answer back	<h3>answer back</h3>〈非正〉顶嘴, 回嘴<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When they scolded him, he would answer back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们骂他, 他就顶嘴。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The child would answer back to all she said.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她说什么这孩子都要回嘴。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When your mother scolds you, you shouldn't answer her back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你妈妈责备你时, 你不应该顶嘴。</font><br>为自己辩护<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He tried to answer back whenever he was criticized.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 每当他挨批评时他都要为自己辩护。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's wrong to accuse him when he's not here and can't answer you back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他现在人不在, 没法反驳你, 你指责他是不对的。</font><br>\n
answer for	<h3>answer for</h3>对…负责; (为…)担保; 因…而受责备<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You must answer for her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你必须对她负责。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can't answer for his honesty.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不能保证他诚实。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All these things are to be answered for.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 所有这一切都是要偿还的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'll answer for it that this man is honest.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我担保这个人诚实可靠。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You will have to answer me for your conduct.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你为你的行为要向我负责。</font><br>符合(…需要)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This tool will answer for our needs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这工具将满足我们的需要。</font><br>充当…, 起…作用<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This box will answer for a chair.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个箱子可以当椅子用。</font><br>许诺, 答应(别人)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Are all the seats answered for?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 所有这些座位都订出去了吗?</font><br>\n

blow out	<h3>blow out</h3>吹出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The chimney blew out a cloud of black smoke.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 烟囱里喷出一团黑烟。</font><br>吹干净<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We shall have to blow the pipe out, it seems to be blocked.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 管子好像堵住了, 我们得把里面吹干净。</font><br>吹熄; 吹灭<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The flame blew out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 火苗吹灭了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't blow out the light.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别把灯吹灭。</font><br>停吹; 停刮<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The storm blew out after three days.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 风暴刮了三天之后停息下来。</font><br>爆裂<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The tire blew out on my way to work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在我开车上班的路上车胎爆裂了。</font><br>炸毁<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bomb blew the windows out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 炸弹炸毁了窗户。</font><br>吹涨<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The boy blew out the paper bag.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 男孩将纸袋吹得鼓了起来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When the paper bag was blown out to its full extent, it burst.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当纸袋吹鼓得不能再鼓时, 它破了。</font><br>烧断<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fuse blew out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 保险丝烧断了。</font><br>\n
blow over	<h3>blow over</h3>停止刮; 停息<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The clouds will soon blow over.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 云即将吹散。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They hoped that the disturbances would soon blow over.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们希望骚动能很快过去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Wait until father's anger blows over and then ask him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 等父亲息怒后再问他。</font><br>被忘掉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The impression is so deep that it can hardly ever blow over.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 印象太深了, 忘也忘不了。</font><br>\n
blowtorch	<h3>blowtorch</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>吹管,喷灯<br>\n
blow up	<h3>blow up</h3>突然开始<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Half way up the mountain a sudden, sharp wind blew up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 走到半山腰, 忽然刮起了暴风。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It may well blow up a storm tonight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今晚很可能下一场暴风雨。</font><br>产生; 出现<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Trouble has blown up at the school.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 学校里开始出现麻烦。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The volcano unexpectedly blew up early in the morning.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 火山一早突然爆发了。</font><br>把…吹旺<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You'll have to blow up the fire to make it burn.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你得把火吹旺让它烧起来。</font><br>(使)爆炸, 将…炸毁, 毁掉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A chemical factory blew up in the North of England.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 英国北部的一座化工厂爆炸了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The terrorists blew up the police station.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 恐怖分子炸毁了警察局。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our house was blown up in an air raid.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在一次空袭中我们的房子被炸掉了。</font><br>(使)失败<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The lawyer's case blew up because he had no proof.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 律师的辩护失败, 因为他没有证据。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We'll soon blow up his plan.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要多久我们就让他的计划告吹。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His reputation has been blown up completely.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他名声扫地。</font><br>发怒, 责骂<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When he heard she was going to quit school, he simply blew up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当他听到她要退学时, 他简直是怒不可遏。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They objected to being blown up for the slightest fault.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们反对因一点点过失就受到申斥。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her boss blew her up for losing the contract.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的老板因为她遗失了合同而把她骂了一顿。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You're sure to be blown up for coming late to work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你一定会因为上班迟到被责骂。</font><br>吹胀, 打气<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't blow the balloon up any further!It'll burst!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别给气球多充气了!它会破的!</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Could you lend me a pump to blow up my bicycle tires?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能借我一个打气筒给自行车轮胎打气吗?</font><br>\n

boil over	<h3>boil over</h3>沸腾溢出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Turn off the gas; the milk is boiling over.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 关掉瓦斯, 牛奶溢出来了。</font><br>到了爆发点<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The small argument boiled over into a serious quarrel.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 小小的争论酿成一场激烈的争吵。</font><br>〈非正〉发怒<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When I said that, he just boiled over.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我说了那句话, 他就发起火来。</font><br>\n

break away	<h3>break away</h3>突然离开; 突然挣脱<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Startled by the sudden whistle of the train, the horse broke away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 火车突然鸣笛, 那匹马受惊脱逃。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The criminal broke away from the young policemen.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那名罪犯从年轻警察手里逃脱了。</font><br>与…决裂; 从…退出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He broke away from all his old friends.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他和老朋友断绝了来往。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I broke away from the association ten years ago.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我10年前就脱离了那个团体。</font><br>改掉; 放弃<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They broke away from conventions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们打破了常规。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Modern music has broken away from 18th century rules.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现代音乐摆脱了18世纪的规则。</font><br>\n
break down	<h3>break down</h3>损坏, 发生故障<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our car broke down and we had to draw it to a garage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的车坏了, 不得不把它拖到修车厂去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her telephone had broken down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的电话故障了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp By then the gate was being broken down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那时候大门快要被砸开了。</font><br>拆散; 分类<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp John broke down the washing machine.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 约翰拆开了洗衣机。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The firemen broke down the wall in order to gain quick access to the building on fire.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 为了很快地进入着火的房子, 消防队员拆了那面墙。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The newly published booklet breaks down into three parts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这本新出版的小册子分成三部分。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let's break down the project into smaller parts in order to deal with them one by one.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们把这个计划分成几个小项逐一进行。</font><br>衰弱下来<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His health has broken down completely.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的身体已完全垮了。</font><br>失败, 破产<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Peace talks have broken down in the Middle East.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 中东和平谈判失败了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our plans have broken down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的计划失败了。</font><br>粉碎, 压倒<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They broke down all opposition.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们镇压了一切反对行动。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police tried to break down the prisoner's opposition.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警察设法制住了那个囚犯的反抗。</font><br>\n

break in	<h3>break in</h3>打断, 插嘴说<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't break in when he is telling the story.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他讲故事的时候别打断他。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Never break in while others are talking.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别人说话的时候你千万不要插嘴。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The loud bell on the clock broke in upon his dreams.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 闹钟大响, 打断了他的梦。</font><br>闯入<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We were watching TV when he broke in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们正在看电视, 他突然闯了进来。</font><br>(使)逐渐适用<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It takes a new secretary one month to break in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新来的秘书要一个月的时间熟悉工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm wearing my new boots around the house to break them in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我穿上我的新靴子在屋里来回走, 以便使靴子逐渐合脚。</font><br>开始工作<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Two hundred more new recruits broke in at the steel plant.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 又有200多名新学徒来到钢铁厂工作。</font><br>\n
breaking point	<h3>breaking point</h3>转换点<br>\n
break into	<h3>break into</h3>闯入, 强行进入, 破门而入<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We had to break into the house as we had lost the key.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 因为我们弄丢了钥匙, 所以不得不破门而入。</font><br>打断, 打扰; 占用<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He became so pensive that she didn't like to break into his thought.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他陷入沉思之中, 她不想打断他的思路。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My aunt's regular visits break into my weekend.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我姑妈的不断来访打扰我度周末。</font><br>突然做<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When I told him the story, he broke into a laugh.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当我把这件事告诉他时, 他突然大笑起来。</font><br>把…分成<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mary broke the chocolate into pieces, one for each person.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 玛丽将巧克力分成小块, 每人一块。</font><br>\n
breakneck	<h3>breakneck</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>要使颈骨折断似的,非常危险的<br>\n
break off	<h3>break off</h3>(使)分离; (使)脱离<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The wing of the plane broke off in midair and the plane crashed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 机翼在空中脱落, 致使飞机坠毁。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He broke off the twig with a snap.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他啪地一声把那根树枝折断了。</font><br>停止; 断交<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He broke off in the middle of his story.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他故事讲到一半就突然不讲了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When she came in, Bob broke off his talk with Jane.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当她进来时, 鲍伯停止了和珍的谈话。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We may break off relations with that country.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们有可能和那个国家断绝关系。</font><br>\n
breakout	<h3>breakout</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>脱逃,越狱,突围<br>\n
break-out	<h3>break-out</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>(常指集体的)越狱<br>\n
break out	<h3>break out</h3>突然发生, 爆发<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Something unexpected always breaks out in this area.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在这一地区总有意想不到的事情发生。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The Second World War broke out in September 1939.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 第二次世界大战爆发于1939年9月。</font><br>向外砸开<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We had to break the door out to escape from the fire.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们不得不把门砸开以逃避火灾。</font><br>\n
break through	<h3>break through</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>v.</i></font><br>突围,突破<br>\n
breakup	<h3>breakup</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>(关系、联盟的)终止, 完结; 解散; 别离; 瓦解; 崩溃<br>分裂; 分散; 分解(成小部分)<br>\n
break up	<h3>break up</h3>结束<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The party breaks up and the neighbors hurry home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 宴会就此结束, 邻居们匆匆地赶回家去。</font><br>(使)破碎, 分解<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The specs fell on the cement floor and broke up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 眼镜掉在水泥地上破掉了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When does the ice break up on the river?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 河里的冰什么时候融化?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The workers will break up the old cars for their parts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 工人要把那些旧车拆掉取零件。</font><br>(使)破裂<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We don't know the reason why they have broken up with each other.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们不知道他们的关系为何破裂。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was money trouble that broke up their marriage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们因钱的问题婚姻才破裂的。</font><br>放假<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We break up next week.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们下周放假。</font><br>(使)散开, (使)解散<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The crowd broke up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 人群散开了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They break up the meeting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们散会了。</font><br>(使)极其焦虑和痛苦<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She broke up at the bad news.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 听到那个不幸的消息使她感到非常痛苦。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The death of his pet cat broke him up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他那只心爱的猫死了, 他为此而悲痛。</font><br>(使)开心, 发笑<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He just broke up when we told him what had happened.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们告诉他发生了什么事情时, 他简直乐坏了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His story broke me up. I couldn't stop laughing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的故事真逗, 我简直笑破了肚皮。</font><br>\n

breathe in	<h3>breathe in</h3>吸气<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We have to breathe in and out so many times a minute.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们每分钟都得呼吸那么多次。</font><br>通过呼吸吸入<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We lifted our heads to breathe in the fresh, clear air.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们抬起头, 吸进新鲜、干净的空气。</font><br>全神贯注地听<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She breathed in every word the professor was saying.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她全神贯注地聆听教授所说的每句话。</font><br>\n
breathe out	<h3>breathe out</h3>呼气, 呼出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The doctor asked me to breathe in, then to breathe out fully.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 医生让我先吸气, 然后全部呼出。</font><br>呼吸时吐出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He breathed out wine fumes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他呼出的气有酒味。</font><br>说出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp On seeing this, he breathed out reproaches.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一看见这就破口大骂。</font><br>\n

Would you like to try some?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我酿了一些啤酒, 你愿意尝一点吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let's brew up some more tea.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 咱们沏些茶吧。</font><br>酿成, 逐渐出现<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was obvious that a big storm was brewing up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 很显然, 一场暴风雨正在酝酿中。</font><br>\n

bring about	<h3>bring about</h3>使(船)掉转船头<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The old helmsman brought us about and we avoided a dangerous dash against the rocks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老舵手掉转了船的航向, 我们才避免了一次撞击礁石的危险。</font><br>造成, 引起〔导致〕(某事)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Gambling had brought about his ruin.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 赌博终于毁了他。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Major changes will have to be brought about in British industry.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 英国工业必须实行重大改革。</font><br>\n
bring along	<h3>bring along</h3>领来〔带来〕…<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Why don't you bring your brother along?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你为什么不把你弟弟带来?</font><br>使发展〔成长〕<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This warm weather should bring the crops along.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这样暖和的天气会有利于农作物的生长。</font><br>\n

bring around	<h3>bring around</h3>把(某人或某物)带到约好的地点<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Bring the new members around to the meeting tonight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今晚开会把新会员带来。</font><br>劝说(某人)改变主意〔意见〕; 说服(某人)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My explanation brought them around.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的解释使他们信服了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'll try to bring him around to your views.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我会努力劝说他同意你的观点。</font><br>使恢复知觉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Several girls fainted in the heat but the doctor soon brought them around.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 几个女孩在高温中昏倒, 但医生很快使她们苏醒过来。</font><br>\n
bring back	<h3>bring back</h3>带回(某人或某物); 还回(某物)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp On your way home from your aunt's, will you bring some coffee back?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你从姑母家回来时, 买点儿咖啡带回来好吗?</font><br>回忆〔回顾, 回想起〕(往事)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Seeing you brought back many fond memories.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 见到你使我想起了许多美好的往事。</font><br>使(某人)恢复(某状态)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We must bring him back to health.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们必须使他恢复健康。</font><br>\n
bring down	<h3>bring down</h3>把(某物, 某人)抬下(楼、山)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mother wants to come downstairs, but is too weak to walk; it'll take both of you to bring her down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 母亲要下楼, 但她太虚弱了走不动, 这得你们俩把她抬下来。</font><br>使(某物或某人)掉下〔倒下〕<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In American football, you have to try to bring down your opponent.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在美式橄榄球赛中, 你必须设法把对手弄倒在地。</font><br>击败…<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp At the next vote, we must try to bring down the government.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 下次选举时, 我们一定设法击败政府。</font><br>降(价)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A nationwide good harvest soon brought down the price of rice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 全国性的大丰收很快使米价回跌了。</font><br>\n
bring forward	<h3>bring forward</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>v.</i></font><br>提出,提前,显示<br>\n
bring in	<h3>bring in</h3>把…拿进来, 带进来<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Bring him in with you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你把他带进来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The policeman brought in two boys whom he had caught stealing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警察把两个当场抓获的小偷带到警察局。</font><br>收获(庄稼等)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The farmers are bringing the apples in early this year because of the warm weather.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 由于今年气候暖和, 农夫们正提前摘苹果。</font><br>赚(钱), 挣(钱)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sale brought in ￡250.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这次拍卖获得250英镑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The boys are bringing in good wages every week.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些男孩每周的工资不低。</font><br>\n
bring off	<h3>bring off</h3>使脱离险境<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The lifeboat brought off most of the shipwrecked sailors.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 救生艇载走了遇难船上的大部分水手。</font><br>成功完成<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jim's plan seemed hopeless, but he brought it off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 吉姆的计划看起来没希望实现, 但是他成功了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He brought off the event.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他完成了这件大事。</font><br>\n
bring on	<h3>bring on</h3>呈现…; 使出现<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The waiter brought on the next dish.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 侍者端上了下一道菜。</font><br>使发作<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sudden cold weather brought on his fever again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 因天气骤冷, 他发起烧来。</font><br>使发展, 进步<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This warm weather should bring on the crops.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 暖和的天气会促使农作物生长。</font><br>\n
bring out	<h3>bring out</h3>取出(某物)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Suddenly the man brought a gun out and threatened the driver with it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那男子突然掏出手枪威胁司机。</font><br>把…从室内搬出来, 带出来<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's warm enough to bring out the garden chairs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 天气很暖和, 可以把花园用的椅子搬出来了。</font><br>呈出(某物); 使(某物)显现出来<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jane never brings out her best dishes even when guests arrive.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 即使客人来了, 珍也从来不把最好的盘子拿出来。</font><br>使清楚; 使明显<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The new dress brought out her hidden beauty.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那件新衣服把她潜在的美展现出来了。</font><br>出版, 生产(某物)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tom has brought out another new book.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汤姆又出版了一本新书。</font><br>说出…<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was so shocked that she could hardly bring out a word.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她十分震惊, 几乎连一句话也说不出来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Fred brought out casually, “I saw Mrs. Fortescue going off to work when I came out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ” 弗雷德漫不经心地说“我出来时看见福特斯库太太正要去上班”。</font><br>\n
bring round	<h3>bring round</h3>把(某人或某物)带到约好的地点<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Bring the new members round to the meeting tonight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今晚开会把新会员带来。</font><br>劝说(某人)改变主意〔意见〕; 说服(某人)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My explanation brought them round.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的解释使他们信服了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'll try to bring him round to your views.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我会努力劝说他同意你的观点。</font><br>使恢复知觉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Several girls fainted in the heat but the doctor soon brought them round.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 几个女孩在高温中昏倒, 但医生很快使她们苏醒过来。</font><br>\n
bring to	<h3>bring to</h3>使(某人)苏醒<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Peter has fainted; try to bring him to.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 彼得晕过去了, 要设法让他醒过来。</font><br>〈航〉(使)停驶<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp As the wind dropped, the boat brought to.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 风止住了, 船停了下来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The captain was able to bring the ship to just before it hit the little boat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 就在即将撞上那艘小船的一刹那间, 船长停住了船。</font><br>把…带给(某人), 带往(某处)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Last night's storm brought several trees to the ground.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 昨夜的暴风雨刮倒了几棵树。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was brought to my home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她是被人带到我家来的。</font><br>使用于…; 使加入, 参与…<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How much experience does he bring this specialized work to?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他有多少经验从事于这项专案呢?</font><br>使达到…<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This last thing will bring the bill to over ￡500.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这最后一件东西使得账单上的金额超过了500英镑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The university's money troubles have been brought to the boil by the recent government cuts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 最近政府削减开支使这所大学的财务到了罗掘俱穷的地步。</font><br>使(某人)面临〔对付〕某种困难<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp But what has brought the company to such a pity condition since I last worked for it?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 自从我最后一次为该公司工作以来, 什么原因使得公司落到这般可怜的境地?</font><br>\n
bring up	<h3>bring up</h3>把…带到楼上〔更高处〕<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When the doctor arrives, bring him up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 医生来时, 带他到楼上。</font><br>教育, 养育(孩子)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My aunt brought up four children.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我姑姑养了四个孩子。</font><br>提及〔提出〕…<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mr. Chairman, I should like to bring up the question of the reorganization of the committee.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 主席先生, 我想提出改组委员会的问题。</font><br>恶心; 呕吐(食物)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The greedy child brought up all he had eaten.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个贪吃的孩子把吃下去的东西全部吐了出来。</font><br>使突然停住<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He brought the car up short when the light changed to red.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 红灯一亮, 他突然把车停住。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The horse is running away. Can't you bring him up?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 马跑开了, 你勒不住吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp John was about to enter the room when he was brought up by a note on the door.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 约翰刚要迈进房间, 突然看见门上的纸条, 立刻止住了脚步。</font><br>\n

call back	<h3>call back</h3>回喊<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The man called from the other side of the river, and his friend called back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个男的隔着河喊他的朋友, 他的朋友也回喊。</font><br>叫(某人)回来〔去〕<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Call the girl back; she's left her book behind.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把女孩叫回来, 她忘记把书带走了。</font><br>回电话<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'll call back after dinner.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我晚饭后给你回个电话。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Would you ask her to call me back?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 能否请你让她给我回个电话?</font><br>重访(某个地方)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The salesman will call back at any house he missed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个推销员将重访他所错过的每所房子。</font><br>使恢复<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This medicine should call your strength back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种药能使你恢复精力。</font><br>记起(某事)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I cannot call his face back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我记不起他的相貌了。</font><br>\n

call off	<h3>call off</h3>把…叫走<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I called off my dog when he came.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他来时我把狗叫走了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was twice called off from my work today to answer the phone.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今天我两次丢下工作去接电话。</font><br>取消; 停止<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He phoned me and called the appointment off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他给我打电话取消了这次约会。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was decided to call off the search when there was no hope of finding the missing child alive.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在没有希望找到那名失踪的孩子生还时, 决定停止搜寻。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The engagement has been called off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 婚约取消了。</font><br>转移(某人的注意力等)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't let anything call off your attention from your studies.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要让别的事转移你学习的注意力。</font><br>点名, 逐一念出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The teacher began to call off the names on his list.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老师开始按名单点名。</font><br>\n

carry on	<h3>carry on</h3>经营, 从事, 忙于<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please carry on!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请继续下去!</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please carry on as usual while I am away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不在时, 请照常干活。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That family has carried on a hardware business for five generations.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那家已经经营五金生意五代了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He carried on a bookstore in the town.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在城里开了一家书店。</font><br>〈非正〉继续进行<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We must try to carry on as if nothing had happened.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们必须继续下去, 只当作什么都没有发生过。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Carry on with your work while I'm out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我出去一下, 你接着做吧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We've carried on a correspondence for years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 多年来我们一直保持通讯联系。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The conversation was carried on in a cordial and friendly atmosphere.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 会谈是在亲切友好的气氛中进行的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We must carry on hoping for the best.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们必须继续抱最好的希望。</font><br>\n

catch on	<h3>catch on</h3>变得流行<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The new song caught on really quickly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这首新歌真的流行得很快。</font><br>〈非正〉理解<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Would you mind repeating that? I didn't quite catch on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请再说一遍好吗?我没听懂。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Being a foreigner, he did not catch on the joke.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是个外国人, 未能理解这个笑话的含意。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It took me a long time to catch on to the directions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我花了很久才弄明白说明书的意思。</font><br>\n
catch out	<h3>catch out</h3>恰遇某人不在<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was here all morning, but you've just caught him out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 整个上午他都在, 刚好你来时他出去了。</font><br>将…难住<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He caught me out just now with a question on English grammar.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他刚才问了我一个英语语法方面的问题, 可把我难住了。</font><br>〈非正〉揭露<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm sure the prisoner is not telling the truth; talk to him and see if you can catch him out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我能肯定那个囚犯在撒谎, 跟他谈谈, 看看能否设法揭穿他的假话。</font><br>使怀孕<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After two years of married life, she was caught out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 结婚两年后, 她怀孕了。</font><br>\n

catch up	<h3>catch up</h3>突然而迅速地抓住<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He caught up the ball as it rolled along and threw it back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一把抱起滚过来的球, 把它扔了回去。</font><br>吹起, 卷起<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The leaves were caught up by a sudden gust of wind.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 突然一阵风把树叶吹起。</font><br>追上, 赶上<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You just go ahead and I'll catch up later.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你先走一步, 我随后赶来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You go on ahead; I'll catch you up in a few minutes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你继续向前走, 过几分钟我会赶上你的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was a ten-mile chase before the thieves were caught up by the police car.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 过了10英里路, 警察的车子才赶上盗窃犯。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Prices will fall as soon as production catches up to demand.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一旦生产赶上了需求, 物价就会下跌。</font><br>卷起来并保持下去<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She caught up her hair.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把头发卷了起来。</font><br>打断<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We mustn't catch the speaker up by so many questions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们不该用这么多问题来打断发言人。</font><br>把…缠住; 把…迷住<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Revolutionary zeal caught them up, and they joined the army.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 革命热情激励他们, 于是他们从军了。</font><br>\n

clean out	<h3>clean out</h3>把(某物)腾空, 清除<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I've asked the children to clean out their drawers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我已经让孩子们把他们的抽屉弄整齐。</font><br>打扫<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He cleaned out his room.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他打扫了房间。</font><br>肃清<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The manager cleaned out inefficient personnel.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 经理把效率低的员工精简掉了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They cleaned him out of the organization.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们把他从该机构中除名了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Inefficient personnel were cleaned out of the management.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 管理人员中办事效率不高的被清除了出去。</font><br>〈非正〉使…失去钱财; 使…耗尽资源<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We played cards and he cleaned me out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们玩了纸牌, 他把我的钱全赢去了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm cleaned out after last night's heavy spending.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 昨晚大手大脚地花钱, 弄得我现在囊空如洗。</font><br>离开<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The thieves took the jewels and then cleaned out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那些贼拿了首饰, 匆匆而去。</font><br>\n

close down	<h3>close down</h3>(使)停业, (使)停产<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Because of the continued loss, the factory closed down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 由于连续亏损, 工厂关闭了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government closed down the newspaper.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府封闭了报馆。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Several research institutions were closed down for lack of fund.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 由于缺乏资金, 好几家研究机构被迫关门了。</font><br>(广播电台或电视台)结束当日广播<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Television closed down for the night after eleven o'clock.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 晚上11点过后, 电视台停止播放节目。</font><br>逼近, 降临<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The ship was closing down on the harbor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那艘船正接近港口。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Darkness closed down on the city.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 黑夜降临于该城。</font><br>\n

come about	<h3>come about</h3>发生<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The flood came about as a result of the heavy spring rains.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 春季的大雨造成了洪水泛滥。</font><br>改变方向<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The ship came about and headed for safety.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 船改变了航向向安全地带驶去。</font><br>\n
come across	<h3>come across</h3>过来; 过访<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Why don't you come across to our house this evening?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今晚你何不到我们家来坐坐?</font><br>被理解; 接受<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He spoke for a long time but his meaning did not come across.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他讲了很久, 但没把意思讲明白。</font><br>吐露, 说出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don't think he'll ever come across with all the information.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想他是不会吐露全部情况的。</font><br>偿还…; 被迫把…交出来<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The robber told the woman to come across with her purse.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 拦路抢劫者勒令那个女人把钱包交出来。</font><br>穿过, 越过<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Be careful when you come across the street.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 过马路要小心。</font><br>偶然发现, 偶然遇见<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I came across him in the street yesterday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 昨天我在街上无意中碰到了他。</font><br>出现在脑海中, 留下印象<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A good idea came across my mind.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我忽然想到一个好主意。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The papers were stored away in a secret place, and there they will probably remain until they are come across by someone who realized their importance.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 文件被藏在一个秘密地方, 在没有了解它的价值的人发现以前, 它大概会一直放在那里。</font><br>\n
come along	<h3>come along</h3>出现, 发生<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He came along with some friends.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他和几个朋友一同来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These troubles came along all at the same time that I was at a loss.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些麻烦突然一起发生, 使我不知所措。</font><br>取得进展<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I began to come along well in English after I improved my study methods.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 改进了学习方法以后, 我的英语开始有所进步。</font><br>赶快; 更努力<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Come along or we'll miss the train.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 快点, 不然就会赶不上火车。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Come along, someone must want to know my invention.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 再努力想想看, 肯定会有人对我的发明感兴趣。</font><br>\n
come around	<h3>come around</h3>调转方向<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The wind has come around to the north.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 风向已转向北。</font><br>绕道而行<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We had to come around by the wheat fields.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们不得不绕着麦田而过。</font><br>开始接受; 理解<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I think he'll come around eventually.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我认为他最终会回心转意的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't expect too much of me.I need time to come around to this new idea.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要对我期望太高。我需要时间接受这一新思想。</font><br>周而复始; 重新来到<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Late duty for each member of the staff comes around every ten days.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 工作人员值晚班每十天轮流一次。</font><br>苏醒, 恢复知觉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He got faint, but soon came around.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他昏死过去, 但不久就苏醒了。</font><br>息怒, 消气<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's very angry now; wait till he comes around.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他现在正在气头上, 等他气消了再说吧。</font><br>造访, 过访<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Why don't you come around and see us one evening?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你何不找个晚上过来看看我们?</font><br>\n
come at	<h3>come at</h3>袭击, 威胁<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't come at me, I did nothing that day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别冲我来, 我那天什么也没做。</font><br>找到, 得到, 弄明白<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After much discussion we came at a conclusion satisfactory to all.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 经过充分讨论, 我们得出了大家都很满意的结论。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was a long time before we came at the truth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 过了很久我们才弄清事实。</font><br>\n
come back	<h3>come back</h3>回来<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm going away and I may never come back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我要走了, 可能永远不再回来。</font><br>记起, 回忆起<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Gradually, the fragments of her childhood came back to her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 渐渐地, 她回忆起了童年生活的一些片断。</font><br>强烈反驳<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “But you're just as guilty!”Jane came back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “可你同样有罪!”珍反驳道。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He came back at the judge with some sharp questions.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他提出了几个尖锐的问题来反驳法官。</font><br>〈非正〉重复说<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I didn't hear you. Could you come back?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我没听见你说的什么, 你能重复一遍吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'll come back to that point later.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我回过头来还要再谈这点。</font><br>\n
come between	<h3>come between</h3>离间, 使分开<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't let a little thing like that come between you two.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要让这样的小事使你们两人产生隔阂。</font><br>妨碍<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The true artist lets nothing come between himself and his work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 真正的艺术家是不容任何事情妨碍他的工作的。</font><br>\n
come by	<h3>come by</h3>经过, 从旁边走过<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Just then a bus came by so we got on and rode home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 正好那时来了一辆公车, 我们就坐上车回家了。</font><br>〈美〉来串门, 来访<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Why don't you come by some afternoon and have coffee with me?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 为什么不在哪天下午来我这儿和我一起喝咖啡?</font><br>得到, 获得<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He came by the data from various sources.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些资料他是从不同地方找到的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Money that is easily come by is often easily spent.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 钱来得容易往往也花得容易。</font><br>\n

count in	<h3>count in</h3>〈非正〉把…算在某一整体之内<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please count me in on this project.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请把我也算作这项计划的参加者。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When the city declares its population numbers, does it count in farmers in outer areas?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个城市公布人口数字时, 是否把郊区的农民也包括在内?</font><br>算上(某人)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you're having a party, count me in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果你们举行聚会的话, 算我一个。</font><br>\n

count on	<h3>count on</h3>依赖, 依靠<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If there's anything I can do, count on me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果有我能做的事, 找我好了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They counted on foreign investment to stimulate their economy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们想依靠外国投资来刺激他们的经济。</font><br>期望, 指望<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm counting on you to persuade her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我指望你能说服她。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I know of at least two people who can be counted on to support us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我知道至少有两个人可以指望会支持我们。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I had counted on having it completed by March.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我曾指望在三月份以前完成这件事情。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We can't count on him telling the truth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们不能指望他说实话。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We can count on the weather being fine.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们可以指望天气好转。</font><br>\n
count out	<h3>count out</h3>〈非正〉逐一数出, 大声数<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The little girl could only remember her numbers by counting out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个小女孩只有大声数数, 才能记得住数字。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She counted out fifteen pence and passed it to the salesgirl.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她数出15个便士交给女店员。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is no need to tell the kids that the number of stars cannot be counted out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 没必要告诉孩子们星星是数不清的。</font><br>〈非正〉不把…考虑在内<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can't join you; you'll have to count me out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不能来, 别把我算在内。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Those who have not yet sent in applications should be counted out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那些还没有申请的人不应算在内。</font><br>\n

curl up	<h3>curl up</h3>(使)卷, 弯曲<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The dying leaves became brown and curled up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 快死的叶子发黄而拳曲。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The boy curled himself up in the big soft armchair with a book.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个孩子在又大又软的安乐椅中蜷着身子, 手里拿着一本书。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The snake was curled up in the long grass.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在深草中, 这条蛇盘着身子。</font><br>缭绕升起<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In the still air, smoke could be seen curling up from the chimney.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在无风的天气里, 可以看到烟从烟囱中缭绕升起。</font><br>(使)身体上〔精神上〕垮掉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When his business failed, the owner just curled up and died.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那店主经营失败, 心力交瘁而死。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fighter's well-aimed blow curled his opponent up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那位拳击手看准目标, 一拳把对手打垮了。</font><br>〈非正〉笑得不能自制<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mary just curled up when Jim walked in wearing his funny clothes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当吉姆穿着滑稽的衣服走进来时, 玛丽笑得前仰后合。</font><br>(使)厌恶, (使)感到恶心<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I just curled up when I saw the colors he had chosen.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 看到他选择的颜色, 我真感到恶心。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What he said really curls me up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的话真叫我恶心。</font><br>\n

cut across	<h3>cut across</h3>抄近路穿过<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He cut across the fields so as not to be late.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 为了不迟到, 他抄近路穿过田地。</font><br>遮断, 打断<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The wall cuts across our line of vision.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那面墙挡住了我们的视线。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her loud voice cut across the conversation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她大嚷大叫, 打断了这次谈话。</font><br>与…相抵触<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His ideas cut across mine on the subject.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在这个问题上他的想法和我的不一致。</font><br>\n

cut-back	<h3>cut-back</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>减少;计划中的削减;缩减;中止(契约)<br>\n
cut back	<h3>cut back</h3>剪〔裁, 缩〕短<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The gardener cut back all the bushes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 园工把所有的灌木丛都剪短了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The Americans cut back the word “catalogue” and it became “catalog”.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 美国人把catalogue这个词加以缩短, 成了catalog。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This kind of word has been cut back to save space.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这类词被缩短了, 以便节省篇幅。</font><br>减少, 削减<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We must cut back our expenses.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们必须削减开支。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We must cut back on expenditure in order to remain solvent.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们应减少开支, 以备急用。</font><br>急转方向; 迅速返回<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We cut back into the pinewoods and hid there till it was dark.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们急忙返回松林躲起来直到天黑。</font><br>追述, 倒叙<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The script cuts back to the old hero's childhood.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 剧本倒叙了老英雄的童年。</font><br>\n
cut down	<h3>cut down</h3>把…砍倒〔割掉〕<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He cut the tree down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他砍倒了这棵树。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She cut the grass down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把草割掉。</font><br>裁短, 改小<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My sister cut father's coat down to fit me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的姐姐按我的身材把父亲的上衣裁短了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is cutting down her dress for her younger sister.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她正把自己的衣服改小, 准备给妹妹穿。</font><br>减少, 降低<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We were for cutting down the cost of production.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们赞成降低成本。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You must cut down on sugar to lose weight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你必须少吃糖以减轻体重。</font><br>〈非正〉驳倒, 使逊色, 击败<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was so eloquent that he cut down the finest orator.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他能言善辩, 胜过最好的演说家。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Your arguments are too easy to be cut down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你的论点一驳即倒。</font><br>砍〔杀〕死, 伤害<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He cut down the snake.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他砍死了那条蛇。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The soldier was cut down in his youth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这名士兵年纪轻轻就被杀害了。</font><br>\n

cut in	<h3>cut in</h3>插嘴, 打断<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't cut in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要插嘴。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was enjoying the dance until that rude man cut in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我正跳得高兴, 却被那鲁莽的男人打断了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He cut in on our conversation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在我们谈话中插嘴。</font><br>突然插到…前面<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He cut in at the head of the line.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他插队进入队伍前面。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You merely caused a crash by cutting in on me like that!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你那样超我的车, 差一点就撞车了!</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was stopped when he tried to cut in on the queue.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他试图超车的时候被人拦住了。</font><br>干预<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I think I ought to cut in on what they are doing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想我应该对他们所做的事情进行干预。</font><br>允许加入<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you cut me in?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 能让我参加吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I would like to be cut in on this project.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我愿意加入这个项目。</font><br>\n

cut off	<h3>cut off</h3>剪〔切, 砍〕下<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Kehr cut off some flowers from the bush.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 凯尔从树丛中剪下一些花。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The rebels cut off the heads of their captives.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 叛乱者砍掉了俘虏的脑袋。</font><br>切〔隔〕断, 阻碍<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our troops cut off the enemy's retreat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的军队切断了敌人的退路。</font><br>迅速离开<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He cut off down a side street.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他从一条侧道跑掉。</font><br>(疾病等)使(人)死亡<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Disease cut Brooks off in the best part of life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 疾病结束了布鲁克斯盛年的生命。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was cut off when he was still young.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他死时年岁不大。</font><br>不留遗产<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jim's uncle cut him off without a penny.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 吉姆的叔叔没有留给他一文钱。</font><br>\n

cut out	<h3>cut out</h3>剪下, 切去<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He cut out the picture from the newspaper.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他从报上剪下这张图片。</font><br>裁剪; 劈开<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She cut out a new dress.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她裁剪了一件新连衣裙。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They cut out a path through the jungle.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们在密林中开出了一条小路。</font><br>停止, 戒除, 放弃<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The radio cut out suddenly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 收音机突然停了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In view of the feeble health of the member, the delegation cut him out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 鉴于这位成员身体虚弱, 代表团就不让他随行了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The doctor said I must cut overwork out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 医生说我必须停止过度劳累。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has decided to cut out smoking and drinking.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他已决心戒烟、戒酒。</font><br>删掉, 省掉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can cut out what you like.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你可以随意删减。</font><br>取代, 击败<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp With her speed and agility, Cage cut out all her competitors in the hurdle race.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 凯奇在跨栏赛跑中速度快、动作敏捷, 击败了所有其他选手。</font><br>适合于, 天生是做…的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is cut out for a football player.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他天生是个当足球运动员的料子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We soon realized that she was cut out to be a teacher.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们不久就了解到她适合当教师。</font><br>\n

deal with	<h3>deal with</h3>惠顾; 与…交易, 和…做买卖<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We have dealt with that firm for many years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们与那家公司有多年的生意往来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They often dealt with that shop.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们常到那家商店买东西。</font><br>应付, 处理; 对待<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He must deal with many difficulties.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他必须应付许多困难。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We should deal with every case on its merits.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们处理各种情况都应根据其本身的条件。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Be careful. She is very difficult to deal with.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 可得当心, 她很难对付。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Deal with a man as he deals with you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 以其人之道, 还治其人之身。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There are many difficulties to be dealt with when starting a new business.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 开展一项新业务时, 有许多困难需要解决。</font><br>论述, 涉及<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This book deals with life in the United States.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这本书谈的是美国的生活情况。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The subject isn't very well dealt with in this book.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这本书里这问题讲得不太好。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Here the subject may be dealt with under four headings.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个题目可以分四点来谈。</font><br>\n

decide on	<h3>decide on</h3>就…做出决定, 决定要<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Peter decided on a blue sweater.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 彼得选定了一件蓝色的运动衫。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp OK, I have decided on buying the jacket.How much is it?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 好吧, 我已经决定买这件夹克衫了。多少钱?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has decided on where to go.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他已经决定去哪儿。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Have you decided on where you'll spend your holidays?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你是否已经决定到什么地方去度假?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The second course was decided on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 决定采取第二个办法。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When I was 17, I opened an inviting letter that decided me on my choice of colleges.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我17岁时接到一封邀请函, 这封信对我选择什么样的大学起了决定性作用。</font><br>\n

divorce	<h3>divorce</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>离婚<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Divorce is on the increase.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 离婚不断增多。</font><br>分离<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp None of us like the divorce of word and deed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们都不喜欢言行不一。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>与…离婚<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She divorced him after years of unhappiness.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 经过多年的不愉快, 她跟他离婚了。</font><br>分离<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In sports, exercise and play are not divorced.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在运动中, 练习和比赛是分不开的。</font><br>\n

do	<h3>do</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>aux.v.</i></font><br>(构成疑问句和否定句)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do you know him?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你认识他吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I didn't think.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我没有想过。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Telling lies does not pay.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 撒谎不值得。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What (did) he tell you?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他告诉了你什么事?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (Do you ) like it?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (你)喜欢它吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Why (does she) not buy one?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (她)为什么不买一个?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Does she have a bike?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她有自行车吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Sorry, I don't have any whisky.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 对不起, 我没有威士忌。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do you have time for a drink?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你有空喝一杯吗?</font><br>(代替动词)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I knew he would help us, and he did.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我知道他会帮助我们的, 他确实这样做了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He got there earlier than we did.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他到得比我们早。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “Does he know I'm here?”“Yes, he does.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ”“他知道我在这儿吗?”“是的，他知道。”</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “Does he come every day?”“He does (so).</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp ”“他每天都来吗?”“他每天都来。”</font><br>(用于加强语气)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I never did like her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的确从来没有喜欢过她。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Only then did he realize that he had been wrong.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 直到这时他才知道他错了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I do think so.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的确是这样想的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I did come.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的确来过。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please do be quiet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 务请肃静。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do wait for me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 务必请等我。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do be honest.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一定要诚实。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do be on time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一定要准时。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>做, 干, 从事<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You've done very well.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你做得很好。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When in Rome do as the Romans do.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 入乡随俗。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp None of us care whether they do right or wrong, good or harm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们中没有人关心他们做的是对还是错, 是好还是坏。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He does nothing but eat and drink.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他除了吃喝之外, 什么也不做。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You've done a good job.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你做得挺不错。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Will you do me a favour?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你帮我一下忙好吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp John has done a good turn to me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 约翰为我做了一件好事。</font><br>学习, 研究<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is doing very well at school.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在学校学习很好。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She does her lessons well.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她学习很好。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>整理; 使整洁<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is doing the room.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她正在整理房间。</font><br>烹调, 烧, 煮<br>算出, 解答<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm quite sure they were doing the same problem.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我敢肯定他们解决的是同一问题。</font><br>行过, 走过, 游览<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We did the journey in six hours.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们在六小时之内走完了这段旅程。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I did the travel.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我旅行去了。</font><br>引起, 产生<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Hard work does wonders.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 努力工作会取得惊人的成就。</font><br>适合, 可用, 方便<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This room will do me quite well.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个房间对我很合适。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Will this spanner do you?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个扳手你用着行吗?</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>行, 足够<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That will do!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 行了, 够了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This small one will do.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个小的就行了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It would never do to neglect official obligations.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 玩忽职守是绝对不行的。</font><br>生长<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Vegetables do well here.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这里蔬菜长势好。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fruit trees are all doing well.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 果树长得不错。</font><br>\n

do for	<h3>do for</h3>对…有效, 适合<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This place would do for a workshop.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个地方适合作车间。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This box will do for a chair.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个箱子可以当椅子用。</font><br>照料, 照应, 帮助<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mrs. Smith has done for her by a neighbor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 史密斯夫人生病期间由一位邻居照顾她。</font><br>毁掉, 完蛋, 累坏<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He received a savage blow on the head; that did for him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他头上遭到一记猛击, 就完蛋了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The severe storm did for most of the crops.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 猛烈的暴风雨毁掉了大部分庄稼。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Once he is unemployed, he is done for.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一旦失业就完蛋了。</font><br>\n

drag in	<h3>drag in</h3>将…拖〔拉〕进去<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children are so busy playing that they don't want their dinner; you'll have to drag them in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们正忙于玩耍, 连饭都不想吃了, 你不得不把他们拖回家去。</font><br>牵强附会把…扯进去<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The issue is quite complicated enough, without dragging in the argument about the effects on wildlife.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要对野生动物可能产生的影响硬扯到这个辩论中去, 这个问题已经是很复杂了。</font><br>\n

I have to draw in my expenditure.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我缺钱, 得节省开支。</font><br>\n

draw off	<h3>draw off</h3>排出, 抽出(某物), 拉走(某人)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I drew off three pints of beer from the barrel.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我从酒桶里抽出三品脱啤酒。</font><br>(使)撤离, (使)后退<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The enemies' losses forced them to draw off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 敌军的伤亡迫使他们撤退。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We have orders to draw off our forces.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们已接到命令撤走军队。</font><br>使转移掉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A sudden shout drew the policeman's attention off, and the prisoner escaped.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 突如其来的一声呼喊转移了警察的注意力, 犯人趁机逃跑了。</font><br>\n
draw on	<h3>draw on</h3>穿上, 戴上<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The man drew on his trousers hurriedly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那人匆匆穿上裤子。</font><br>渐渐来临<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Winter is drawing on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 冬天渐渐来临了。</font><br>鼓励, 鼓动(某人)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her refusal only drew her lover on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的拒绝只能促使其恋人继续追求她。</font><br>\n
draw out	<h3>draw out</h3>掏出, 取出, 拔出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He drew out his notebook and began to take notes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他掏出笔记本开始记笔记。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I drew out my savings before the summer holidays began.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 暑假开始之前, 我取出存款。</font><br>拉长<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Draw out the wire until it is very thin.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把这条金属线拉得很细才行。</font><br>拖延<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The politician drew out his speech to almost two hours.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这位政治家拉拉杂杂讲了近两个小时。</font><br>(白昼)变长<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The days begin to draw out after the winter solstice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 冬至以后, 白天渐渐变长。</font><br>(使)离开<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The train drew out of the station.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 火车缓缓开出车站。</font><br>提供大意<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The committee drew out a plan for the reorganization, without showing any details.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 委员会只提供了改组计划的大意, 没有细加说明。</font><br>诱发, 引出, 暴露(某事物)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The teacher helped to draw out the meaning of the poem.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老师帮学生解出了这首诗的含意。</font><br>鼓励<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She's very shy but he managed to draw her out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她很怕羞, 但他还是鼓励她开口说话。</font><br>通过谈话了解到<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was able to draw his story out of him by patient questioning.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 经过耐心的询问, 我才了解到他的经历。</font><br>从银行提(款)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I shall have to draw out some more money to pay all these people.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不得不再多取些钱给所有这些人发工资。</font><br>\n

drop out	<h3>drop out</h3>离开, 退出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He says he has dropped out, and won't attend college any more.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他说他退了学, 以后也不会去上大学了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They have dropped out of society.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们已经退出社交圈。</font><br>掉出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The window was open, and the pot just dropped out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 窗户开着, 花盆就掉了出去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The teapot dropped out of her hand.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 茶壶从她手中掉了下来。</font><br>\n

dry out	<h3>dry out</h3>(使)变干, (使)干涸<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The steamed bread has dried out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这馒头干硬了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Will this flooded ground ever dry out?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这次洪水淹过的地还会干吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sun dried out the ground.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 阳光把地面完全晒干了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She hung up her wet clothes in order to dry them out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把她的湿衣服挂起来, 以便晾干。</font><br>〈非正〉(使)戒(酒、毒等)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's not easy for him to dry out since he has a lot of drug-addict friends.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的毒瘾不易戒掉, 因为他有很多朋友都是有毒瘾的人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Peter's friends do all they can to dry him out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 彼得的朋友们竭力使他戒酒。</font><br>\n

dry up	<h3>dry up</h3>(使…)干涸<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The ground dried up quickly after the rain.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 雨后地很快就干了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The long drought dried up all the wells.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 长期的干旱使所有的井都干涸了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The hot sun is drying the ground up, and the crops can't grow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 烈日烤焦了大地, 庄稼无法生长。</font><br>枯竭; 用光, 耗尽<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We have no milk to sell; the cows have dried up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 奶牛没奶了; 我们没有牛奶可卖。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our sources of information have dried up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的信息来源枯竭了。</font><br>〈英〉擦干碗碟<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Help me dry up after lunch.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 午饭后, 请帮助我擦干碗碟。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Dry up the dishes!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把碟子擦干!</font><br>〈非正〉住口<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I wish the conversation will dry up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我希望谈话不要再继续下去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A funny answer might dry her up for a short time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一个滑稽可笑的回答会使她短时间内说不下去。</font><br>\n

end up	<h3>end up</h3>〈非正〉(以…)结束; 最终成为〔变得〕<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How does the story end up?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这篇故事是怎么结尾的?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The boy's ball ended up on the garage roof.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这男孩的球落到了汽车库顶上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If he had really pulled the trigger, I would have ended up then and there.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果他真的扣动了扳机的话, 我早就被当场打死了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you don't work hard, you'll end up nowhere.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如不努力工作, 你就一事无成。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He finally ended up his speech.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 最后他结束了自己的讲话。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He ended up as head of the firm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他最后成了公司的负责人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Most of the white liquid running out of these trees ends up as rubber tires.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 从这些树上流出来的大部分白色液体最后都变成了橡胶轮胎。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The hooligan ended up dead in a car accident.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个恶棍最后在一次车祸中丧命。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you don't eat less, you'll end up looking like a whale!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果你不少吃些, 你最终会使自己看起来像一条鲸鱼!</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They all ended up puzzled.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 最终他们都感到迷惑不解。</font><br>\n
