fall behind	<h3>fall behind</h3>落后; 下降; 退后<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He fell behind when we were climbing the mountain.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们爬山时, 他掉队了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Production has fallen behind in the last few months.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 最近几个月生产下降了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't fall behind now, just when you're doing so well.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你干得很出色, 这个时候可别后退。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Several of the runners fell behind in the race.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有几个赛跑者在比赛中落在后面了。</font><br>逾期(付款等)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If your payments of rent fall behind, you will be asked to leave.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果你不如期交房租, 你就会被撵走。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't fall behind with your gas bill.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要拖欠煤气费。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has fallen behind with his correspondences.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他有一些信件没有及时回复。</font><br>处于较低水平<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The work of this class has been falling behind recently.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 近来这个班的成绩一直处于较低水平。</font><br>\n

fight back	<h3>fight back</h3>抵抗, 反击<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They fought back heroically.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们英勇反击。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If he hit you, why didn't you fight back?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果他打了你, 你为何不还手呢?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The aggressors were fiercely fought back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 侵略者遭到猛烈的抵抗。</font><br>强忍住<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was difficult for her to fight back her tears.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她很难忍住不流泪。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her tears were fought back on such an occasion.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在这种场合下她忍住了眼泪。</font><br>恢复<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Everything seemed to be against me, but I fought back to my old position of strength.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那时一切事情看起来都对我不利, 然而我努力恢复力量反击。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She fought her way back to health so quickly after the accident that she was soon back at school.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 车祸之后, 她很快恢复健康回学校上课。</font><br>\n

figure on	<h3>figure on</h3>预料<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We did not figure on having so many people at the picnic.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们没有料到会有这么多人参加野餐。</font><br>〈美口〉指望<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's a person you can always figure on his help.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是一个你总能依赖他帮助的人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't figure on going abroad this summer; we may not be able to afford it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别指望今年夏天出国, 我们可能负担不起旅行费用。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can figure on him to be on time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你可以指望他准时。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is a person we can always figure on to complete his jobs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是一个我们经常可以指望其完成任务的人。</font><br>计划<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I figure on going over to town to pay a visit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我打算进城去拜访一个人。</font><br>\n
figure out	<h3>figure out</h3>计算出; 解决<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The purchase price figures out at about two million dollars.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 交易的价格计算在200万美元左右。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Could you help me figure out this problem?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能帮我解决这问题吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Just figure it out yourself.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你自己想办法吧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I have figured out how much during the week I spent.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我算出了这个星期花了多少钱。</font><br>弄明白<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I just can't figure him out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我简直摸不透他。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can't figure out what he was hinting at.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想不出他在暗示什么。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I didn't figure out how to do it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不知道该怎么办。</font><br>\n

fill in	<h3>fill in</h3>填平, 填满<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The workmen dug a hole, mended the pipe, and then filled the hole in again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 工人们挖了个洞, 修补好管道, 然后又把洞填平。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He helped us to fill in a big gap in our knowledge.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他帮我们填满知识上的空白。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The ruts must be filled in so that traffic can pass.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 车轮压出的辙迹必须填平, 以便行人和车辆通行。</font><br>填(写)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Many people find it difficult to fill in a form.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 许多人发现表格填写困难。</font><br>度过(时光)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The plane takes off in the evening.How can I fill in the time between?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 飞机要等到晚上才起飞。我怎么打发这段时间呢?</font><br>使(某人)熟悉, 向(某人)提供消息等<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please fill me in on your future plan.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请详细谈谈你今后的打算。</font><br>代替; 暂时补缺<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was called on to fill in in an emergency.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是在紧急情况下被召去临时补缺的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'll find someone to fill in for you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我去找个人来顶替你。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His medical skill is so superb that he can hardly be filled in for in an emergency.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他医术高超, 在紧急情况下很难被代替。</font><br>淤塞<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The harbor gradually filled in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 港口渐渐淤塞了。</font><br>填补<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He fills in a sketch with shadow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在画稿上添衬上阴影。</font><br>\n

find out	<h3>find out</h3>发现, 看穿, 揭发<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I hope nobody finds out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我希望无人发现。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'll find out about planes to New York.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我去打听一下飞纽约的班机。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The manager had found him out and was going to sack him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 经理发觉了他的不轨行为, 打算炒他鱿鱼。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We must find out the truth of the matter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们必须弄清楚事情的真相。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The traitor was finally found out and put in prison.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个卖国贼终于被人发现并被监禁了起来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I have found out how to make the cake.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我已经发现怎么做蛋糕。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We soon found out that he was a secret agent.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们很快就查明他是个间谍。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was found out that certain herbal medicines had curative effect on AIDS.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 经研究发现有些草药对艾滋病有疗效。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Find out where he is going.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 弄清楚他要到哪儿去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please find out when the train starts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请你查一下火车什么时候开。</font><br>使发作<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This cold weather finds out my old wound.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这寒冷的天气使我的旧伤疼痛。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The overcast and rainy weather found out his arthritis.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 阴雨天使他的关节炎发作了。</font><br>通过探询〔访问〕获悉(某人)不在<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I found him out when I called.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我去看他时发现他不在家。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I called at his office yesterday, but found him out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 昨天我到他办公室去看他, 但发现他不在。</font><br>使受惩罚, 使得到报应<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His sins will find him out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他为非作歹, 不会有好下场。</font><br>\n
fine print	<h3>fine print</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>极小的字体;(契约中)难懂的条文<br>\n
finery	<h3>finery</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>华丽、优雅的服装或装饰<br>\n
fine-tooth comb	<h3>fine-tooth comb</h3>非常仔细地<br>\n

fingering	<h3>fingering</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>用指摸弄,抚弄,捻弄,用指弹奏,指法,(总称)指法符号,细绒线<br>\n
finicky	<h3>finicky</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>过分注意的,过分讲究的,过分周到的<br>\n
finishing line	<h3>finishing line</h3>精整作业线;终点线<br>\n
finishing school	<h3>finishing school</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>女子精修学校<br>\n
finish off	<h3>finish off</h3>结束(某事)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There are still a few jobs to finish off so we cannot be released for the time being.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 还有几件事得干完, 所以我们暂且还不能松劲。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We finished off the work by noon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 到中午我们的活就干完了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His thesis is being finished off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的论文快写完了。</font><br>〈非正〉杀死; 毁掉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Two of the villagers finished off the bandit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有两个村民杀死了那个匪徒。</font><br>吃光(某物); 耗尽(某物)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He finished off two bowls of noodles in no time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他很快就吃完了两碗面条。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A long drive like that could finish the car off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这样长途驾驶会把汽车跑坏的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Dishes served in restaurant are seldom finished off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 饭馆里吃的饭菜常有剩余。</font><br>\n
finish up	<h3>finish up</h3>〈非正〉结束, 告终<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can finish up now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现在你可以结束了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I hope you won't finish up in jail.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 希望你不要以入狱告终。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He never dreamed that he would finish up owning such a lot of property.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他做梦也想不到最终会拥有这么多的财产。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We must finish up this business in a day or two.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们必须在一两天内把这事结束。</font><br>吃〔喝〕光<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We finished up everything there was on the table.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们把桌上的东西全吃完了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Everything on the lunch table was finished up soon by the hungry children.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 桌上的午餐被饥饿的孩子们一扫而光。</font><br>\n
finish with	<h3>finish with</h3>〈非正〉用完, 完成<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He will leave as soon as he has finished with his immediate commitments.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把眼前承担的事一结束, 就立即动身。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has already finished with school.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的学业已经结束。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp As soon as a melody is finished with, the composer writes another.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 每写完一首曲子, 这位作曲家就接着写另一首。</font><br>断绝关系, 绝交<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jane has finished with her new boyfriend.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 简已经和她的新男友不再来往了。</font><br>到(某日期)为止<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please send your accounts for the period finishing with 10 October.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请把截止到十月十号的账目送来。</font><br>\n

fitful	<h3>fitful</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>一阵阵的; 不规则的; 不稳定的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The whole debate was rather fitful.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 整个辩论断断续续地进行。</font><br>\n
fit in	<h3>fit in</h3>有地方容纳<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All of us couldn't fit in there.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那里挤不下我们所有的人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I think we can fit in an additional room.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想我们可以再加建一间房子。</font><br>有时间从事(某事); 有时间接待(某人)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Dr. White says he can fit in only two more patients this morning.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 怀特大夫说今天上午他只能看两个病人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I am sure you can fit me in somewhere.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我相信你能找个地方安排我。</font><br>相处融洽, 合得来<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mary joined a painting group but didn't seem to fit in, so she left.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 玛丽参加了一个绘画组, 但是似乎和那些人合不来, 所以她又退了出来。</font><br>\n
fit into	<h3>fit into</h3>(使)适合, (使)合乎…的时间〔空间〕, 与…融为一体<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I fear I will not fit into any future.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我怕我会与未来的任何社会都格格不入。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This diagram fits well into the article.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这张图表放在这篇文章中非常合适。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The house fits into the scenery so well that you can hardly see it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个房子与这儿的风景浑然一体, 几乎都看不出来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We have to fit the special train into the timetable.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们只得把这次专列安排在时间表中。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Any new building must be fitted into the existing appearance of the city.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 任何建筑物都必须与本城目前的景观相协调。</font><br>\n
fit out	<h3>fit out</h3>以…装备, 供给…以必需品<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We must fit the boy out for school.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们必须为这个男孩准备好上学用品。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government fitted out warships and sailors for them.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府给他们配备了战舰和水手。</font><br>\n
fitter	<h3>fitter</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>适当的,胜任的<br>\n
fit up	<h3>fit up</h3>装备必需品<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It costs a lot of money to fit up a new office.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 装饰一间办公室要花很多钱。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The room was fitted up with bookshelves.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 房间备有书架。</font><br>放置好, 安装好<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please fit the machine up for this afternoon's class.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请为今天下午的课准备好机器。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp New blackboards have been fitted up in all the classrooms.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 教室里都安装上了新黑板。</font><br>临时做成…<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The actors had to fit up a stage because there was no theater in the town.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 镇上没有剧场, 演员们只好临时搭个舞台。</font><br>给(某人)安排住处<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you fit me up in a good hotel?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能给我找个好旅馆吗?</font><br>给(某人)硬套罪名<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I didn't take the jewels; the police have fitted me up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我没有偷珠宝, 是警察硬栽赃给我的。</font><br>\n

fixity	<h3>fixity</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>固定性,固定物,不变性<br>\n
fix on	<h3>fix on</h3>把…固定住<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The tail won't come off the toy plane; it is fixed on with nails.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 玩具飞机的机尾掉不下来, 它是用钉子钉住的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The tail is fixed on the model plane with nails; it cannot come off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 模型飞机的机尾是用钉子钉在飞机上的, 不会掉下来。</font><br>把…集中在…上<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Fix your eyes on the road and we will be much safer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 眼睛盯住公路, 这样我们就更安全些。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has fixed his affections on a woman.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他已爱上一位妇女。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's difficult to fix my mind on what I am doing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我很难把精力集中在我做的事情上。</font><br>确定, 选定<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Have you two fixed on a date for the wedding yet?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你们俩选定婚期了吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They fixed on him to speak on their behalf.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们已经确定他作为代表发言。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We have fixed upon starting tomorrow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们已决定明天动身。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can't fix the blame on me. I can prove I was somewhere else.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你不能定我的罪, 我可以证实我当时在别的地方。</font><br>\n
fix up	<h3>fix up</h3>修理, 修补<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The mechanic soon fixed up the machine.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 机修工很快就把机器修好了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The old machine was fixed up and put to work again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那台旧机器修好了, 又开始转动了。</font><br>安排, 确定<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We fixed up a trip.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们已安排旅行。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They've fixed up to visit us next month.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们决定下个月访问我们。</font><br>为(某人)提供<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Ask your brother to fix you up with a nice girl.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请你哥哥给你介绍一位好姑娘。</font><br>安顿, 照应<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He fixed us up in a good hotel.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他给我们安排了一个好旅馆。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We were fixed up for the night in a hotel.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们被安顿在旅馆里过夜。</font><br>\n

get into	<h3>get into</h3>进入<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They will get into London this afternoon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们今天下午会到伦敦。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bus got me into the village at two o'clock.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 两点钟时公共汽车把我送进村子里。</font><br>陷入<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Again they got into difficulties.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们再次陷入困境。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Haines got into a rage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 海恩斯勃然大怒。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This mistake may get him into difficulties.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这一错误将使他陷入困境。</font><br>养成<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The boy has got into the habit of washing his hands before meals.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那男孩已养成饭前洗手的习惯。</font><br>\n
get in with	<h3>get in with</h3>认识, 巴结<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He always tries to get in with the most influential people.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他总是试图巴结最有影响的人物。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can't get in with him at all.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我根本无法认识他。</font><br>与…取得联系<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I am getting in touch with him right away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我马上和他进行联系。</font><br>\n
get off	<h3>get off</h3>离开; 动身<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We got off immediately after breakfast.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 早饭后我们立即启程。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children had to get themselves off to school as both their parents went out to work at eight o'clock.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 由于父母都在八点钟去上班了, 孩子们只好自己去上学。</font><br>发出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'd like to get this letter off by the first post.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想将这封信在邮局第一次收信时寄出去。</font><br>(使)免受处分<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They got off lightly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们轻易地逃脱了惩罚。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You won't get off so easily next time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 下次可不能这样轻易放过你。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her warning got two boys off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的警告使得两个孩子免受处分。</font><br>(使)入睡<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He couldn't get off to sleep.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他不能入睡。</font><br>停止工作<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When do you get off?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你何时停工?</font><br>记住; 背诵<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She got a passage off by heart.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她背熟了一段文章。</font><br>下(车、马等)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is where I get off the bus.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这就是我下车的地方。</font><br>\n
get off with	<h3>get off with</h3>与…要好<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He got off with that blonde.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他结识了那个金发碧眼的女人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She got off with him an hour after the party started.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在晚会开始一小时后就和他熟识起来。</font><br>罚款<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He got off with only a fine instead of possible imprisonment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他仅受到罚款而不被监禁。</font><br>\n

get out	<h3>get out</h3>出来, 出去, 走开<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There were so many people in the doorway that we could hardly get out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 门口那么多人, 我们简直走不出去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Get out!I won't hear you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 滚开! 我不要听你的话。</font><br>(使)出现, (使)逃出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Few of the enemy troops got out alive.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 敌军生还者很少。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They could not find a way to get themselves out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们无法找到一条逃生之路。</font><br>从车上下来<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I shall get out at the next station.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我将在下一站下车。</font><br>开始被人知道; 泄漏出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp To his surprise the news soon got out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 使他惊奇的是, 消息很快就泄露出去了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Handle with care, or the acid may get out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 小心轻放, 否则酸会溢出来。</font><br>参加社交活动<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp John advised Peter to get out and mix more with people.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 约翰劝彼得出去参加社交活动, 多跟人们往来。</font><br>(天气)变得(晴朗等)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It got out very fine.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 天气变得很好。</font><br>出版, 发行<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They got the book out quickly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们很快出版了那本书。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A new version of the dictionary has been got out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这部词典的一种新版本已经问世。</font><br>作出; 完成<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They managed to get the plans out on time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们总算按时订出了计划。</font><br>(成功地)解决, 解答出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Not a single boy in the class could get the problem out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 班上没有一个学生解得出这道题。</font><br>探听出, 盘问出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We got out some information about the enemy's dispositions from the captured enemy officer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们从捕获的敌军官那里问出一些有关敌军部署的情况。</font><br>\n
get out of	<h3>get out of</h3>离开; 下<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The meeting went on late and he wanted to get out of it soon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 会开得太晚了, 他想早点离开。</font><br>停止; 改掉; 戒掉; 脱离, 摆脱, 克服; 避免做某事<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is not easy to get out of a bad habit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 改掉坏习惯是不容易的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has already got out of danger.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他已脱险。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her sons were experts at getting out of housework.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的儿子们很会逃避家务活。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He tried to get out of paying his share of the bill.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他试图逃避支付账单上他那一份儿。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My illness got me out of having to see him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的病使我不用见他。</font><br>从…得到, 获得<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Somehow we have to get the information out of him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们必须用某种方法从他那儿得到情报。</font><br>\n
get over	<h3>get over</h3>(使)渡过, (使)穿过<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He got over while the traffic was stopped.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 车辆停下来时, 他过了马路。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They got him over somehow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们设法帮他过去。</font><br>传送<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He gets over well when he wants to.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他想说什么, 都能表达自如。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They got the play over all right.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这出戏他们演得很动人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I get it over to him that they wouldn't come.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我使他明白他们不会来了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These facts may be clear enough to us, who have made a study of them, but how are they to be got over to the man in the street?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些事实对于曾做过一番研究的我们可能是够清楚的了, 但怎么能为一般人所理解呢?</font><br>做完…, 结束<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let's do the job now and get it over.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 咱们现在就干这事, 并且把它干完。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They got the work over as quickly as possible.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们尽快地结束了工作。</font><br>走完<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They only managed to get over ten kilometers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们只走完十公里路。</font><br>克服; 克制<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We had to get over many difficulties.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们必须克服很多困难。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He can't get over his shyness.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他无法克服羞怯。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I hope you'll get over being angry.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我希望你克制住不要生气。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Once these difficulties were got over, the work would speed up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一旦克服了这些困难, 工作进展就快了。</font><br>从…中恢复过来<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It took him a long time to get over his cold.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 很久之后他的感冒才好。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She seemed to have got over her distress.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她似乎已经摆脱了她的悲痛心情。</font><br>\n
get over with	<h3>get over with</h3>〈口〉一劳永逸地做完(不愉快但不得不做的事),把…做完了事<br>\n
get round	<h3>get round</h3>传播, 散播<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The story has got round—everyone knows about it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这事已传开——谁都知道了。</font><br>绕开, 避开<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It may take time, but we'll get round.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这事可能要费时间, 但我们可以回避。</font><br>随意走走; 旅行<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Does Abell get round a great deal?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 艾贝尔常出去走动吗?</font><br>说服<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That child can always get round you and get what it wants.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个孩子总是会哄人, 要的东西都能得到。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tom's trying to get round his father to buy him a car.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汤姆正想劝说父亲给他买辆车。</font><br>\n
get round to	<h3>get round to</h3>设法找到足够的时间去做(某事)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I promised to repair the doorknob, but I had never got round to it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我答应要修门把, 可我抽不出时间修。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After a long delay, he got round to writing the letter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 耽搁了很久以后, 他找到时间写这封信。</font><br>说服<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We should have very little difficulty getting him round to our way of thinking.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 要说服他接受我们的想法不太难。</font><br>\n
get through	<h3>get through</h3>穿过; 通过<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The passage is too narrow for cars to get through.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 通道太窄, 汽车过不去。</font><br>到达目的地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our message doesn't seem to have got through, we've had no reply through it was sent several days ago.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的信件看来没有收到, 因为已经寄了好几天了, 可至今还没有接到回音。</font><br>读完; (使)理解; 消化<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I've pile of papers to get through before the meeting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 开会前我有一大堆文件要处理。</font><br>(用电话)接通某人<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I rang you several times but wasn't able to get through.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我几次打电话给你, 都没有打通。</font><br>完成<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I got through the novel in one evening.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我一个晚上就看完了这本小说。</font><br>用完, 花光<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has got through all the money I lent him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我借给他的钱他已花光了。</font><br>\n

get up	<h3>get up</h3>(使)起床<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Getting up early is a very good habit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 早起是个很好的习惯。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They got the soldiers up well before dawn.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 天蒙蒙亮他们就叫士兵们起床。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's high time you were able to get yourself up, my boy!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现在你应该可以不要人叫就自己起床了, 我的孩子!</font><br>站起来; (使)起立<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He fell down on the road and was too weak to get up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他摔倒在路上, 身体太虚弱, 站都站不起来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The patient was so weak that the nurse was unable to get him up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这病人弱得很, 护士扶都扶不起来。</font><br>举起, 竖起, 递上, 搬上<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Get up the ladder, and I'll pass the paint up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把梯子竖起来, 我要把油漆递上去。</font><br>使靠近; 行近<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp People on shore greeted the new 10, 000 liner by waving their arms as it was getting up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当新造的万吨巨轮驶近时, 岸上的人们挥臂欢迎。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The soldiers have got their equipment up to the front line.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 士兵们已经把装备运往前线。</font><br>变得猛烈, 增加强度, 增加速度<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is a strong wind getting up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 刮起了大风。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Then our car got up speed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 接着我们的汽车加快了速度。</font><br>整理, 装饰; 打扮<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We get Grandfather up as Father Christmas.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们把爷爷装扮成圣诞老人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Helen got up her hair before going to the dinner party.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 海伦去赴宴前把头发梳理好。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children were all beautifully got up on Children's Day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 儿童节那天所有的孩子都打扮得很漂亮。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She got herself up very attractively.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把自己打扮得十分迷人。</font><br>安排; 准备; 组织; 筹划<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is good at getting things up for parties.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他善于安排聚会的各项事宜。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The scheme was well got up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个设计组织得很好。</font><br>学习, 研究; 记熟<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is getting up his maths for the exam.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他正在温习数学, 准备考试。</font><br>激发, 激起<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He could not get up an atom of sympathy for her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他对她激不出一点同情心。</font><br>\n

go for	<h3>go for</h3>去找某人, 想得到…, 争取<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We'd better go for a doctor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们最好去请医生。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Kent's going for the tennis championship this year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 肯特竭力想获得今年的网球冠军。</font><br>攻击, 抨击<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She went for him with a hatchet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她操起短柄斧向他扑去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They went for her in the newspaper.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们在报纸上攻击她。</font><br>喜欢<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don't go for men of his type.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不喜欢他那种人。</font><br>适用于<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What he said about you goes for me too.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他关于你的一席话对我也适用。</font><br>认为是, 看作, 用作<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can this brush go for a paintbrush?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这把刷子可以用作画刷吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His words don't go for much.People do not trust him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的话无足轻重, 人们不信任他。</font><br>\n

go out	<h3>go out</h3>走出, 出去; 出国<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't go out after dark.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 天黑后别往外跑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Are you going out by plane or by ship?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你是搭飞机还是乘船出国?</font><br>参加社交活动<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mrs.Snow will go out a great deal, even at seventy-five.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 斯诺夫人已经75岁了, 还经常参加社交活动。</font><br>被发出; 被发布, 被发行; 被传布<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The pamphlet went out in 6000 copies.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这本小册子发行了六千本。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All the invitations for the party have now gone out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 宴会的请帖现在已全部发出去了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Forms have gone out to all our sub-offices.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 表格发到我们的所有分局。</font><br>退下, 消退<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The tide goes out at 4 p.m.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 下午四点退潮。</font><br>熄灭; 停止运转<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His cigarette went out and he hurried to find matches.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的香烟灭了, 他急忙找火柴。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp One of the plane's engines went out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 飞机的一个发动机熄火了。</font><br>死去; 消逝; 失去知觉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The patient caught pneumonia and went out shortly before midnight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个病人感染了肺炎, 在午夜前不久去世了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her love has slowly gone out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的爱情慢慢地消逝了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp One heavy blow to the chin and the challenger went out like a light.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 下巴挨了一重拳以后, 挑战者立即被打得不省人事了。</font><br>辞职, 下台; 被淘汰<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's nearly two months since Labour Government went out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 工党政府下台将近两个月了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That team went out in the first round.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那支队伍在首轮比赛中被淘汰了。</font><br>结束, 过完<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The year went out, with great achievements on all fronts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这一年以各阵线都获得卓越的功绩而结束。</font><br>不流行, 过时<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Short skirts went out a few years ago, but they've come back again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 短裙几年前不流行了, 现在又再度流行了。</font><br>\n

go round	<h3>go round</h3>参观<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Keep quiet while you're going round.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 参观时要保持安静。</font><br>走访<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I went round to see him yesterday evening.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 昨晚我顺便去看望他。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let's go round to his office and talk to him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们要到他的办事处去跟他谈一谈。</font><br>转动, 旋转, 运转; 眩晕<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The water wheel goes round and around.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 水车转个不停。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm better now, but my head keeps going round.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我现在好一点了, 但我的头还在晕。</font><br>到处走动<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The girl went round telling lies.We are already tired of her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那女孩到处说谎, 我们已经讨厌她了。</font><br>相处, 做伴, 交往<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They have been going round for three years now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们在一起已经三年了。</font><br>传播<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There are a lot of colds going round.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 感冒正在散播。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The story soon went round.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 事情很快就传开了。</font><br>足够分配<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There are not enough desks to go round in the classroom.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 教室里书桌不够用。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I fear the apples wouldn't go round.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我怕苹果不够分配。</font><br>\n

go through	<h3>go through</h3>检查, 审查, 搜查<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They went through our luggage at the customs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 海关人员仔细检查了我们的行李。</font><br>完成, 做完<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let's go through the exercises.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 咱们把这些练习做完。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp With great concentration she went through the movements.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她聚精会神地做完这些动作。</font><br>练习<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The artists were going through their daily routines.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 艺术家们正进行日常的练习活动。</font><br>遭受, 经受, 经历<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When he was a child, he went through one hardship after another.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩提时代, 他经历了一个又一个的艰难困苦。</font><br>穿过, 通过<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The river goes through the city.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这条河流穿过这个城市。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The piano went through the door easily.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 钢琴很轻易地通过了那道门。</font><br>用完, 用掉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We've gone through all those envelopes I bought last week.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们用完了我上周买的所有的信封。</font><br>看完<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How long will it take to go through the book?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 读完这本书要多少时间?</font><br>讨论<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let's go through the plan again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 让我们再详细地讨论这项计划吧。</font><br>\n

There are new leaves growing out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这棵植物终归没死!它又长出了新叶。</font><br>\n

hammer in	<h3>hammer in</h3>用锤敲击<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He hammered in the nail.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他用锤把钉子敲了进去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Help me to hammer in these last few nails. I'm tired!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 帮我把最后这几个钉子钉上, 我太累了。</font><br>用力敲击, 用力敲入<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They hammered in the door and then charged into the room.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们撞开了门冲进房间。</font><br>〈非正〉反复灌输, 不断地努力强调<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He'll hammer some information in whether that child likes it or not.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不管那个小孩喜欢不喜欢, 他要反复灌输一些知识给他。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I want to hammer in a few facts if I can.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 要是能够的话, 我要反复强调几个事实。</font><br>\n
hammer out	<h3>hammer out</h3>锤平; 锤成, 敲出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The machine can hammer out metal very thin.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这台机器能把金属锤得很薄。</font><br>阐明, 解决<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We hammered out the question in friendly debate.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在友好的辩论中, 我们弄清了这个问题。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our differences were at last hammered out in discussion.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的分歧最后通过讨论消除了。</font><br>〈非正〉开始演奏, 弹奏出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She hammered out a tune on the piano.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在钢琴上弹奏一支曲子。</font><br>\n

hand down	<h3>hand down</h3>把…传递下来<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Will you please hand down that book from the shelf?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请你把书架上那本书拿下来好吗?</font><br>遗留; 流传, 传下<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our fathers handed down these customs to us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的父辈把这些习俗传给了我们。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This necklace has been handed down in my family.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这串项链是我家祖上传下来的。</font><br>搀扶…下去<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They handed Grandma down to the ground floor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们搀扶老奶奶下楼到一楼去。</font><br>正式宣布, 正式宣判<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The judge handed down a very heavy sentence on him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 法官给他判了很重的刑。</font><br>\n

hand out	<h3>hand out</h3>搀扶…出来<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The conductor handed the sick man out of the bus.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 售票员扶病人下公共汽车。</font><br>〈非正〉分发, 发给, 散发<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Will you help me to hand out the materials for the lecture?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你可以帮我分发演讲材料吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Have you handed out the Christmas gifts?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 圣诞礼物都分发出去了吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please hand out the reading materials to the students.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请把这些阅读材料分发给学生。</font><br>提出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He likes handing out advice to his friends though no one ever follows.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他喜欢给朋友们提建议, 尽管从来没有人听从过他的劝告。</font><br>拿出, 取出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The man handed out his pass and showed it to the guard.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个人拿出证件出示给门卫。</font><br>维持, 忍受<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is doubtful whether our resources will hand out for more than two or three days more.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的资源能否再维持两三天以上值得怀疑。</font><br>居住<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is your friend John, isn't it?And where does he hand out?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这是你的朋友约翰, 是吧?他住在哪里?</font><br>\n

hang on	<h3>hang on</h3>紧紧抓住<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He hung on until the rope broke.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他紧握着绳子, 直到绳子断了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The girl hung on to her mother's hand as they crossed the street.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 过马路的时候, 小女孩紧抓住她妈妈的手。</font><br>坚持下去<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Although we are beaten, we must hang on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 尽管我们失败了, 我们还得坚持下去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp John did not like his job, but he decided to hang on to it until he found a better one.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 约翰不喜欢他的工作, 但他决定干下去, 直到找到更好的工作。</font><br>等候<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please hang on while I go for some water.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请稍等一下, 我去弄点水来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Hang on! I'll call him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别挂断!我去叫他。</font><br>\n

hang out	<h3>hang out</h3>〈非正〉居住<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you tell me where Jim hangs out?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能告诉我吉姆住哪儿吗?</font><br>伸出; 前靠<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The dog's tongue was hanging out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 狗的舌头伸在外面。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't hang out of the window or you may fall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要把身体伸出窗外, 否则会掉下去的。</font><br>晾晒; 挂出去<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp People hang flags out on the national holiday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在国庆日, 人们把国旗挂在门外。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She hung out the wet clothes on the line to dry.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把湿衣服晾在外面的绳子上晒干。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A white banner was hanging out of the window.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一面白旗挂在窗子外面。</font><br>不屈服, 坚持下去<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We must hang out until help arrives.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们必须坚持下去, 直到得到援助。</font><br>\n
hang round	<h3>hang round</h3>闲逛; 闲待着<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Since he lost his job, he's been hanging round here.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他失业后一直在这里闲着。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tom is hanging round in the street.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汤姆在街头闲逛。</font><br>耽搁, 延误<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't hang round—we have a train to catch!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要耽搁, 我们要赶火车呢!</font><br>迫近, 即将来临<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is rain hanging round.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 马上要下雨了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Christmas is hanging round.The children are very happy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 圣诞节就要到了, 孩子们都很高兴。</font><br>\n

hold back	<h3>hold back</h3>阻碍, 阻止<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was so impatient that I could hardly hold him back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是那样急躁, 我简直拉不住他。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They built dykes and dam to hold back the rising flood waters.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们修筑了堤坝来阻挡上涨的洪水。</font><br>控制; 抑制<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She couldn't hold back her tears any longer and wept aloud.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她再也忍不住了, 大声哭泣起来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Though very angry, I held back from telling him exactly what I thought.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 尽管我非常生气, 仍克制自己未将我的感想告诉他。</font><br>隐瞒, 保留<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They felt that she was holding back something.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们感觉她有些话没说出来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We must have the whole story; don't hold anything back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们必须了解全部情况, 你什么也别隐瞒。</font><br>犹豫不决<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She held back, not knowing what to do or say.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她犹豫起来, 不知该做什么或该说什么。</font><br>\n
hold down	<h3>hold down</h3>压住, 使固定<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He took a dictionary to hold down the test papers for fear that they might be blown away by the wind.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他拿了本词典压住试卷, 以防被风吹走。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We must hold down the tents because of the strong wind.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 风很大, 我们必须把帐篷固定好。</font><br>限制, 控制<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government has done something to hold down food prices.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府已经采取措施控制食品价格上涨。</font><br>镇压, 压制, 使屈服<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They tried every means to hold down the workers on strike.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们采取一切手段镇压罢工工人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You won't be able to hold such a man down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你是无法叫这样的人屈服的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The whole nation was held down by the cruel rule of the king.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 整个国家处于国王的残酷统治的压制之下。</font><br>\n

hold over	<h3>hold over</h3>延期; 延续<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The meeting holds over until next week.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 会议延期至下星期召开。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let's hold over discussion of this problem until our next meeting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 让我们下次会议再讨论这个问题。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The matter was held over until the next meeting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 此事被延至下次会议解决。</font><br>保留, 留用<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Would you please hold over the rest of the goods?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请将其余货物保存起来好吗?</font><br>继续上映<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They are going to hold that movie over for a week again; it's very successful.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们打算把那部影片再继续上映一周, 上座率非常好。</font><br>\n

hold up	<h3>hold up</h3>举起, 抬起, 拿起<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Hold up your hands if you have any question.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如有问题请举手。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was holding up an umbrella when I saw her in the street.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我在街上看到她时, 她手里撑着把伞。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He held up the map so it could be seen more clearly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他举起地图, 这样可以看得更清楚些。</font><br>支持, 支撑, 承受住<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't worry. The house will hold up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别担心, 房子不会倒下来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I thought that no one else could hold up such pain.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我认为没有人能忍受住这样的疼痛。</font><br>拦住, 使停顿, 耽搁<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We had planned to finish the work before dark, but the heavy rain held us up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们原计划在天黑以前干完这项工作, 可给大雨耽搁了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Two policemen held up a truck so as to inspect the driver's license.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 两个警察让一辆卡车停住以便检查司机的驾驶证。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The building of the new road has been held up by bad weather.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这条新路的修筑工程因天气恶劣而停下了。</font><br>拦劫, 抢劫<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They held up the owner and robbed him of everything.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们劫持了货主, 并抢走了他的所有东西。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Two young men were reported to have held up a bank last week.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 据报道, 上周有两个年轻人抢劫了银行。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That bank has been held up three times.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那家银行已遭劫三次。</font><br>举出, 提出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't hold me up as a model.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要拿我当典型。</font><br>(天)继续晴下去, 放晴<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I hope that the fine weather will hold up for some more days.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我希望晴天再持续几天。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If the weather holds up, I'll be very glad.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果这种天气持续下去, 我就高兴了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The weather held up and the match was played on time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 天气很好, 比赛按时进行。</font><br>(情况)良好<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Everyone was doubtful at first, but his statement in detail held up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 起初大家都怀疑, 但他的详细叙述证明情况属实。</font><br>\n

keep back	<h3>keep back</h3>留在后面, 不上前<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Keep back! The firecrackers are exploding.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 退后!爆竹快要爆炸了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I asked the spectators to keep back from the sideline.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我要求观众们不要走近边线。</font><br>阻止…前进; 阻止…的进展<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I would have been here sooner, but the rain kept me back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我被雨所阻, 否则早已经到了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The angry crowds would not keep back the barrier.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 愤怒的人群不肯站在栅栏后面。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was unable to keep back her tears, and wept freely.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她抑制不住泪水, 痛痛快快地哭了起来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fighter accepted money to keep himself back from winning the fight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这位职业拳击手拿了钱, 这阻碍了他在这场拳击赛中的获胜。</font><br>隐瞒<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The prisoner was keeping back vital information.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 该囚犯有重要消息不肯吐露。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I will keep nothing back from you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我绝不瞒你任何事。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The doctor thought the girl's illness should be kept back from her because it was cancer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 医生认为不能把病情告诉这个女孩, 因为她得了癌症。</font><br>扣留; 保留<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I kept a few books back and gave him the rest.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些书我自己留下了几本, 其余的都给了他。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Keep some blood plasma back for the serious cases.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 留一些血浆给重病号。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The stockholders agreed to let their company keep back a part of its profits for reserve funds.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 股东们同意让公司扣留一部分利润作为公积金。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They kept back five dollars from her wages for income tax.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们从她工资中扣了五美元所得税。</font><br>\n
keep down	<h3>keep down</h3>使不升起; 蹲下, 伏倒<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Keep down or you'll be hit by shell fragments.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 趴下, 否则你会被弹片击中的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Keep your arms down by your sides.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把你的手臂放在两侧, 不要举起来。</font><br>控制, 限制<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I hope the wind keeps down, or the sea will be too rough for sailing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 希望风不要再大了, 否则, 海面浪涛汹涌, 无法航行。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can't keep a good man down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 优秀的人是抹杀不了的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She is managing to keep down her spending.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在设法缩小开支。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She thinks that women have been kept down by men for long enough.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她认为妇女受男人压制的时间已经够长了。</font><br>除掉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They hoe the garden to keep down the weeds.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们把花园里的草锄掉, 阻止其生长。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Chemicals are used to keep the insects down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 化学药品用于阻止昆虫滋生。</font><br>使留级<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Haas was afraid that if he failed his examinations again, he would be kept down next year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 哈斯担心他如果再考不及格, 下一年就得留级了。</font><br>吞下药物; 不吐出来<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sick man can't keep anything down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个病人无法使任何东西不吐出来。</font><br>\n

keep on	<h3>keep on</h3>继续前进; 继续工作<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Turn left at the corner and keep on as far as the church.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 到街角向左拐, 一直向前走到教堂。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They kept on working after dark.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 天黑了他们还继续工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let us keep on with our work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 让我们继续干吧。</font><br>继续穿着〔戴着〕<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's rude for a man to keep his hat on indoors.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 男人进屋不脱帽是不礼貌的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She kept her hat on her head with a long pin.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她用长帽针把帽子牢牢地戴在头上。</font><br>继续雇用; 继续使用或占有<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Are you able to keep both the gardeners on?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你还能继续雇用这两名花匠吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is keeping on the house in his hometown.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把家乡的那栋房屋保留着。</font><br>反复提及; 抱怨<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The old lady kept on about her illness.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那老太太没完没了地讲她的病情。</font><br>(使)继续朝…行进<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If we keep on our way for another hour, we should reach the village.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果再继续向前走一小时, 我们就到那个村子了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The captain was able to keep the ship on her course in spite of the storm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 尽管有风暴, 船长仍使船沿航道继续航行。</font><br>(使)继续服药〔接受训练〕<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Will you keep on the course of exercises until you are thinner?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你要继续这项训练直到身体瘦下来为止吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The doctor wants to keep Mother on the medicine for another month.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 医生要母亲把这种药再服用一个月。</font><br>\n

keep to	<h3>keep to</h3>待在<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I kept to my tent.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我一直待在帐篷里。</font><br>紧靠向<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you keep to the main road you won't get lost.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 假如你沿着主干道走, 就不会迷路。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In the country, traffic keeps to the right.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在该国, 车辆靠右行驶。</font><br>(使)谈话不离题<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In discussing this problem, we ought to keep to the point at issue.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 讨论这个问题时, 我们应该抓住分歧点。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I must keep to what I've seen with my own eyes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我只谈一下我自己亲眼所见的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is part of the chairman's duty to keep each speaker to the point to avoid wasting time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 使每位发言人不离题, 少浪费时间, 是主席的部分职责。</font><br>(使)遵守〔坚持〕<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The tourists insist on keeping to their plan.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 旅行者坚持按旅行计划行事。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You must keep to the rules even if you think they're unfair.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 尽管你认为这些规则不公正, 但也得遵守。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They kept to the custom to hold their wedding.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们按当地风俗举行婚礼。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Traffic regulations should always be kept to at any time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 任何时候都要遵守交通法规。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There's nothing to keep me to such an arrangement.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 什么也不能使我遵从这样的安排。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I shall keep you to your promise to come and see us next year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我要让你遵守自己的诺言, 明年来看我们。</font><br>保密; 不交际<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There are only a man and his wife living there.They keep entirely to themselves.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 只有一个人和他的妻子住在那里, 他们完全不与外人来往。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Imes knew the answer to the problem, but he kept it to himself.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 艾姆斯知道问题的答案, 但他却不说。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'll thank you to keep your opinion to yourself.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我请你别发表自己的看法。</font><br>将…的数量限制在<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don't want too many people to come to the party.Please keep the guests to about fifty.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不想让太多的人来参加晚会。把客人控制在50位左右吧!</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Keep his remarks to the minimum and let other people have chances to present their views.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把他的发言控制得尽可能短些, 好让别人也有机会发表意见。</font><br>\n
keep up	<h3>keep up</h3>(使)不倒下, (使)不下沉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The hay was so well stacked that it kept up even in strong winds.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 干草堆得很严实, 连大风也没有把它刮倒。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Are these pillars strong enough to keep up that dome?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这几根柱子撑得住那个圆形屋顶吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children use water wings to keep themselves up in the water while they're learning to swim.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们在学游泳时常用浮圈使自己浮在水面。</font><br>保持在高水准上<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In spite of the unfavorable weather, the grain output of the farm kept up and even increased a little than last year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 尽管天气不好, 但粮食产量并未下降, 甚至比去年还略有增加。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They worked hard every day to keep their experimental plot up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们天天埋头苦干, 以把试验田种好。</font><br>跟上, 赶上<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you cannot keep up, I can walk more slowly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 要是你跟不上, 我可以走得慢一点儿。</font><br>保养, 维修<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It must be very costly to keep up a house like this.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 维修这么一幢房子一定很昂贵。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The municipal authorities have kept the roads up well.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 市政当局把道路保养得不错。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The historic mansion was presented by the owner to the city, and is now kept up by the local authority.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这幢有历史意义的宅邸是房主送给城市的, 现在由地方当局保养维修。</font><br>保持<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We are very anxious to keep up the reputation of the firm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们对于保持公司的名誉非常急切。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The ancient custom of well-dressing is still kept up in many Derbyshire villages.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 穿着体面的古代风俗在德贝郡一带很多村子里一直还保持着。</font><br>保持不衰退<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Their spirits kept up well in spite of setbacks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 尽管遭受挫折, 他们的热情不减。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Keep up your courage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 鼓足你们的勇气。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Keep it up! Final victory is in sight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 坚持下去!最后胜利已经在望了。</font><br>不减弱<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I hope the weather will keep up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我希望天气继续晴朗。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The rain kept up all night.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 雨彻夜未停。</font><br>使熬夜<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't keep the children up too late.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别让孩子们睡得太晚。</font><br>\n

kick around	<h3>kick around</h3>漫不经心地踢<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The boys were kicking an old ball around.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 男孩子们把一个旧球踢得到处滚。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Children enjoy kicking piles of dead leaves around.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们喜欢把一堆堆的落叶踢得到处都是。</font><br>漫不经心地游荡<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He kicked around a good deal before settling down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在定居前一直在东奔西走。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Davis kicked around in several stock companies.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 戴维斯在几家股票公司间转来转去调换工作。</font><br>〈口〉存在; 活着<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Is the chairman still kicking around? I thought he had left years ago.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这位主席还活着?我还以为他多年前就死了呢。</font><br>〈口〉无人照管; 无人注意<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I found this book kicking around upstairs; is it yours?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我发现这本书被丢在楼上, 是你的吗?</font><br>粗暴地对待<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The mother was taken to court for kicking the children around.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那位母亲因虐待孩子被送交法院。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp John likes to kick around the little boys.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 约翰好欺负小孩子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This old suitcase looks as though it has been kicked around a lot.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个旧箱子好像被摔得挺厉害。</font><br>〈口〉谈论<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The committee kicked your suggestion around for over an hour before deciding that they could not accept it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 委员们谈论了一个多小时才决定不能采纳你的建议。</font><br>\n
kick back	<h3>kick back</h3>踢回<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't blame me for the fight—he kicked me first, and I only kicked him back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 打架别怪我——他先踢了我, 我才回敬他一脚的。</font><br>〈非正〉复发<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This kind of feverish cold is slow to cure; it often kicks back just when you think you are better.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种寒热病好起来很慢, 它经常会在你认为已好转时复发。</font><br>突然反冲; 回到自己头上<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The engine kicked back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 发动机突然反冲。</font><br>退还; 付佣金<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The Tokyo contractor was asked to kick 6000 back as commission.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个东京的承包商被要求退还6000美元作为佣金。</font><br>〈非正〉向…报复; 进行反击; 回击<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't kick back; I'm only joking.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别报复, 我只是开开玩笑罢了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You ought to kick back at such malicious slander.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你应当反击这种恶毒的污蔑。</font><br>\n

kick off	<h3>kick off</h3>(足球)中线开球<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They kicked off on time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们准时开球。</font><br>〈口〉(使)开始<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When should we kick off?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们什么时候开始?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It might be a good idea to kick off with a few folk songs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一开始就来几支民歌可能是个好主意。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They kicked off the reception with the President's speech.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们把请总统讲话作为招待会的第一个项目。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The movie festival was kicked off with the showing of a new film.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 电影节以放映一部新片开始。</font><br>踢开, 踢掉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He kicked his slippers off and dropped on to the bed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他踢掉了拖鞋, 倒在床上。</font><br>〈美, 非正〉离开<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Well, I really must kick off now. I've stayed long enough.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 嗯, 我真的必须走了, 我在此待得够久了。</font><br>〈美, 口〉死<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I hear poor old Charlie has kicked off!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我听说可怜的老查理死了!</font><br>〈美, 口〉停止运转<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That old washing machine has kicked off again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那台破旧的洗衣机又不转了。</font><br>\n
