knock about	<h3>knock about</h3>漫游; 四处走动<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I've knocked about in most parts of the world in my time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我这辈子差不多游遍了整个世界。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has knocked about quite a bit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他经历过很多漂泊不定的生活。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's not yet thirty, but he's knocked about the world a good deal.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他还不到30岁, 但他已漫游了世界许多地方。</font><br>殴打; 在肉体〔精神〕上虐待<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They said that her husband used to knock her about but they had never heard her complain.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们说她丈夫曾对她拳打脚踢, 但从没听她诉过苦。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If that man knocks his wife about any more, he'll be sent to prison.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 要是那个人还虐待妻子, 他就要被送往监狱。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The poor boy is usually knocked about by his stepfather.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个不幸的男孩常遭继父殴打。</font><br>接连打击, 毁坏<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don't like the children playing in this room, for fear they knock the furniture about.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不喜欢孩子们在这间房子里玩, 因为怕他们把家具打坏了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It had been a good piano in its time, but it was badly knocked about.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这本来是一架好钢琴, 但是完全被敲坏了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can get some exercise by knocking a ball about a field with a friend.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 和一个朋友在场上打打球会使你得到锻炼的。</font><br>活着<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Is the same chairman still knocking about? I thought he had left years ago.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这位主席还活着?我还以为他多年前就死了呢。</font><br>放着无人理睬<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Have you any scrap iron knocking about?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你那儿有散在各处的废铁吗?</font><br>玩; 开车等取乐<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jim bought Mary an old car, just for knocking about.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 吉姆给玛丽买了一辆旧车, 就是为了开着玩。</font><br>〈口〉随意放在…<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp No, it's not mine; it's been knocking about the house for years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不, 那不是我的, 好几年了这本书就扔在屋里没人管。</font><br>〈口〉在…猛干<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I wear these old trousers for knocking about the garden.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我穿这条旧裤子是为了在园子里大干一番。</font><br>\n
knockabout	<h3>knockabout</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>粗用的,喧闹的,到处闲荡的<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>闹剧,小游艇,流浪汉<br>\n
knock around	<h3>knock around</h3>漫游; 四处走动<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I've knocked around in most parts of the world in my time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我这辈子差不多游遍了整个世界。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has knocked around quite a bit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他经历过很多漂泊不定的生活。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's not yet thirty, but he's knocked around the world a good deal.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他还不到30岁, 但他已漫游了世界许多地方。</font><br>殴打; 在肉体〔精神〕上虐待<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They said that her husband used to knock her around but they had never heard her complain.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们说她丈夫曾对她拳打脚踢, 但从没听她诉过苦。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If that man knocks his wife around any more, he'll be sent to prison.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 要是那个人还虐待妻子, 他就要被送往监狱。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The poor boy is usually knocked around by his stepfather.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个不幸的男孩常遭继父殴打。</font><br>接连打击, 毁坏<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don't like the children playing in this room, for fear they knock the furniture around.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不喜欢孩子们在这间房子里玩, 因为怕他们把家具打坏了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It had been a good piano in its time, but it was badly knocked around.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这本来是一架好钢琴, 但是完全被敲坏了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can get some exercise by knocking a ball around a field with a friend.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 和一个朋友在场上打打球会使你得到锻炼的。</font><br>活着<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Is the same chairman still knocking around? I thought he had left years ago.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这位主席还活着?我还以为他多年前就死了呢。</font><br>放着无人理睬<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Have you any scrap iron knocking around?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你那儿有散在各处的废铁吗?</font><br>玩; 开车等取乐<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jim bought Mary an old car, just for knocking around.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 吉姆给玛丽买了一辆旧车, 就是为了开着玩。</font><br>〈口〉随意放在…<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp No, it's not mine; it's been knocking around the house for years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不, 那不是我的, 好几年了这本书就扔在屋里没人管。</font><br>〈口〉在…猛干<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I wear these old trousers for knocking around the garden.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我穿这条旧裤子是为了在园子里大干一番。</font><br>\n
knockback	<h3>knockback</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>拒绝<br>\n
knock back	<h3>knock back</h3>回敲<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He knocked on the wall and she knocked back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他敲了敲墙壁, 她在隔壁应声回敲。</font><br>猛饮<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How much can you knock back at a time?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你一次能喝多少?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has knocked back two double rums.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他喝掉了两杯双份甜酒。</font><br>〈口〉使花费掉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How much did that new watch knock you back?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那只新表花了你多少钱?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That new dress must have knocked her back a few pounds!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那件新衣服肯定让她花了好几英镑!</font><br>使大吃一惊<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This kind of news knocks you back a bit, doesn't it?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种消息使你有点儿吃惊, 是吗?</font><br>\n
knock down	<h3>knock down</h3>〈非正〉击倒, 撞倒<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He knocked his opponent down with one blow in the competition.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 比赛中他一拳就打倒了他的对手。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This old fighter has never been knocked down by an opponent.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这位老拳击手从未被对手打倒过。</font><br>拆卸<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The portable device easily knocks down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种轻便装置容易拆卸。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Knock down the machine before shipping.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在装运前把机器拆卸开来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Why are they knocking down the wall?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们为什么在拆墙?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our house is being knocked down to make way for a new road.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们家的房子正被拆毁以筑新路。</font><br>〈非正〉降价; 减少<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The man was asking ￡5 for the dress, but I knocked it down to ￡4.50.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那件衣服卖主索价5英镑, 但我砍价后以4.5英镑买下了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The price was knocked down to ￡3. Perhaps he'll knock the price down a little if the glass is broken.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 价格降到了三英镑。如果玻璃有破损, 或许他还会再降点儿。</font><br>卖时以击锤表示卖出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The auctioneer knocked the bureau down to a furniture dealer from York.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 拍卖者将写字台卖给从约克来的家具商。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A mahogany table was knocked down for five pounds.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 红木桌作价五英镑被拍卖了。</font><br>〈俚〉挣得, 获得过<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A clever lawyer can knock down 40, 000 dollars in a good year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果碰上好运气, 一个精明的律师一年就能赚四万美元。</font><br>〈俚〉偷; 抢<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He wanted to knock down a bank.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他想抢劫银行。</font><br>使降低; 使丢脸<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She does not want to knock down his self-esteem.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她不想挫他的自尊。</font><br>拒绝<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They knocked down the suggestion.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们把这条建议否决了。</font><br>挥霍<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She knocked down forty dollars at a restaurant.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在一家饭馆花掉40美元。</font><br>在燃烧区域边缘控制〔减弱〕火焰〔高温〕<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was a low protecting wall to knock down the heat blasting from the pit of the furnace.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有一堵低矮的护壁挡住从炉膛里喷出的火焰。</font><br>\n

knock off	<h3>knock off</h3>〈非正〉将…击打掉, 碰撞掉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She knocked the vase off by accident.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她不小心把花瓶打掉了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A snowball knocked his hat off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一个雪球飞来把他的帽子打落在地。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm sorry.I've knocked the glass off the table and broken it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 对不起, 我把桌子上的杯子碰倒打碎了。</font><br>〈口〉(使)停止<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let's knock off now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现在让我们歇一下吧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When do you usually knock off for lunch?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你们通常什么时候休息吃午饭?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You've been whistling that same tune all morning. Knock it off, will you?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 整个上午你说来说去都是老一套, 别再讲了, 好不好?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let's knock off work early and go to the football game.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 咱们早点收工去看球赛吧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My health compels me to knock off work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的健康问题使我不得不停止工作。</font><br>〈非正〉降低<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you take both dresses, I'll knock ￡2 off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你要是两套衣服都买, 我就减价两英镑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The advertised price was 168 dollars, but the shopkeeper knocked off the odd shillings.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 广告价格是168美元, 但是店主减去了零头。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When he received his money, he found that five shillings had been knocked off for expenses incurred.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当他收到钱时, 他发现已扣去了五先令的费用。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'll knock ￡3 off the price of the dress if you'll take both dresses.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 两套衣服都要的话那我就把价钱减少三英镑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Most shopping centers have knocked ten percent off the price.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大部分购物中心打九折。</font><br>〈非正〉快速做…<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can knock off a poem in half an hour.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 半小时之内我就能作一首诗。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That composition was knocked off in about two hours after dinner one evening.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那首曲子是在一天晚饭后用两小时左右谱写出来的。</font><br>〈非正〉杀, 谋杀<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don't want to knock the old man off; can't we just tie him up to keep him quiet?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不想杀死那老头, 咱们只把他捆起来叫他别做声, 行吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The old man who owned the jewels was knocked off by the thieves.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 拥有这些珠宝的老人被窃贼杀死了。</font><br>〈非正〉偷; 抢劫<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Where did you get all those watches? Did you knock them off?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那些表是从哪儿来的? 抢的吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was planning to knock off the library.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他正计划盗窃图书馆。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They knocked off a bank.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们抢劫了银行。</font><br>〈口〉拘捕<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can't knock me off—I've done nothing!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你们不能抓我, 我什么也没干!</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The criminal was tracked down and knocked off by the police.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个罪犯被警察追到后, 被逮捕起来了。</font><br>〈口〉完成, 结束<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I've a pile of work to knock off before I can take my holiday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在我去度假之前, 还有一大堆事情得干完。</font><br>〈口〉吃完<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Those boys have knocked off the whole cake!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那些孩子把整个蛋糕吃光了!</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It looked a big dish, but it was almost knocked off in no time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 看起来是一大盘菜, 但几乎一下子就扫光了。</font><br>〈口〉为惩罚而狠打<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tell me where you've been out so late, or I'll knock your block off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 告诉我你到哪儿去了, 这么晚才回来, 不说我就揍死你。</font><br>\n
knock out	<h3>knock out</h3>用锤等敲掉; 打掉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He knocked the nail out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把钉子敲了出来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He knocked his pipe out before refilling it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在装烟丝之前, 他磕出了烟斗里的烟灰。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Several of the child's teeth were knocked out in the accident.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在那次事故中, 这孩子的几颗牙齿被打掉了。</font><br>使昏迷<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The drug knocked him out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 麻醉药使他昏迷了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The medicine knocked him out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种药使他昏了过去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was knocked out by a stone hurled at him from the other side of the road.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他被马路对面向他投来的一块石头打昏了。</font><br>击倒<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Joe knocked his opponent out in the first round of the contest.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 乔在比赛第一回合中就把对方击倒了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp No one expected that he would be knocked out so easily.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 谁也没有料到他这么轻易地被击败了。</font><br>淘汰<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has now knocked out most of the other competitors.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现在他已击败了大多数的其他竞赛者。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The supporters were disappointed when their united team was knocked out in the first round.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当联队在第一轮比赛中就遭到淘汰时, 它的支持者们都感到很失望。</font><br>使不能使用; 毁坏<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The telephone communications were knocked out by the storm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 风暴使电话通讯中断了。</font><br>使筋疲力尽; 使竭尽全力<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This job has quite knocked me out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这项工作真把我累死了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He actually knocked himself out with excessive work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 实际上他是由于工作过度而把自己累得筋疲力尽的。</font><br>粗略地〔匆匆地〕创作〔完成〕<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He knocked out five letters in two hours last night.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 昨晚, 他只花了两小时就写了五封信。</font><br>使震惊<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The news of the tragedy really knocked us out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 关于这一惨案的消息确实使我们感到震惊。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We were completely knocked out by their generosity.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们的宽宏大量使我们感到十分吃惊。</font><br>引起共鸣<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That book really knocks me out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那本书确实引起了我的共鸣。</font><br>\n
knock over	<h3>knock over</h3>碰翻; 打倒<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Coming too fast down the road, I knocked over a child on a bicycle.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 由于车开得太快, 我把一个骑自行车的小孩撞倒了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jim was knocked over by a bus, but not seriously hurt.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 吉姆被公共汽车撞倒了, 但伤得不严重。</font><br>使吃惊<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The unexpected news fairly knocked me over.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那意外的消息着实使我吃了一惊。</font><br>轻易击败<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We should be able to knock the other team over without any trouble.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们应该能够毫不费力地击败对手。</font><br>偷窃; 抢劫<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “Where did you get all these watches? Did you knock them over?”“Yes, we knocked over a jeweler's shop last night.”</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “你从哪儿弄来这些手表?是不是抢的?”“是的, 昨晚我们抢劫了一家珠宝行。”</font><br>快速完成<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mike can knock over three or four of those simple drawings in a day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 迈克一天可完成三四张那样简单的图画。</font><br>\n
knock together	<h3>knock together</h3>匆匆做完(某事)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It won't take me more than five minutes to knock a snack together.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 用不了五分钟, 我就能做好一份点心。</font><br>(使)相撞<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The two pieces of wood knocked together.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 两块木头互相碰撞。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His knees were knocking together.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他害怕得腿肚子打战。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You should knock their silly heads together.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你应设法使他们明白事理。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The logs were knocked together as they floated down the stream.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 圆木顺流而下时互相碰撞着。</font><br>烹调<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Hey, Mum, knock something together for us to eat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 嗨, 妈, 搞点东西给我们吃吧。</font><br>\n

laugh off	<h3>laugh off</h3>〈非正〉一笑置之; 以笑来驱除〔消除〕<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He had a bad fall while ice-skating but he laughed it off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他滑冰时重重地摔了一跤, 但他一笑置之。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This is a mistake that can't easily be laughed off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这可不是可以一笑了之的错误。</font><br>〈非正〉痛快地笑<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His joke made us laugh our heads off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他讲的笑话逗得我们大笑不已。</font><br>以笑声使离开<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was supposed to be a serious performer, but the crowd laughed him off the stage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他被认为是严肃的演员, 但观众却把他哄下了台。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The play was so bad that it was laughed off the stage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这出戏很糟糕, 最后在观众的哄笑中停演了。</font><br>\n

lay	<h3>lay</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>放置<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He laid his coat over a chair.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把外衣放在椅子上。</font><br>压倒, 使躺下, 放倒<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The trees were laid flat by heavy wind.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 树木被风刮倒了。</font><br>使平息, 使消失<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The rain quickly laid the dust.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 雨水很快消除了空中飞扬的尘土。</font><br>打赌, 下赌注<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'll lay five pounds that you don't succeed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我出五英镑打赌, 你不会成功。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>生蛋, 产卵<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The hens don't lay during this cold weather.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这样冷的天气母鸡不会下蛋。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The duck laid ten eggs this month.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这只鸭子本月下了十个蛋。</font><br>\n

lay aside	<h3>lay aside</h3>把…放在一边<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Lay aside your book and go to bed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 放下你的书本去睡吧。</font><br>暂时搁置一边<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Plans for the new building were laid aside.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 建这幢新楼的计划被暂时搁置了起来。</font><br>放弃(某种习惯)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has laid aside the habit of smoking.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他已戒除抽烟的习惯。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is the time we lay aside old prejudices.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 是撇开旧偏见的时候了。</font><br>积蓄(金钱), 留出(时间)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He laid aside one hour a day for reading.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他每天留出一小时阅读。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is laying aside money for his old age.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他正在积蓄金钱以度晚年。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Half the prize money he spent, and the rest was laid aside for a rainy day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把获得的奖金花了一半, 另一半存起来以备不时之需。</font><br>\n

lay down	<h3>lay down</h3>放下; 使躺下<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The enemy laid down their arms.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 敌人放下武器投降。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Lay the baby down gently.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请将婴儿轻轻放下。</font><br>建造<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There are laying down gas pipes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们正在铺设煤气管道。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Several ocean-going ships are being laid down here.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这里正在建造几艘远洋货轮。</font><br>规定, 制定<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He lays it down that the school should be kept clean and quiet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他规定, 学校应当保持安静和干净。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Prices are laid down by the manufacturer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 价格是由厂商制定的。</font><br>放弃; 牺牲<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The martyr laid down his life for the cause of national independence.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这位烈士是为了民族独立的事业而献身的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Their lives have not been laid down in vain.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们并没有白白牺牲。</font><br>贮藏(尤指酒类)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has laid down some excellent wine.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他贮藏了上好的葡萄酒。</font><br>出钱(买)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I laid down 200 dollars for this TV set.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我花了200美元买了这台电视机。</font><br>\n
lay in	<h3>lay in</h3>贮存, 储备<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Peter is laying in with good red wine for his wedding party.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 彼得正为他的结婚聚会储备红葡萄酒。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They laid in hay for the winter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们贮备干草以备过冬。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp At the beginning of the winter, supplies were laid in, in case heavy falls of snow should block the road.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 为预防下大雪阻塞道路, 在初冬人们就把生活必需品储备起来了。</font><br>\n
lay into	<h3>lay into</h3>〈非正〉攻击<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The senator laid into the opponents of his bill.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那位参议员抨击反对他的提案的人。</font><br>\n
lay off	<h3>lay off</h3>停止工作〔活动〕<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The doctor advised me to lay off cigarettes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 医生建议我戒烟。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The doctor told me to lay off for a week.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 医生要我休息一周。</font><br>停止做某种不快的事<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Lay off that girl!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别缠着那个女孩子了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I wish you would lay off!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 但愿你别再说别人不好了。</font><br>暂时解雇<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The factory has laid off workers because of the drop in sales.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个工厂由于销量下降而暂时解雇了工人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The work force has been laid off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 工人们被辞退了。</font><br>\n
lay on	<h3>lay on</h3>猛打<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The soldiers laid on with a will.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 战士们开始猛烈地进攻。</font><br>安装(水、电、煤气等); 提供(饭食等)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They all moved into apartments with water and electricity laid on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们都搬进了装有水电的套间。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They lay on all essential services.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们提供一切必要的服务。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The firm always lays on a special meal for the staff around Christmas.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 圣诞节前后这家公司总是为全体职员供应一顿特殊的饭。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The telephone is laid on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 电话已安装好了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Are gas and water laid on in the new building?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 新大楼里煤气和水安装好了吗?</font><br>涂上(油漆等)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They laid on two coats of paint.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们已上了两层油漆。</font><br>征收<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government has laid on a new tax.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府已征收新税。</font><br>组织, 安排<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'll lay on a car tomorrow and have you run down to London.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 明天我安排一部车将你送到伦敦市内。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Operas were laid on for the delegates.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 为代表们安排观看歌剧演出。</font><br>将…放在…上<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She laid her heavy case on the ground and took a rest.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把重箱子放在地上, 休息一会儿。</font><br>强调, 把…强加于某人<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The detective lays great stress on details.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这位侦探非常重视细节问题。</font><br>\n
lay out	<h3>lay out</h3>陈设; 展开<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She laid out all her new clothes on the bed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把她所有的新衣服都摊开在床上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The goods for sale were attractively laid out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 供出售的商品都陈列了出来, 极引人注目。</font><br>设计<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The architect laid out the interior of the building.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 建筑师完成了这幢建筑的内部设计。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our plan must be well laid out before we begin to work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们在开始工作之前, 必须制定好计划。</font><br>〈非正〉花钱, 花力气<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has laid out all his strength and is weary.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他使出了全部气力, 非常疲倦。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She will be willing to lay out 2000 dollars for a washing machine.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她乐意花2000美元买一台洗衣机。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her money is well laid out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的钱用得很合理。</font><br>〈非正〉击倒, 打倒<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp With one blow he laid his attacker out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一拳将攻击者打倒。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp One step further and you'll be laid out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 再往前一步我就要把你打倒。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was laid out by the intense heat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 酷热使她昏了过去。</font><br>\n

lay up	<h3>lay up</h3>放置不用<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There's something wrong with this car; we have to lay it up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这辆汽车有毛病, 我们只得停止使用。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Ships are laid up, from time to time, for repairs.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 船只常常因不能使用而需要修理。</font><br>贮存, 储蓄<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He laid up some money for a rainy day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他积蓄一些钱以备不时之需。</font><br>使(某人)待在床上或室内<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The flu has laid him up for a few days.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 流感使他在床上躺了几天。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The old man was laid up with his broken left leg.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这位老人因左腿骨折卧床。</font><br>\n

lead off	<h3>lead off</h3>开始<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Who is going to lead off?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 谁先开始?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The principal led off by welcoming all the new students.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 校长以欢迎全体新同学作为开场。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She led off a dance.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她领头起舞。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They led off the show with a song.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们以一首歌开始了节目。</font><br>\n
lead on	<h3>lead on</h3>劝诱, 使误信, 哄骗<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you have no intention of marrying her, you shouldn't keep leading her on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果你不打算和她结婚, 你就不应该继续哄骗她。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Salesmen do their best to lead people on to buy things they don't need.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 推销员竭其所能诱使人们去买那些他们不需要的东西。</font><br>\n
lead on to	<h3>lead on to</h3>引起, 导致<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Besides cancer, smoking can lead on to other diseases.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 除了癌症外, 吸烟还可引起其他疾病。</font><br>\n

lead up to	<h3>lead up to</h3>作为…的准备; 导致<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In the months leading up to the great ceremony, many people took part in the preparations.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 临近盛典的几个月里, 许多人参加了准备工作。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The report describes the negotiations which led up to the settlement.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这篇报道描述了导致达成协议的谈判的情况。</font><br>使话题(渐渐)转向<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Finally the chairman led up to his favorite topic.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 最后, 主席终于转到自己最热衷的话题上去了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That's just what I am leading up to.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那正是我就要说到的一点。</font><br>\n

let-down	<h3>let-down</h3>放乳<br>\n
let down	<h3>let down</h3>放低, 放下<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They let him down on a rope.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们帮助他顺绳子滑下来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please let down the blinds.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请把百叶窗放下来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He let himself down slowly by means of a rope.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他用一条绳子滑下来。</font><br>使失望, 失信<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can trust Brooks.He'll never let you down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你可以相信布鲁克斯, 他决不会使你失望。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is a bit let down by the low grade he got.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这次成绩不好, 他有点气馁。</font><br>\n
let in	<h3>let in</h3>让…进入; 放进<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Open the door and let me in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 打开门让我进去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please open the window and let in some fresh air.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请把窗子打开, 让新鲜空气进来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The public are usually let in half an hour before the performance begins.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 通常在演出前半小时让观众入场。</font><br>把…降下<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Once the walls of the room are up, let in the ceiling.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 房子四壁一旦支起来, 就把顶篷放下来安好。</font><br>加进; 嵌入<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The teacher showed us how to cut out part of the surface of the wood and let a pattern in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老师让我们看如何把木头的表面部分挖掉一块, 然后把图案镶进去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The doctors decided that a rubber pipe would have to be let in to enable him to breathe.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 医生们决定得插一个橡皮管进去, 好使他能呼吸。</font><br>容许, 接受<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The chairman refused to let in the possibility of doubt.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 主席不容许有怀疑的余地。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His misconduct let in a host of troubles.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的不端行为招致不少麻烦。</font><br>\n
let in on	<h3>let in on</h3>〈非正〉让…知道〔参与〕<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I've heard something very funny and I'll let you in on it after class.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我听到一件很滑稽的事, 下课后告诉你。</font><br>\n
let into	<h3>let into</h3>让〔放〕…进入<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Who let you into the building?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 谁让你进入这大厦的?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We have let her into the secret.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们已经把秘密告诉了她。</font><br>嵌入, 插入<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She let a piece of lace into her dress.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她在衣服上镶了一块花边。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In order to save space, the back of the boiler had been let into the wall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 为了节省空间, 锅炉的背部被嵌进墙内。</font><br>\n
let off	<h3>let off</h3>让…下车〔下船〕<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This train stops to let off passengers on signal.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这列火车按信号停车让旅客下车。</font><br>引发, 引爆<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They let off their guns at the British ships.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们对英国船舶开炮。</font><br>放掉〔过〕; 免除<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We won't let you off so easily next time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们下次绝不会这样轻易地饶恕你。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The engine is letting off steam to relieve the pressure in the boiler.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 机车在放蒸汽, 以减少锅炉的气压。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Would you let me off the bus at the next stop, please?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请让我在下一站下车好吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She let the boy off playing piano.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她没有强迫孩子练习弹钢琴。</font><br>\n
let on	<h3>let on</h3>〈非正〉泄密, 透露; 假装<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't let on about this meeting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要把这次会议的事泄露出去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't ever let on to know me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 切记不要露出你认识我的样子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She never let on that she had met him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她从不承认她曾经见过他。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't let on to Kehr that we are going to the movie tonight.We don't want her to know.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们今晚去看电影的事别告诉凯尔, 我们不想让她知道。</font><br>\n
let out	<h3>let out</h3>使出来, 放出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please let the water out of the bathtub.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请把浴缸里的水放掉。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The wounded man let out a cry of pain.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 伤员发出一阵痛苦的叫喊声。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If he was given five years' imprisonment, he could be let out after three years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 要是他被判五年徒刑, 他就可能在三年后出狱。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't trouble to see me to the door. I'll let myself out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别麻烦送我出门了, 我会自己出去的。</font><br>〈主英〉出租(某物)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He used to let out cars by the day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他惯常按日出租汽车。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These boats are let out by the hour.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些船按小时租用。</font><br>使(火)熄灭<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't let the fire out, will you?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别让火熄灭, 好吗?</font><br>〈非正〉使(某人)得到解〔开〕脱<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “The regular teacher is back, isn't he?”“Good, that lets me out!”</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “那位正式教员回来了, 对吗?”“好哇, 那我就算解脱了。”</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was glad to be let out of that nasty affair, and have someone more experienced handle the trouble.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我真高兴能从那件棘手的事情中解脱出来, 让更有经验的人去对付那个难题。</font><br>〈非正〉打〔骂〕(某人)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Cass let out in all directions but his attackers were too strong for him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 卡斯左踢右打, 但攻击他的人比他厉害得多。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He let out wildly at the thief.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他猛打那个小偷。</font><br>〈美, 非正〉解散; 放学<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When does your school let out?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你们学校什么时间放学?</font><br>〈非正〉泄露秘密<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Someone had let the news out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有人把这消息泄漏出去了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mary accidentally let out that her mother had telephoned.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 玛丽无意中说出她的母亲来过电话。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jane let out where she had hidden her father's birthday present.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 简无意中把藏着给父亲的生日礼物的地方说了出去。</font><br>\n
letter bomb	<h3>letter bomb</h3>邮件爆炸物<br>\n
letter box	<h3>letter box</h3>信箱<br>\n

lettering	<h3>lettering</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>书写的文字,字体,刻出的字母<br>\n
letter of credit	<h3>letter of credit</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>(银行发行的)信用证<br>\n
let-up	<h3>let-up</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>停止;放松,减弱<br>\n
let up	<h3>let up</h3>让(某人)上到某处<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The student's here; shall I let him up?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个学生来了, 我让他上楼吗?</font><br>放松; 减少〔弱〕<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When he was with her, his nerve never let up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 和她在一起, 他总是感到很激动。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mother thought the pain would never let up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 母亲认为疼痛永远不会减轻了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We have overspent.We'll have to let up our expenditures next month.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们已经超支了, 下个月一定得节约开支。</font><br>\n
let up on	<h3>let up on</h3>对(某人)放松〔不严厉〕; 在(某事)上松懈<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let up on Jane.She is sick.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 对简宽容点, 她病了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We can't let up on our efforts to compete with other more successful firms.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在同其他那些更兴隆的公司竞争中, 我们丝毫松懈不得。</font><br>\n
level crossing	<h3>level crossing</h3>平交路口<br>\n
level-headed	<h3>level-headed</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>头脑冷静的,清醒的,稳健的<br>\n
leveller	<h3>leveller</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>使平者,校平机<br>\n
level off	<h3>level off</h3>将…弄平, 使平整<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Level off the shelves with a spirit level.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 用酒精水平仪把架子弄平。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When the house was built, the garden had to be leveled off with a big earthmoving machine.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 建房时得用大型推土机把园子推平。</font><br>使平稳; 使稳定<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp On reaching 1000 meters, the pilot leveled off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 到达1000米高度时, 驾驶员便做水平飞行。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After going up for six months, the cost of living leveled off in September.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 生活费用上涨了六个月以后于九月份稳定下来。</font><br>\n
level out	<h3>level out</h3>平坦起来<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp East of the gorge leveled out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 峡谷东面地势变得平坦起来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Level out this field; we want to play games on it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 平整这块场地, 我们想在这里比赛。</font><br>达到平衡〔稳定〕<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The rise in the unemployment figure should level out soon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 上升的失业数字会很快稳定下来。</font><br>消除(差别等)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The tax system is extended to level out the big differences between the rich and the poor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个税法旨在消除贫富间的差距。</font><br>\n
level pegging	<h3>level pegging</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>势均力敌,不分上下<br>\n

lie around	<h3>lie around</h3>到处散放; 闲着不干事<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I wish you wouldn't just lie around all day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 但愿你别整日躺着无所事事。</font><br>\n
lie back	<h3>lie back</h3>倚靠<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He lay back in the comfortable chair.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他靠在舒适的椅子上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was so weak and exhausted that she had to lie back in the easy chair.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她是那样虚弱和疲劳, 只得仰靠在安乐椅上。</font><br>\n
lie behind	<h3>lie behind</h3>位于…之后; 留在…的后头<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The valley that we are trying to reach lies behind the next hill.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们要去的那个山谷就在下一座山的背面。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Some difficulties lie behind us, but greater ones lie ahead.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有些困难已经克服了, 但更多困难还在前面。</font><br>是…的原因<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do you know what lies behind her sudden departure for London?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你知道她突然去伦敦的原因吗?</font><br>存在于过去; 已成为往事<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Memories lie behind of all that has happened.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大家都记得以前发生过的事情。</font><br>\n
lie detector	<h3>lie detector</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>〈口〉测谎器<br>\n
lie down	<h3>lie down</h3>休息<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She lay down for half an hour.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她休息了半小时。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp An old worker spread his padded coat on the floor and insisted that I lie down for a while.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一位老工人把大衣铺在地上, 一定要我在上面躺一会儿。</font><br>接受, 忍受<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The man will not lie down under such treatment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个人不甘心受这样的对待。</font><br>逃避(职责), 不好好干<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If Ade keeps lying down on the job, he'll soon be fired.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果艾德一直不好好干, 他很快就会被辞退。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When the overseer was not in, most of the workers would lie down on the job.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 只要监工不在, 大多数工人就磨洋工。</font><br>\n

live on	<h3>live on</h3>继续活着; 继续存在<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's ninety, but still he lives on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他90岁了, 还健在。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These traditions will live on for centuries.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些传统将世代相传。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The composer's works will always live on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这位作曲家的作品将永远留在人间。</font><br>住在…上<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I have always wanted to live on an island in the middle of a lake.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我总是想在一座湖心小岛上生活。</font><br>以…为食; 靠…为生<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Most of Asians live on rice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 多数亚洲人以大米为主食。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She still lives on her parents.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她依靠父母生活。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That old man lives on the earnings of his daughter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个老人靠他女儿的收入维持生活。</font><br>\n
live out	<h3>live out</h3>不住在工作〔学习〕的地方<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Most of the students prefer to live out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大多数学生情愿住在校外。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Students can live out if they wish.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果学生们愿意, 他们可在学院外寄宿。</font><br>度过(某一段时间); 过(某种生活)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Will the old man live out the month?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那老人熬得过这个月吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The patient lived out another month.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 病人又活了一个月。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't bother me, O.K.? Just let me live out my life in peace and in private.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别打扰我了, 好不好?就让我一个人安安宁宁地度过后半辈子吧。</font><br>\n

live together	<h3>live together</h3>住在一起; (通常指异性)同居<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I hear Jane and Bill are living together.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我听说简和比尔现在同居了。</font><br>\n

look around	<h3>look around</h3>四下观望<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Concentrate your mind on study.Don't look around.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 专心学习, 别东张西望的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Looking around, I could see no sign of life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 四处环顾后, 我看不出有生命的迹象。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The stranger looked around him with great interest.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那陌生人怀着极大的兴趣看着他的四周。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I looked around the station but couldn't see my friend anywhere.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我环顾车站四周, 但到处都看不到我的朋友。</font><br>(作出选择前)进行调查<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You'd better look around carefully before making the final decision.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在作最后结论之前, 你应该仔细考虑。</font><br>\n

look in	<h3>look in</h3>往里面看<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp At last he came to the house and looked in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 最后他来到房间并向屋里看了看。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Look in the cupboard and see if we have any more coffee.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 看看碗橱里面是否还有咖啡。</font><br>拜访; 短暂访问<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We shall be pleased to see you if you came to look in any time you're passing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 非常欢迎你路过时顺便进来坐坐。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'll look in at the shop on my way home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我将在回家的路上顺便到这家商店里转一转。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Dr. Smith looked in on the invalid the day before yesterday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 史密斯大夫前天去看望那个病人。</font><br>把注意力转向…<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He looked in that direction and saw an airplane.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他朝那个方向看, 看见了一架飞机。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I won't be able to look him in the eye if I lie.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我要是撒谎, 我就不敢直视他的眼睛。</font><br>\n

It gets a beautiful view.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这座房子面朝大海, 可以看到很美的景观。</font><br>留神〔照看〕(某人或某物)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Would you look to the children, please?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请你照料这些孩子好吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Look to it that you are here in time tomorrow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你明天一定要按时到达这里。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Look (to it) that they do not escape.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当心别让他们逃跑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Look that nothing worse happens.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 注意别让最糟的事情发生。</font><br>依靠〔指望〕(某人或某事)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I look to my parents when I need help.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当我需要帮助时我依赖我的父母。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She has always looked to her parents for advice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她总是指望她的父母替她出主意。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I look to you to support me in this matter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在这件事上我要靠你支持。</font><br>\n

make for	<h3>make for</h3>走向, 前往<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When the bell for supper rang, all the students made for the dining room.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 晚饭铃响了, 学生们都涌向餐厅。</font><br>冲向, 向…猛扑<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We didn't want to open the garden gate in case their dog made for us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们不想打开花园的大门, 以防他们的狗向我们扑过来。</font><br>有利于, 致使<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Cleanliness makes for good health.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 讲究卫生有助于增进健康。</font><br>\n
make of	<h3>make of</h3>用…做成<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children like making houses of sticks and clay.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们喜欢用树枝或黏土盖房子玩。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The table is made of wood.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 桌子是木制的。</font><br>理解, 明白, 对…有某种看法<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “Could you make anything of what he was saying?”“No, I could make nothing of it.”</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “你明白他在说什么吗?”“不, 我不明白。”</font><br>使某人发展成为<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His father wanted to make a doctor of him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他父亲想把他培养成一名医生。</font><br>\n
make off	<h3>make off</h3>匆匆逃掉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The child made off when he saw a stranger.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那小孩看见生人便急忙跑掉了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When the deer saw the hunter, it made off at once.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 鹿一见到猎人, 就立刻跑掉了。</font><br>\n
make off with	<h3>make off with</h3>偷, 花费<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He made off with all the old man's savings.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他卷走了这个老人所有的积蓄。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The money has been made off with her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些钱已被花掉了。</font><br>\n
make out	<h3>make out</h3>填写(表格); 开出(支票、账单)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please make out a bill for these goods.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请给这些物品开个账单。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The check was made out for sixty pounds.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 开了一张60英镑的支票。</font><br>辨认出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was difficult to make out the manager's handwriting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 经理的字迹很难辨认。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The signature could not be made out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这签字无法辨认。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can't make out whether this letter is an e or an o.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我认不出这个字母究竟是e还是o。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They could hardly make out where the road was in the darkness.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 黑暗中他们难以辨认出路在哪里。</font><br>理解, 明白<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was a strange sort of person; I couldn't make her out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她这个人有些古怪, 我不能理解她。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The poem is so complicated that I cannot make out its meaning.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这首诗太复杂, 我理解不了它的意思。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you make out what he is saying?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能理解他在说什么吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp No one can make out how the fire started.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 没人能找出起火的原因。</font><br>声称<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can't make out that we haven't tried to help you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你不能断言我们没有试图帮助你。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was made out by his counsel that he was quite unaware that the money had been stolen.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 据他的律师宣称, 他完全不知道钱已被偷走。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He made out himself to be rich.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他声称自己是有钱的。</font><br>假装<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let's make out that we are wrecked on a desert island.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 让我们假装在荒岛上遇难。</font><br>\n

make up	<h3>make up</h3>编造<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tom makes up stories to amuse his little brother.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汤姆编故事逗他的小弟弟。</font><br>讲和<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mary and Joan quarreled, but made up after a while.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 玛丽和琼吵架, 但一会儿就和好了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The quarrel was only about a trivial matter, but it was years before they made it up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 争吵只是为了一件小事, 但是过了多年他们才言归于好。</font><br>弥补, 偿还<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Vitamin pills make up what you lack in your diet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 维生素丸可补充你食物中所缺乏的营养。</font><br>补足, 凑足<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We collected ￡478, but a very generous benefactor made it up to ￡500.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们募捐了478英镑, 一位非常慷慨的捐款人凑足到500英镑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She had to make up her income as a pianist by teaching piano students.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她这个钢琴家的收入得靠教人弹琴来添补。</font><br>化装, 打扮<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It didn't take her long to make up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她很快就化妆好了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When she goes out to visit friends, she is very much made up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她出去访友时, 总是浓妆艳抹地打扮一番。</font><br>配制<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The pharmacist made up the prescribed medicine.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 药剂师按方子配好了药。</font><br>铺床, 整理<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Leave this notice hanging on your door, asking the servant to make up your room.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 留张便条挂在你房门上, 请服务员把你的房间整理一下。</font><br>组成, 构成<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How many countries make up the Common Market?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp (欧洲)共同市场由多少国家组成?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The audience was made up of very young children.</font></i><br><font 这由三个不同部分组成。</font><br>\n

mean	<h3>mean</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>表示…的意思<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In this poem the budding flower means youth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在这首诗里含苞欲放的花朵是指青春。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sign means that cars cannot enter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种标志表示汽车不能入内。</font><br>本意是, 原意为; 意味<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When we say yes, we mean it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们说同意就同意。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I did not mean you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不是指你。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These new orders for our manufactures will mean working overtime.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些订购我们产品的新订单意味着要加班。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He means you no harm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他对你没有恶意。</font><br>怀有某目的; 打算<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He that promises too much means nothing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 许愿过多的人是不打算兑现的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I mean to stay here, if I can.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 若是能留下, 我想留在这儿。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I mean this house for my daughter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我打算把这房子给我的女儿。</font><br>对某人有价值或重要<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In running a company, strict financial management means everything.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 经营一家公司, 严格的财务管理是至关重要的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I must tell you that I mean what I say.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我得告诉你, 我说话是算数的。</font><br>打算或注定要某人成为或做某事<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was never meant for the army.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我根本就不是当兵的材料。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He means his son to be a doctor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他要儿子当医生。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>吝啬的; 自私的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is a mean man.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是个自私的人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her husband is rather mean over money matters.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的丈夫在金钱方面非常小气。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's too mean to make a donation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他很小气, 不肯捐款。</font><br>卑鄙的, 不善良的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He took a mean advantage of me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他利用卑鄙的手段占我的便宜。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Corruption and bribery are mean.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 贪污行贿是可鄙的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was mean of her to say that.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她那样说是刻薄的。</font><br>中间的, 平均的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The mean temperature of this area is 33 degrees in summer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个地区夏季平均气温为33度。</font><br>低微的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is a man of mean birth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是位出身低微的人。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>平均数, 平均值<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What you do first is to calculate the mean.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你要做的第一件事就是算出平均数。</font><br>中间, 中庸<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's a question of finding the mean between too lenient treatment and too severe punishment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 问题是要找出处理过宽和处罚过严的折中办法。</font><br>\n

measure out	<h3>measure out</h3>量出, 配出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The pharmacist carefully measured out a dose of herbal medicine and told me how to brew it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 药剂师仔细地配好一服草药, 并告诉我煎药的方法。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Life measures out its rewards in ways unrelated to how people deserve them.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 生活分送给人们的报酬与人们是否应该得到的无关。</font><br>跌倒<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Suddenly feeling faint, he measured out his length on the floor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他突然感到头晕, 跌倒在地。</font><br>\n
measure up	<h3>measure up</h3>测量<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Will you measure up or shall I?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 是你来量还是我来量?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How does the food here measure up according to your nutrition standards?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 按照你的营养标准来衡量这食物怎么样?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'll just measure you up, sir, if I may?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 先生, 我这就给您量量衣服尺寸行吗?</font><br>估计<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We've been trying to measure up his chance.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们一直试图估量他成功的可能性。</font><br>\n

melt away	<h3>melt away</h3>融化<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The snow soon melted away when the sun came out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 太阳出来后不久, 雪就化了。</font><br>逐渐消失<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The morning fog usually melts away as the sun rises.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 晨雾通常在太阳升起时消失。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The crowd quickly melted away when the storm broke.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 暴风雨袭来时人群很快地四散了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Their fear and worry melted away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们的恐惧和担心消失了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They melted the nation's resources away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们使国家的资源逐渐枯竭。</font><br>(使)着迷〔神魂颠倒〕<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her heart melted away in secret raptures.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她暗自高兴得心花怒放。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The story melted away her soul.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这故事使她着了迷。</font><br>\n

打开<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We shall have to open you up and remove the diseased bone.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们得为你开刀切除坏死的骨头。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bullet wound in his shoulder was opened up for treatment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 切开他肩上的枪伤进行治疗。</font><br>开发<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They are opening up a new oil field.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们正在开发新的油田。</font><br>变宽; out of	<h3>out of</h3>从…里面(走出); 离开<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He walked out of the gate, all smiles.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他笑容满面地从大门里走出来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We're moving out of our flat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们准备搬出公寓。</font><br>从…的状态中<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We're out of danger.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们现在脱离了危险。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My hat was out of shape after the rain.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 雨淋过以后, 我的帽子就变形了。</font><br>越出…之外<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Out of sight, out of mind.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 离久情疏。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The ball bounced out of bounds.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 球跳出界外。</font><br>从…中<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Choose one out of the six.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 从六个中挑选一个。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Three out of four people choose “Safeguard” soap!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 四个人当中就有三个选中“舒肤佳”牌香皂!</font><br>因为, 出于, 由于<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He asked the question out of curiosity.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他出于好奇提出了这个问题。</font><br>由…制成<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She made a hat out of bits of old material.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她用旧的零碎材料做了一顶帽子。</font><br>缺乏, 没有<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They're out of water.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们缺水。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The grocer's is out of coffee.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这家杂货店的咖啡缺货。</font><br>\n

pack in	<h3>pack in</h3>塞进<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You pack in as tightly as you can.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你们尽量往里挤。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She packed all the clothes in after much trouble.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她费了好大的劲才把所有的衣服都塞了进去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The workers tightly packed the goods in the crate.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 工人们把货物严紧地包装在箱子里。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Glass should be packed in straw.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 玻璃器皿应该包扎在稻草中。</font><br>停止; 放弃; 辞职<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Why don't you pack in when you feel dizzy?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你觉得头晕时, 为什么不停止工作?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The motor is packing in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 马达正逐渐停止转动。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm sorry to say he has packed in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 很遗憾, 他已经辞职了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After a couple of weeks he packed the job in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 几星期后他放弃了那份工作。</font><br>吸引<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That film is really packing them in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那部电影吸引了他们。</font><br>\n

pack up	<h3>pack up</h3>打包; 收拾<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let's pack up and get ready to start at once.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 让我们收拾好行李, 准备马上出发。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I heard that her husband had packed up his things and moved out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我听说她丈夫已收拾了他的东西搬出去住了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Have you packed your things up?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你把东西收拾好了吗?</font><br>〈非正〉停止工作, 停止运转<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's time to pack up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 到收工的时候了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp As business was slack she packed up early.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 由于生意萧条她早早打烊了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp One of the aircraft's engines packed up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 飞机的一个引擎坏了。</font><br>\n

pair up	<h3>pair up</h3>结成对<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Not all the gloves would pair up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 手套不全成对。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When she finished the mending, she paired up the socks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 袜子补好以后, 她把它们一双双地放在一起。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This shoe does not seem to pair up with that one.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这只鞋似乎与那只不成对。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We each paired up with our same number from the other school to exchange ideas.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们分别与另一个学校相同号数的学生结成对, 交换意见。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In the contest he was paired up with an opponent about his equal.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在比赛中, 他被安排跟一个与他实力不相上下的人对阵。</font><br>交配<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Cranes take from four to seven years to mature before they pair up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 鹤要四至七岁才成熟交配。</font><br>\n

pass	<h3>pass</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>走过, 经过<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The parade passed.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 游行队伍走过去了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When will the ship pass the channel?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那轮船什么时候通过这海峡?</font><br>通过; 批准<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bill passed and became law.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 法案通过了, 成了法律。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Parliament passed the bill.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 国会通过了那个法案。</font><br>度过; 花费<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A week passed quickly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一星期很快就过去了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Helen passed her weekend at her uncle's.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 海伦在她叔叔家过周末。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>递给; 传<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Dick passed the football quickly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 狄克传球迅速。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>越过, 通过<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The aircraft made a few passes over the enemy camp, but didn't drop any bomb.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 飞机几次飞越敌营, 但没有投弹。</font><br>通行证, 许可证<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tom gave him a free pass on the railway.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汤姆给了他一张火车免费乘车券。</font><br>通道, 山口<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is a bus passing through the Brenner Pass every day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 每天都有一辆穿过布里纳山口的公共汽车。</font><br>\n
passable	<h3>passable</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>可通过的<br>\n

pass away	<h3>pass away</h3>(时间等)消磨掉, 过去<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Forty years have passed away since they met.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们相识至今已40年了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Conversation with friends soon passed an evening away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 与友人闲聊, 一个晚上很快就消磨掉了。</font><br>去世<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He passed away peacefully.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他安详地去世了。</font><br>终止; 停止<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The storm should pass away before dark.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 天黑以前风暴会停止的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All this trouble will pass away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这一切困难都将结束。</font><br>\n
passbook	<h3>passbook</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>(建房互助会的)存取款记录簿<br>(种族隔离时期所有黑人随身携带的)有色人种身份证<br>\n
pass by	<h3>pass by</h3>经过; 过去<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Time quickly passed by without our knowing it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 时间不知不觉地很快就过去了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She passed close by me without a sign of recognition.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她与我擦肩而过, 却没认出我。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The procession passed right by my door.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 游行队伍正好经过我家门口。</font><br>疏忽, 不予理会, 回避<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I inadvertently passed this essay by.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我漫不经心地把这篇散文忽略过去了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She had a feeling that her friends were passing her by.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她感到她的朋友回避她。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If small mistakes are passed by, they may lead to more serious ones.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 小错不改, 将会酿成大错。</font><br>以…为人所知<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He passed by the name of Baker for many years.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 多年来他一直化名为贝克。</font><br>\n

pass off	<h3>pass off</h3>逐渐消失<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I often get headaches, but they seem to pass off in a little while.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我常常头痛, 但不一会儿就好了。</font><br>发生; 进行<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The celebration passed off successfully.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 庆祝活动圆满结束。</font><br>转移注意<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Whenever someone else raised the subject, he would pass it off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 每当别人提起这个话题, 他就将话题引开。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His rude remark was passed off by the host.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 主人并没有把他粗鲁的话放在心上。</font><br>冒充; 假装为<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He passed his wife off as a famous film star.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他让妻子冒充一个著名的电影明星。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He passed off this theory as his own.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他谎称这一理论是由他自己提出来的。</font><br>\n
pass on	<h3>pass on</h3>前进; 继续下去<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He stopped for a moment, and then passed on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他停了一会儿, 又向前走去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let's pass on to the next subject now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 现在让我们来继续讨论下一个议题。</font><br>对…发表(意见); 作(判断)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The judges passed on each contestant.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 裁判员对每一位参赛者加以品评。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can't pass an opinion on your works without seeing it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我没有看到你的作品, 不能发表意见。</font><br>传递; 传授<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Would you please pass the dictionary on to Mary?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请你把这本词典传给玛丽, 行吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The story is passed on from generation to generation in the village.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这故事在村民中世代相传。</font><br>去世<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He passed on in his sleep.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在睡眠中死去。</font><br>\n
pass out	<h3>pass out</h3>〈口〉昏厥, 失去知觉; 喝得烂醉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She passed out when she heard the tragic news.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当她听到这悲惨的消息时, 一下子晕倒了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If I had taken one more drink, I would have passed out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我再多喝一杯酒就会烂醉如泥。</font><br>分配; 分发<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The teacher began to pass out the papers at 8:15.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 8点15分老师开始发卷。</font><br>毕业; 通过考试<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How many of the young men passed out this year?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今年有多少年轻人毕业?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Polly is due to pass out from training college at the end of July.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 波利七月底将从训练学院毕业。</font><br>\n
pass over	<h3>pass over</h3>置之不理, 忽视<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't pass any detail over.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要忽视任何细节。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let us pass over his rude remarks in silence.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 对他粗暴无礼的话我们不去理会算了。</font><br>去世<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The poet passed over early in life.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这位诗人英年早逝。</font><br>\n
Passover	<h3>Passover</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>逾越节,逾越节祭神的羔羊<br>\n
pass up	<h3>pass up</h3>〈口〉错过<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's a pity that Mike passed up such a good opportunity.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 迈克错过了这么好的一个机会, 真是可惜。</font><br>\n
