patch together	<h3>patch together</h3>匆匆做成, 拼凑成<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He patched together a mask for the fancy party.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他为参加化装舞会匆匆制作了一个假面具。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She succeeded in patching the broken vase together.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她成功地把打破的花瓶拼凑好了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A peace treaty was patched together on the same day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在同一天里, 一个和平条约草草地签订了。</font><br>\n

pick at	<h3>pick at</h3>扯, 拉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sick man picked at the blanket.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 病人拉扯着毯子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He sat there ruminating and picking at the tablecloth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他坐在那儿沉思, 轻轻地抚弄着桌布。</font><br>找茬儿; 批评<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Leave the child alone; you're always picking at her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要管那孩子, 你总是找她的茬儿。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mother constantly picked at him for being sloppy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 母亲不断地批评他懒散。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She'd been picked at so often by parents and teachers that she didn't know how to behave.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 家长和老师经常对她求全责备, 她简直不知怎么办才好。</font><br>少量地吃<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sick boy was only picking at his food.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个有病的孩子只吃了几口饭。</font><br>\n

pick off	<h3>pick off</h3>摘去<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't pick off any of these flowers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些花一朵也不要采摘。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He picked off the burs that had stuck to his overcoat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他摘下粘在外衣上的刺果。</font><br>逐个毁掉; 瞄准射死<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A sniper behind the bushes picked off three of our men.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 藏在树丛后面的一个狙击手射死了我方三个人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Over the years, he's picked off his competitors so that he now has a virtual monopoly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 几年来, 他一个一个地战胜了他的竞争对手, 现已实际上成了垄断者。</font><br>\n
pick on	<h3>pick on</h3>挑选<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I know someone has to fetch some more logs, but why pick on me?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我知道得有人再去捡些木柴, 但为什么挑上了我?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Why do you always pick on me to do the unpleasant jobs?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你为什么老是找我干这些令人不愉快的工作?</font><br>招惹, 找茬儿; 责备<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The older boys always picked on the younger ones.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大孩子总是招惹小的孩子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She felt that her teacher was always picking on her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她觉得老师老是找她麻烦。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp In the assignment of various sorts of work, none of them felt as if they were being picked on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在分配各项工作时, 他们中间没有人觉得自己受到亏待。</font><br>\n
pick out	<h3>pick out</h3>取出, 去掉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The child refuses to eat this fruit without first picking out the stones.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不把果核取出来, 那个小孩就不会吃这水果。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They had to stop to pick out thorns from their feet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们只得停下来把脚上的刺拔去。</font><br>挑选, 选择; 选拔<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They have picked out the best items on the menu.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们从菜单上选出最好的菜。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let's pick out the bad potatoes from the basket.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 让我们把坏掉的土豆从篮子里挑出来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We must pick out the enemy's weakest units for attack.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们必须找敌人最薄弱的部队攻击。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was picked out from the whole class to represent them at the other school.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 从全班中选出她来作为去另一学校的代表。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Pick me out a dozen apples.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 给我挑一打苹果。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Pick out a dozen oranges for me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 给我挑一打橘子。</font><br>分辨出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There were so many people at the conference that I couldn't pick him out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 参加会议的人太多了, 我没法认出他。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He picked out a friend's face in the crowd.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在人群中认出了一位朋友的脸。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her house is easily picked out from the rest; it has a large black gate.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的住宅很容易和其他的区别开来, 有一个黑色的大门。</font><br>了解; 领会<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I picked out the meaning of the passage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我领会了这段文章的含义。</font><br>衬托, 点缀, 使明显<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The design was picked out in the bright red.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这图案在鲜红色衬托下很显眼。</font><br>凭听觉〔记忆〕奏出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She tried to pick out the tune of a song she had heard on the radio.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她试图凭听觉记忆摸索着奏出那首她从广播里听到的歌曲。</font><br>\n
pick over	<h3>pick over</h3>挑出来<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He picked over the tomatoes, looking for the ripest ones.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把西红柿拿起来仔细看, 要挑选最熟的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You won't find any good tomatoes in that basket; they've been well picked over.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你在那只篮子里找不到好的西红柿了, 好的已被挑走了。</font><br>老谈, 老想<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't keep picking over our old quarrels; let's be friends again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要老谈以前争吵的事了, 让我们重新做朋友吧!</font><br>\n

pick up	<h3>pick up</h3>拾起, 捡起; 抬起<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He picked up the child and put her on his shoulders.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他抱起孩子, 让她骑在自己的肩膀上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I picked up your book by mistake.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我拿错了你的书。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I would have picked it up if I had noticed it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我如果看见的话, 我早就把它拣起来了。</font><br>安排接取; 使搭乘; 搭救<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The ship calls at each port on this coast to pick up passengers and mail.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那艘轮船在沿海每个港口停下, 搭载乘客和接取邮件。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please wait at the school gate. John will pick you up there.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请在校门口等候, 约翰会到那里接你。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The shipwrecked sailors were picked up by a passing boat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一艘过路的船只搭救了遭受船难的水手。</font><br>爬〔站〕起来; 振作起来<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His spirits picked up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的精神振奋起来了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Pick yourself up and brush yourself down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 自己爬起来, 把衣服掸干净。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's hard to pick yourself up after such a terrible shock.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 经历这样可怕的打击后, 就很难再振奋起来了。</font><br>使增加〔加快〕<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The car began to pick up the moment the vehicle got onto the motorway.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一开上高速公路, 车子的速度就加快了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The car picks up speed with just a touch of the accelerator.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这辆车只要你一触加速器就会加速。</font><br>收拾东西〔屋子〕<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Children, it's time to pick up and have supper.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们, 该收拾吃晚饭了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Pick up your room before you go out, please.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请在离开之前整理好房间。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The room must be picked up before the guests arrive.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个房间在客人到达之前必须收拾出来。</font><br>掘, 挖<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The peasants were picking up in the field.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 农民们在田里翻地。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The man was picking up the ground very hard.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个人正在使劲地挖地。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The frozen ground will have to be picked up by hand before machine digging can begin.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这冻土必须挖过后才能用掘土机掘土。</font><br>染上<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He must have picked up a cold—he's begun to snuffle.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他开始鼻塞, 一定是感冒了。</font><br>捉住, 逮住<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was implicated in a murder, and sooner or later they would pick him up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他和一宗凶杀案有牵连, 迟早他们会逮捕他的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is picked up on a charge of killing a man.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他因犯有杀人罪而被逮捕。</font><br>好转; 恢复<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When is the weather going to pick up? It's been bad for weeks.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 天气什么时候转好?几周来一直很糟糕。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Trade has been slack for the past six months, but it is now picking up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在过去六个月中贸易一直不景气, 但现在状况正在好转。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has picked up slowly since he came out of hospital.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他自出院以来, 身体恢复得很慢。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The writer's personal appearance picked up the sales of the book considerably.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那位作家亲自到场, 使那本书的销售量大增。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A bit of exercise will pick you up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你稍微运动运动就会恢复健康的。</font><br>\n

play along	<h3>play along</h3>等待回音或决定<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They have played me along for some time, without telling me what they really want to do.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们没有告诉我真正想要做什么, 使我焦急地等待了一段时间。</font><br>合作<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I am glad you've decided to play along.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我高兴的是你决定合作了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was in charge, so I had to play along with his ideas.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是负责人, 对他的念头我只好服从。</font><br>(使)沿…闪动, 荡漾<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sunlight played along the water ahead of us, making it difficult to see where the boat was going.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 阳光在我们眼前的水面上荡漾, 晃得我们都看不清小船向哪里驶去了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They played the water along the whole side of the burning building.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们向燃烧着的楼房的整面墙上喷射水柱。</font><br>\n
play around	<h3>play around</h3>玩耍<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Stop playing around and get on with the job.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别胡闹了, 接着工作吧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Tell the children not to play around the building.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 告诉这些孩子别在那栋建筑物附近玩耍。</font><br>\n
play at	<h3>play at</h3>玩…; 参加…<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The two retired workers are playing at chess.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 两个退休工人正在下棋。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Next week we will play at a football game.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 下周我们将参加一场足球比赛。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't play Father at cards—he always wins.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别和父亲打牌, 他总是赢。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp England are playing France at football tomorrow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 明天英格兰队同法国队进行足球比赛。</font><br>在…演奏; 扮演…<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A world-famous violinist is playing at tonight's concert.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一位世界闻名的小提琴家将在今晚的音乐会上演奏。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The band played excellent music at the children's show.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在儿童演出中, 这个乐队演奏了非常美妙的音乐。</font><br>在体育比赛中担任…<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is always playing at center.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一直踢中锋。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The captain wants to play Brown at left half in the next game.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 队长打算在下次比赛中让布朗踢左前卫。</font><br>假装…的游戏<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children were playing at keeping shop.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们在假装开店铺。</font><br>\n
playback	<h3>playback</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>录音重放,录音重放装置,重放<br>\n
play back	<h3>play back</h3>把…打回给对方<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He played the ball back close to the net.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把球击回到对方靠近球网的地方。</font><br>后退一步接球<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When a fast ball lands short of you, you have to play back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当一个快球靠近你着地时, 你得后退一步击球。</font><br>播放, 重播<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp To record, press these two buttons together; then rewind, and then press the red button to play back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 要录音就得一起按下这两个键, 而后倒回, 按下这个红键播放。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When I play back the text, please listen carefully to see whether there are any mispronunciations in it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我放课文录音时请仔细听着, 看里面有没有发音错误。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I played the music back to her.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我放音乐给她听。</font><br>\n
playboy	<h3>playboy</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>〈口〉寻欢作乐的女子,花花公子<br>\n
play down	<h3>play down</h3>轻描淡写, 故意缩小…的重要性<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She tried to play down his part in the affair.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她极力贬低他在这一事件中的作用。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Somehow Harriet always tried to play herself down to her friends.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不知为什么, 哈丽特总是竭力使自己在朋友们中间显得无足轻重似的。</font><br>和善地对待, 放低身价<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Politicians have to learn to play down to the voters.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政治家必须学会对选民放低身价。</font><br>\n

playoff	<h3>playoff</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>(双方得分相等时的)最后决赛<br>\n
play off against	<h3>play off against</h3>完成同其他优胜者的平分比赛<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The top teams in each group will play off seven games against each other.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 各组的优胜者还要相互比赛七次。</font><br>(使)相互争斗以坐收渔利<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She played her two rivals off against each other and got the job herself.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她挑拨两个对手相争, 自己却获得了那份工作。</font><br>\n
play on	<h3>play on</h3>在…玩<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The baby is playing on the ground.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 婴儿正在地上玩。</font><br>演奏…<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp While he sang, I played on the flute.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他唱歌, 我吹笛伴奏。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was playing an old tune on his flute.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他用笛子吹奏一首老曲子。</font><br>(使)在…荡漾; (使)喷射在…上<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The sunlight plays on water.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 阳光在水面上荡漾。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His mind played on the idea of going away for a holiday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他心里动着度假的念头。</font><br>对…加以利用<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The politician played on the patriotic sentiments of the people from ulterior motives.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个政客别有用心地利用人们的情绪。</font><br>\n
play on words	<h3>play on words</h3>双关语<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Much English humor consists of plays on words.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 许多英语幽默都运用了双关语。</font><br>\n
play out	<h3>play out</h3>在户外玩耍<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's too wet for the children to play out today; they'll have to amuse themselves indoors.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今天外面太潮, 孩子们不宜在户外玩耍, 他们得在室内玩了。</font><br>进行到底<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Shall we call it a draw, or play it out?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们是算平局呢还是继续比赛决出胜负?</font><br>演完, 做完<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When they played out, there was a smile on their faces.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当他们演完时, 他们的脸上露出了笑容。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children succeeded in playing out the comedy within two hours.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们成功地在两小时内演完那出喜剧。</font><br>以音乐送走<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The band played the guests out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 乐队奏乐送客。</font><br>逐渐放开<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The rubber hose is playing out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 卷着的橡皮管正在逐渐放开。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let's play out the rope.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 让我们把卷着的绳索放开。</font><br>疲倦; 用完<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We hope we have not yet played out our supplies.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们希望贮备的东西还没用完。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Having walked eighty miles that day, some of them were played out at the end.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那天走了80里, 结果他们中有几个人感到疲倦极了。</font><br>\n

It's your turn.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 加油啊!轮到你了。</font><br>夸大<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They criticized the lazybones for playing up his slight illness.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们批评那个懒汉夸大自己的小病而不肯干活。</font><br>为…做广告<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This new film will attract the crowds, whatever its quality, provided that it gets played up in the right way.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果广告做得好, 那么, 无论这部新片子的质量如何, 都会吸引许多观众的。</font><br>\n
play upon	<h3>play upon</h3>在…玩<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't play upon the carpet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别在地毯上玩。</font><br>演奏…<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp While he sang, I played upon the flute.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他唱歌, 我吹笛伴奏。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The girl is playing a popular tune upon the piano.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个女孩用钢琴演奏流行乐曲。</font><br>(使)在…荡漾; (使)喷射在…上<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A smile played upon her lips.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她双唇露出一丝微笑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They played water upon a fire.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们往火上喷水。</font><br>对…加以利用<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp By playing upon the old lady's fears, the criminals were able to persuade her to give them her money.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 罪犯们利用老太太恐惧的心理, 终于使她把钱交了出来。</font><br>\n

plough into	<h3>plough into</h3>用犁把…犁入土中<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After the wheat crop has been gathered, many farmers burn the remains and plough the ash into the soil, so as to enrich the soil.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 割完小麦后, 许多农夫把麦秸烧掉, 并把灰烬埋入土中, 以增加土壤肥力。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The stalks are left to be ploughed into the earth for the next planting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 作物的秆被留着以便犁入土中作下次播种的肥料。</font><br>积极投入工作<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He ploughed into his work and finished it in a few hours.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他起劲地工作, 几个小时就干完了。</font><br>冲入; 冲到<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The car ploughed into his garden wall.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那辆汽车撞在他的花园墙上。</font><br>对…进行投资<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The company ploughed a large sum into that project.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这家公司对那项工程进行了巨额投资。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The huge sums of money which were ploughed into the project soon began to pay off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 投资到这项工程的大笔钱没过多久便开始赢利。</font><br>\n

plough on	<h3>plough on</h3>继续用犁翻地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If we plough on until it's dark, we should get this field finished.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果我们一直犁到天黑, 就可以把这块地犁完了。</font><br>坚持不懈<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We must plough on somehow in spite of all the difficulties.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 尽管困难重重, 我们仍需坚持下去。</font><br>\n

plough up	<h3>plough up</h3>用犁将…翻起<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Farmers occasionally plough up old Indian relics.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 农夫们偶尔能犁出古老的印第安人遗物。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The meadow's been ploughed up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那片草地已用犁翻过。</font><br>用犁翻土, 像犁那样翻(地)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The wild boar ploughs the earth up like a furrow, and does irreparable damage in the cultivated lands.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这只公野猪把土翻得像犁沟似的, 给这些耕地造成了不可弥补的损失。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All the fields are now ploughed up, ready for the seeds.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 全部土地都翻耕过了, 准备播种。</font><br>\n

provide for	<h3>provide for</h3>为…提供生活费<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He had to provide for five children.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他要供养五个孩子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He worked hard to provide for his old age.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他努力工作为养老做准备。</font><br>为…作准备<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is highly important to provide for the future.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 预先做好准备非常重要。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I think we have provided for every possible hazard.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我认为我们已经准备好了应付每一种可能的危险。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Every possible risk has been provided for in this project.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 此方案对各种可能发生的风险都作了准备。</font><br>规定<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The agreement provided for a cease-fire.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 协议规定停火。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The plan provided for the rich to assist the poor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那项计划要求富人向穷人提供帮助。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These measures were provided for by law.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些措施是法律所规定的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The book being translated is provided for in your contract.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在你们的合同中已确定要翻译这本书。</font><br>\n

pull down	<h3>pull down</h3>毁坏, 拆毁<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They pulled down my old house and built five new ones.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们拆除了我的旧房子, 建起了五幢新房子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The firemen pulled down some nearby sheds to stop the fire spreading.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 消防队员们把附近的一些棚子拉倒, 不让火势蔓延。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His home was pulled down by fire.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的家被大火烧毁了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The old building has been pulled down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那座老建筑物已被拆毁。</font><br>使虚弱; 拖垮<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp An attack of fever soon pulled him down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 发高烧很快使他的身体衰弱下来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A really bad cold pulls you down and leaves you feeling very miserable.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一场真正的重感冒可以把你拖垮, 让你感到非常难受。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was pulled down by a sudden fever.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他突然发烧病倒了。</font><br>\n

pull in	<h3>pull in</h3>(火车)进站; (船)靠岸<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The train pulled in exactly on time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 列车准时进站。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The ship pulled in to the shore at midnight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那船半夜时靠岸。</font><br>赚钱<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's pulling in quite a bit in his new job.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他在新工作中赚了不少钱。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He pulls in quite a lot as a milkman.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他卖牛奶赚了相当多的钱。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He pulls in a lot of overtime pay each month.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他每月挣得不少加班费。</font><br>吸引; 招引<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The Beatles always pulled in enormous crowds.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 披头士乐队总能吸引大批的人群。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The film pulled in large audience when it was shown in the city.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那部影片在该市上映期间, 吸引了大批观众。</font><br>拘留, 逮捕(嫌疑犯)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police have pulled in a half dozen people who they suspect.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警方已逮捕六个他们怀疑的人。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The men were pulled in on suspicion of having committed a burglary.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些人因涉嫌犯有夜盗罪而被拘留。</font><br>节省, 节省开支<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You will have to pull in if you want to escape bankruptcy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果你想避免破产, 就必须节省开支。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If food is scarce it's no use complaining; we shall just have to pull in our belts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果食物短缺, 抱怨也没有用, 我们只能勒紧裤腰带。</font><br>\n

火车正点开出。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A lorry pulled out from a side street.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一辆卡车从一条小路上开出来。</font><br><i><font push on	<h3>push on</h3>继续向前, 坚决进行下去<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After a short rest the travelers pushed on towards the coast.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 旅行者稍稍休息后, 继续朝着海岸行进。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We must push on with our work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们必须努力把工作做下去。</font><br>用力推〔压〕…<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You have to push on the handle to turn it—it's very stiff.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 手柄很不灵活, 你必须用力推才能转动它。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The weight of the sleeping child's body was pushing on my arm and making it uncomfortable.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 熟睡的孩子的身体压在我胳膊上, 使我很不舒服。</font><br>把…强加于…<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They've been trying to push all the unpleasant jobs on me again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们一直想把所有讨厌的工作再次往我身上推。</font><br>\n

put back	<h3>put back</h3>放回原处<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The boy put the ink bottle back where it came from.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那男孩把墨水瓶放回原处。</font><br>拨回, 向后推<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You cannot put back the clock.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 时间是不会倒转的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The date had been put back from March to April.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 日期由三月推迟到四月。</font><br>\n
put by	<h3>put by</h3>储存, 存放在一边<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He put the idea by until he was at leisure to consider it carefully.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把这个念头放在一边, 到空闲时再去认真考虑它。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Whatever he got besides his basic salary was put by for his old age.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 凡是在基本工资以外的收入他都存起来以备年老时用。</font><br>\n
put down	<h3>put down</h3>放下<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Put down that book and help your mother with the dishes.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 放下那本书, 帮你母亲洗餐具。</font><br>平定, 镇压, 取缔<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They had to call the police in order to put down the riot.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们只得叫来警察以平定骚乱。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The uprising was put down with utmost ferocity.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 起义被极端残酷地镇压下去了。</font><br>记下, 写下<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let me put down your telephone number lest I forget it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 让我先记下你的电话号码, 以免忘了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Everything he said was put down at once.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他说的话马上被记了下来。</font><br>估计, 认为<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We put the boy down as nine years old.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们估计这男孩有九岁。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They put him down for a fool.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们认为他是个傻瓜。</font><br>归于<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I put his bad temper down to having had an unhappy childhood.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我把他的坏脾气归之于他有过不幸的童年。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The disease was put down to bad drinking water.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这疾病被认为是由劣质饮用水引起的。</font><br>\n
put down as	<h3>put down as</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>v.</i></font><br>估计,认为<br>\n

put forth	<h3>put forth</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>v.</i></font><br>放出,发表,颁布,提出,启航,生出<br>\n
put forward	<h3>put forward</h3>向前移<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Why don't you put your chair forward to get a better view?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你为什么不把椅子往前挪一点, 以便看得更清楚些?</font><br>将…提前<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We shall have to put the meeting forward.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们得把会议提前。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The attack had been put forward an hour.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 进攻提前了一小时。</font><br>将钟拨快<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Put your watch forward; it's five minutes slow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 将你的手表拨快些, 它慢了五分钟。</font><br>提出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He put forward a plan for the committee to consider.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他提出一项计划交由全体委员审议。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A suitable answer has already been put forward by the chairman.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一个合适的解决办法已由主席提出。</font><br>\n
put in	<h3>put in</h3>(使)在内; 把…放于…中<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He put his head in at the window.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他从窗口把头伸进来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Put sugar in coffee, please.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请把糖放在咖啡里。</font><br>打断, 插嘴<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “Don't forget us, ” she put in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp “别忘记我们。”她插进来说。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The teacher always puts in a good word for his former pupils.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个老师总是为他以前教过的学生说句好话。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp While they were discussing the car accident, Frank put in that the road was icy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当他们讨论这起车祸时, 弗兰克插嘴说路上覆盖着冰。</font><br>做, 履行<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She always puts in an hour's reading before breakfast.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 早饭前她总是读一小时书。</font><br>选举…执政; 任命<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He put in a caretaker.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他任命了一个管理员。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The candidate was put in by a majority of one thousand.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个候选人以一千票的多数当选。</font><br>在…上花费<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I've put a lot of work in improving my English.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我下了很大的工夫进修英文。</font><br>使处于某种状态<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His study is in chaos; it takes long time to put his papers in order.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的书房一片狼藉, 整理好他的文件要花好长时间。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The surprise attack put me in a fix.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这次突然袭击使我处于困境。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All goods should be put in order on the shelf before the supermarket opens.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 超级市场开门前, 所有的货物都必须整齐地排列在货架上。</font><br>\n
put off	<h3>put off</h3>延期<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They decided to put the meeting off until after Christmas.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们决定把会议推迟到圣诞节以后。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Owing to the state of the ground, the match has been put off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 由于场地状况不佳, 比赛推迟了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The appointment was put off because of his illness.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 由于他生病而推迟了约会。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you think you are sick you should not put off going to the doctor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果你觉得有病就不应该拖, 要快去看医生。</font><br>阻碍做某事<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I wanted to say something, but her face quite put me off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我本来要说几句, 但看到她的脸色, 又没有勇气开口了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We are going there tomorrow — not even bad weather could put us off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们明天要去那儿, 即使天气不好也要去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They had intended going into the country for the day, but were put off by reports of traffic jams.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们本来打算那天到乡下去, 但听说交通拥挤就作罢了。</font><br>(停车)让某人下<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Ask the conductor to put you off at the Odeon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 告诉售票员在奥汀提醒你下车。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Where do you want to be put off?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你在哪儿下车?</font><br>使分心<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I don't like music playing when I'm working. It puts me off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不喜欢工作时放音乐, 那会使我分心。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If I am once put off I find it very difficult to recapture the same train of thought.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我一旦受到打扰, 发觉自己很难回到原来的思路上来。</font><br>关掉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please put off all the lights as you leave the building.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 离开这所房子时, 请你把所有的灯都关上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Under the official regulations the central heating was put off on March 15th each year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 据正式规定, 每年3月15日停止供应暖气。</font><br>敷衍, 推诿<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When he asked her to name a day for their wedding, she put him off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当他要她订个结婚的日子时, 她却支支吾吾不说。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm not going to be put off with that excuse.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不会被那个借口敷衍过去的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I won't be put off with such vague promises.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种含糊的诺言是敷衍不了我的。</font><br>脱去(衣、帽等)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please put off your shoes before entering this holy building.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在进入这所神圣的殿堂之前, 请把鞋脱掉。</font><br>丢弃, 摆脱<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You must put off your doubts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你必须消除你的疑虑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He had put off all personal cares.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他已摆脱了一切个人的牵累。</font><br>\n
put on	<h3>put on</h3>穿上, 戴上; 把…放在…上<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He put on his best clothes for the party.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 为参加晚会他穿上了最好的衣服。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He put on his hat and went out of the office without a word.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他戴上帽子, 一言未发走出了办公室。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The trees have put on their new coats of green.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 树木披上了新绿。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Put the plates gently on the table, they are very delicate.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把碟子轻轻放在桌上, 这些碟子非常易碎。</font><br>上演, 演出; 展览<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They are going to put on Hamlet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们将上演《哈姆雷特》。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We are going to put on an exhibition of cultural relics next Tuesday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们下周二要举办一个文物展览。</font><br>假装, 装出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He puts on a smile which makes other people feel be.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他装出一副笑脸, 这使人们更信任他。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her modesty is all put on; at heart she is very vain.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的谦逊全是假装的, 内心里她是很虚荣的。</font><br>增加; 增加(费用)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has put on weight during the last two months.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他上两个月里体重增加了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The rise in taxation will put pounds on the cost of living.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 提高税收将使生活费用大大增加。</font><br>打开<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She put the radio on to listen to the news.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她打开收音机收听新闻。</font><br>做饭菜<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He put the lunch on immediately after he came home.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一回到家他就开始做饭。</font><br>装(船、火车、飞机)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The workers are bringing things to put on the ship.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 工人正在运货装船。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fishermen are putting on their boat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 渔民们正在装船。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Extra buses are put on during rush hours.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 高峰期间增开公共汽车。</font><br>押赌注<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Many people are putting their money on Jim to win the race.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 许多人下了赌注, 认为吉姆会赢得这场赛跑比赛。</font><br>强使承担(责任等)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Why are you trying to put the blame on me?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你为什么总想把责任推到我身上呢?</font><br>分配任务<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Who are you putting on the special report?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你让谁作那个专门的报告呢?</font><br>\n
put out	<h3>put out</h3>伸出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's rude to put out your tongues at people.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 对人吐舌头是不礼貌的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp As the spring is coming, all the trees are beginning to put out green buds.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 春天来了, 树木都开始吐出绿色的嫩芽。</font><br>扑灭; 熄灭<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They quickly put out the fire.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们迅速将火扑灭。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Smoking is forbidden here. Please put your cigarette out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这里禁止吸烟, 请将您的烟熄灭。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The fire was soon put out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 火很快就扑灭了。</font><br>生产; 制造<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The engine puts out thirty horsepower.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这台发动机可产生30马力。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This engine puts out more electric current than the other one.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这台发电机比另一台发的电多。</font><br>出版; 发行; 发布<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They have already put out a new periodical.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们已经出版了一种新的期刊。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government will put out a new statement tomorrow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府将于明天发布一项新声明。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This magazine is put out every Friday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这份杂志每星期五出版。</font><br>驶出, 离开<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A coast guard boat put out through the waves.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一艘海岸巡逻舰破浪驶离海岸。</font><br>把…送到外面去做<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We put out the washing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们把要洗的衣服送到洗衣店去洗。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All repairs are done on the premises and not put out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 全部修缮都在家里进行, 不用送到外面去做。</font><br>\n

puzzle out	<h3>puzzle out</h3>推测出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's good for students to puzzle things out for themselves.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 让学生们自己思索解决难题很有好处。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I've never been able to puzzle her out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我一直对她捉摸不透。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We finally puzzled out how to open the box.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们最后终于想出怎样打开盒子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I've been trying to puzzled out which piece of work is most urgent.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我一直想弄清楚哪一件工作最紧迫。</font><br>\n

reckon on	<h3>reckon on</h3>〈非正〉指望, 信赖〔依靠〕…<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You can always reckon on Jim; he'll never fail you.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你总是可以相信吉姆, 他绝不会辜负你。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'd like to come with you but that's not a promise—don't reckon on it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我愿意与你一起去, 但这不算允诺, 别指望我一定来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't reckon on going abroad this summer, we may not be able to afford it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别指望今年夏天出国了, 我们可能负担不起费用。</font><br>\n
reckon with	<h3>reckon with</h3>用…来计算<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We reckon your pay with our adding machine.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们用加算器来计算你的薪金。</font><br>面对, 正视〔认真对待〕(某人)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I wouldn't like to reckon with the manager when he's in a bad temper.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 经理脾气不好时我不愿同他打交道。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Women have become a force to be reckoned with in the affairs of the world.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在世界事务中, 妇女已成为一支不可忽视的力量。</font><br>认真考虑(某事)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We must reckon with all possible difficulties when we are considering the cost of the contract.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们考虑合同费用时必须认真考虑所有潜在的困难。</font><br>对付、处理〔战胜〕困难<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After all the suffering that you have had to reckon with in the past, your present struggle will seem easy.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在你战胜了过去种种磨难之后, 你目前的斗争看来是容易的。</font><br>〈非正〉惩罚(某人)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'll reckon with that boy when he gets home!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 等那孩子回家后, 我要惩罚他!</font><br>\n
reckon without	<h3>reckon without</h3>〈非正〉忽略(某情况或某人); 没把(某因素或某人)考虑在内<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We had hoped to hold the garden party this weekend, but we reckoned without the weather!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们原想在本周末举行游园会, 但忽略了天气的因素!</font><br>\n

run down	<h3>run down</h3>停止走动, 用完<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That clock ran down hours ago.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那座钟在几小时以前就停了。</font><br>撞倒, 撞沉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was so foggy that the steamship almost ran down a small boat leaving the port.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 雾很大, 汽艇差点把一只正在离港的小船撞沉。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mr. Block ran a boy down this afternoon.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 布拉克先生今天下午把一个男孩撞倒了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The old man was run down by a big lorry.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个老人被一辆大卡车撞倒了。</font><br>诽谤, 贬低<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's always running me down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他总是讲我的坏话。</font><br>走下坡路, 垮掉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The coal industry is running down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 煤矿业正在逐渐走下坡路。</font><br>(使)虚弱, 疲乏<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This exhausting work is enough to run everyone down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这项费力的工作足以使人精疲力竭。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is quite run down and needs a vacation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的身体太虚弱, 需要休假。</font><br>\n

run out	<h3>run out</h3>用完, 耗尽<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our food soon ran out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的粮食很快就吃完了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He ran himself out in the first few circles.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他才跑了几圈就没力气了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The soldiers ran out of ammunition and had to withdraw.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 士兵们用光了弹药, 不得不撤退。</font><br>结束, 期满<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When does the lease of the house run out?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这房子的租约何时到期?</font><br>流走, 流掉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The water is running out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 水流出来了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The water runs out of the pipe into the bucket.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 水从管子流入桶里。</font><br>\n
run over	<h3>run over</h3>造访; 驱车送<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Will you run over to the shop and get some butter?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你到铺子里去买点黄油好吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let's run over to the Browns' this evening.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今晚咱们开车去布朗家吧。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't get a bus. I'll run you over to the theatre.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要去坐公共汽车了, 我开车送你去剧场。</font><br>溢出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bath water is running over.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 浴缸的水溢出来了。</font><br>撞倒, 撞翻并轧过其身体的一部分<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The jeep ran him over.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 吉普车把他撞了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This box looks as if it's been run over by a bus.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个箱子好像被公共汽车撞翻过似的。</font><br>\n

run through	<h3>run through</h3>跑着穿过…<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Running through the forest in the dark, the boys were greatly afraid.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们在黑暗中穿过树林, 心里非常害怕。</font><br>(使)在…流过<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The river runs through several underground caves which store the water for the city's use.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这条河流经几处贮存城市用水的地下蓄水池。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Run lots of soapy water through the pipe to clean it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 用大量的肥皂水把管子里面冲洗干净。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Father told me to unblock the pipe to let the water run through.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 父亲叫我把管子打通, 让水流过去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Run some clean water through and then you'll see its true color.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 让一些清水从中流过, 你就会看出它的真正颜色了。</font><br>匆匆查阅<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please run through these names again from the top of the list.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请将这些名字从头至尾再看一遍。</font><br>贯穿<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A feeling of sadness runs through his poetry.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一种悲伤感贯穿于他的诗歌。</font><br>\n

run up	<h3>run up</h3>升起<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They ran up a flag in honor of the president's visit.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 为了欢迎总统的来访, 他们升起了一面旗子。</font><br>(使)增长<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His debts ran up alarmingly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的债务惊人地增长。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She ran up a big bill at a hotel.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她很快就积欠了一大笔旅馆的账。</font><br>迅速地登上; 沿…迅速地移动<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A sudden pain ran up her leg.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一阵突然的疼痛顺着她的腿蔓延开来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The insect ran up my leg.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 小虫子爬到我腿上来了。</font><br>\n

这条河平均流量为每秒二百立方米。</font><br>瞬间, 一会儿<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He said he will be back in a few seconds.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他说他一会儿就回来。</font><br><font quality ingredients to build building.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们决不使用次等材料用于建筑。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adv.</i></font><br>其次, 以第二位<br><i><font sell out	<h3>sell out</h3>出售股份<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I've decided to sell out and go and live in the country.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我决定卖掉股份, 去乡村生活。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She had decided to sell out her share of the company.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她决定出售她在公司的股份。</font><br>脱销, 卖掉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All the tickets for the last performance have sold out already.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 最近一场演出的票已经全部卖光。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The shop sold out all its shirts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那家商店把所有的衬衫都卖光了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The match tickets were completely sold out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 比赛的门票全部售完了。</font><br>〈非正〉背叛, 出卖<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was a good writer, but he sold out and now just writes for money.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他曾是个好作家, 但后来背弃了原则, 现在只是为钱而写作了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He will never sell out his friends.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他绝不会出卖朋友。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They accused him of selling out the interests of the people.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们指责他出卖人民的利益。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was sold out by a traitor and arrested.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他被叛徒出卖而被捕了。</font><br>\n

send down	<h3>send down</h3>使下降<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The storm sent the temperature down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 暴风雨使气温下降。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Bad news sent market prices down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 坏消息使市场价格降低了。</font><br>把…开除出学校; 勒令…停学<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The university authorities sent the student down for the rest of the term.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大学当局勒令这个学生停学到学期结束。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp As a result of the inquiry, two students have been sent down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 调查结果, 两个学生被开除了。</font><br>\n
send for	<h3>send for</h3>召唤, 派人去叫; 派人去取<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The boss has sent for me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老板派人叫我。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Leave this house now, or I will send for the police.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你现在就离开这房子, 否则我叫警察了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They sent for him to build the house.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们派人叫他去建房子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mother sent my brother for the luggage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 妈妈派哥哥去取行李。</font><br>申请; 订购<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I have sent for a dozen copies of the book.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这本书我订购了12本。</font><br>\n

send-off	<h3>send-off</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>送别,送行<br>\n
send off	<h3>send off</h3>为…送行<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There was a large crowd to send him off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一大群人为他送行。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mary complained about getting up early in the morning to send her husband off to work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 玛丽抱怨早晨得早起送丈夫去上班。</font><br>寄出; 发出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Why haven't you got my letter? I sent it off last week.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你为什么还没有收到我的信?我上星期就寄出去了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Light and heat are sent off, together with heavy smoke, and soon only black charcoal is left.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 光和热随着浓烟一起发出, 不久就只剩下黑色的木炭了。</font><br>派往; 运出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His teacher sent him off to the principal's office.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的老师派他到校长室去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please send the goods off today.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请于今天把货物运出。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Troops were being sent off to the front.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 军队正被派往前线。</font><br>\n
send on	<h3>send on</h3>邮寄, 发送; 转寄<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I've already sent on my luggage.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我已经将行李寄出。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If any letters come after you've left, I'll send them on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果你离开后有信来了, 我会转寄给你。</font><br>使继续下去<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They sent him on although he was ill.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 虽然他有病, 但他们还是让他继续表演。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You should never have sent on so inexperienced a player.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你不该让这样一个无经验的人上场。</font><br>派…参加(某事)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mother sends my brother on errands.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 母亲常派我弟弟去办事。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The government has sent a delegation on friendly visits to some countries in Europe.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 政府已派代表团去欧洲一些国家进行友好访问。</font><br>\n
send out	<h3>send out</h3>发送; 发出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They sent out invitations to many people.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们向许多人发了请帖。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All the stars send out light and heat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 所有的恒星都会发出光和热。</font><br>长出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The trees are sending out new leaves.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 树木长出新叶。</font><br>散布; 派遣<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The company is sending out leaflets to all its contacts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 公司将把传单发送给所有的有关单位。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They were sent out as our representatives.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们是作为我们的代表被派出去的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He often sent them out to make investigations.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他常常派他们出去作调查。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They sent him out to get the newspaper.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们派他去取报纸。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The team sent some people out hunting and they bagged a wild boar.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那支队伍派了一些人去打猎, 他们打了一头野猪。</font><br>\n

send up	<h3>send up</h3>发射, 把…向上送; 使向上升<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The burning firewood sent up clouds of smoke.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 燃烧着的木柴冒出滚滚浓烟。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Many countries have sent up man-made satellites to circle the earth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 许多国家已经发射人造卫星围绕地球运转。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Yet another spaceship has been sent up recently.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 最近又发射了一艘宇宙飞船。</font><br>毁坏<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our bombers sent the bridge up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的轰炸机把桥炸毁了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The whole building was sent up in flames when the petrol exploded.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 汽油爆炸时, 整个楼房都被大火烧毁了。</font><br>使沿…上升, 上行<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When the doctor arrives, send him up the stairs, will you?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 大夫到后, 让他到楼上来, 好吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Two men were sent up the mountain while the main party of climbers remained at base camp.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 两个人被派上山, 而大部分登山队员留在大本营。</font><br>\n

show up	<h3>show up</h3>显而易见; 使显示出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A police put some chemicals on the piece of paper and a line of words showed up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一位警察在一张条上涂上化学药品, 一行字迹清晰地显现出来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her wrinkles showed up in the strong sunlight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 强烈的阳光使她脸上的皱纹更明显了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The quiz showed up Cane's weak points in physics.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这次测验看出了凯恩在物理学方面的弱点。</font><br>到场, 出席<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He showed up when we least expected him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们根本没有料到, 他竟然来了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He promised to come on Tuesday but he never showed up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他答应星期二来, 可是一直未露面。</font><br>羞辱, 使丢脸<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He showed his parents up rather badly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他给他父母丢尽了脸。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't show us up by wearing something absurd.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别穿些可笑的东西给我们丢脸。</font><br>\n

take apart	<h3>take apart</h3>拆开; 拆卸<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's easy to take a watch apart but difficult to put it together again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把表拆开容易, 装起来难。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Pat took apart the TV set and spread the bits all over the carpet.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 帕特拆开电视机, 把零件散置在地毯上。</font><br>\n
take away	<h3>take away</h3>拿开, 拿走<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Who has taken my dictionary away?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 谁把我的字典拿走了?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Not to be taken away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要拿走。</font><br>把…带走; 使离开<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A maid came to take away the tray.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一个女仆进来拿走了托盘。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They took the injured away in an ambulance.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们用救护车把受伤的人运走。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The prisoner was taken away by an armed guard.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一个持枪的狱警把犯人带走了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The box of matches was taken away from the baby.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 把那盒火柴从宝宝那里拿开。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The children were taken away from that school.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 孩子们被从那所学校带走了。</font><br>使停止; 转移<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'll give you some tablets to take away the pain.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我给你些药片止痛。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This drug should help to take the pain away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这药可以止痛。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm sorry, my attention was taken away for a moment.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 对不起, 刚才我走神了。</font><br>减去<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Take away ２ from ４ and you get ２.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 四减二等于二。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 30 take away 6 leaves 24.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 30减去6还剩下24。</font><br>剥夺; 夺取; 抢夺<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp No government shall take away the rights of the native people.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 任何政府也不能剥夺土著人的权利。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't let him take away your freedom to think for yourself.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别让他夺去你独立思考的自由。</font><br>〈非正〉使大吃一惊<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The shock of the news quite took my breath away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这突如其来的消息简直让我惊喜不已。</font><br>\n

take down	<h3>take down</h3>拆卸<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They are taking down the old building.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们正在拆毁旧建筑物。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The machine has been taken down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 机器已拆下来了。</font><br>记录, 记下<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The reporters took down the speech in shorthand.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 记者们迅速记下讲话的内容。</font><br>\n

take in	<h3>take in</h3>欺骗; 使上当<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The salesman finds it easy to take in old ladies.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个推销员发现老太太们容易上当受骗。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you trust him, you will certainly be taken in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果你相信他, 你一定会受骗。</font><br>领会; 理解<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I wonder if he's really taking it in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想知道他是否真正明白了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The lecturer had the feeling that a good deal of what he said had not been taken in by the students.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 演讲人觉得他说的许多话学生都没有领会。</font><br>接待; 收留<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He had nowhere to go, so I took him in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他无处可去, 所以我收留了他。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp My house is full; I can't take in any more guests.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的房子已客满, 不能再容纳更多的客人了。</font><br>包括<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The study of physics takes in many difficult subjects.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 物理的学习包括许多困难的方面。</font><br>吸入<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The boat is taking in water!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 船进水啦!</font><br>\n

takeoff	<h3>takeoff</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>(飞机的)起飞; (航天器的)升空<br>起跳<br>(对某人习惯动作的)滑稽模仿<br>\n
take off	<h3>take off</h3>拿走, 取下; 去掉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can't take the lid off, it's stuck!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这盖子卡住了, 我拿不下来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Help me to take this handle off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 帮我把这握柄取下来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Last night's strong wind nearly took the roof off!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 昨夜的大风差一点把屋顶刮掉了。</font><br>脱去<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can't take my boots off, they're so tight!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 靴子太紧了, 我脱不下来!</font><br>截断, 切除<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm afraid the disease can't be stopped, so we shall have to take your leg off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 恐怕这病情控制不住了, 我们得把你的一条腿截肢。</font><br>(使)离开<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'll take off now, and see you later.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我现在就要走了, 回头见。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The director has taken the visitors off to his office.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 经理把客人带到他办公室去了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I think I'll take myself off now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我想我现在就得走。</font><br>起跳; 起飞<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The tiger took off from the ground with a powerful spring.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老虎从地上猛地一跃而起。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Watch that bird taking off from the branch!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 注意看那只鸟从枝头飞起来!</font><br>(飞机)起飞<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's exciting to feel the plane taking off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 感觉到飞机起飞令人兴奋。</font><br>发起<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The attack will take off from our position near the harbor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 此次攻击将从我们在港口附近的阵地上发动。</font><br>使停运; 使停航<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The early morning train is being taken off for the summer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 早班火车夏季将停运。</font><br>减轻(体重)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm so pleased that I've been able to take off all that weight and get into my good clothes again!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的体重终于减轻, 那些漂亮的衣服又合身了, 我真高兴!</font><br>〈非正〉走开, 离开<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They took themselves off without saying good-bye.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们没有告辞就走了。</font><br>\n
take-off	<h3>take-off</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>起飞<br>\n
take on	<h3>take on</h3>承担<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He is always ready to take on heavy responsibilities.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一向乐于挑重担。</font><br>呈现<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The old factory has taken on a new look.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这家老厂已呈现出一派新面貌。</font><br>雇用<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They no longer have to take on large numbers of temporary workers to do the harvesting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们再也不必雇用大量临时工来收割农作物。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp No more workers are being taken on at present.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 目前不雇请更多的工人。</font><br>\n

take out	<h3>take out</h3>把…带出去<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please take the children out, their noise is making my head ache.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请把孩子们领出去, 他们吵得我头痛。</font><br>清除, 除掉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There's a nasty mark on the tablecloth, and I don't think the usual washing powder will take it out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 桌布上有一块污迹, 我想用普通洗衣粉是洗不掉的。</font><br>获取, 办理<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Mary and John took out a marriage license.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 玛丽和约翰取得一份结婚证书。</font><br>邀请(某人)外出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He took her out for dinner.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他带她出去吃饭。</font><br>\n
take out on	<h3>take out on</h3>发泄<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Why do you always take your annoyance out on me?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 为什么你不高兴时总是对我出气?</font><br>\n
take over	<h3>take over</h3>接管; 接替<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The strikers took over the factories.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 罢工工人接管了工厂。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She took over his work after his departure.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他离开以后, 她接替了他的工作。</font><br>带, 领…到另一地<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He took us over to the window.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他带我们到窗户旁。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He took his son over this road.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他带他的儿子穿过这条马路。</font><br>在…上花费<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I have taken two years over this book.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我花了两年写这本书。</font><br>帮…学习<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He took me over my lines.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他帮我练习台词。</font><br>领(某人)参观<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He will take the visitors over these rooms.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他要带我们参观这些屋子。</font><br>\n
take to	<h3>take to</h3>喜欢, 习惯于…<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I soon took to her children.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 很快我就喜欢上她的几个孩子了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We took to his idea.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们赞赏他的主意。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Now we have renovated our old bathroom, my husband has taken to having a shower every morning.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 因为我们已整修翻新了我们的旧浴室, 我丈夫已习惯于每天早晨淋浴。</font><br>开始从事<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He gave up medicine and took to literature.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他放弃医学, 开始从事文学。</font><br>觉得(某事)容易学<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He took to French as though it had been his native language.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他觉得法语就像母语一样容易学。</font><br>\n
take up	<h3>take up</h3>拿起; 抱起<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He took up telephone receiver and began to dial.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他拿起电话听筒开始拨号码。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She takes up a child under each arm.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她一手抱起一个孩子。</font><br>占去<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I won't take up much of your time.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不会占用你很多时间。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This thing takes up all my attention.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这件事占用我所有的注意力。</font><br>接受(提议)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'd like to take up your offer of a ride into town.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我愿接受你的邀请, 搭你的车进城。</font><br>继续<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I put the telephone down and took up my work again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我放下电话继续干我的活。</font><br>\n
