throw aside	<h3>throw aside</h3>把…扔在一旁<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He threw aside all good proposals.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他拒绝了所有好的建议。</font><br>\n
throwaway	<h3>throwaway</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>(使用后抛弃的)广告传单,散单,宣传小册子<br>\n
throw away	<h3>throw away</h3>扔掉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What a waste to throw it away!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 扔掉它多浪费!</font><br>浪费; 错过<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has thrown away a good opportunity.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他已失去了一个良好的机会。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All his efforts were thrown away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的努力都白费了。</font><br>\n
throw back	<h3>throw back</h3>掷回, 丢回<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A spectator threw the ball back to the players.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一个观众把球掷回给球员。</font><br>推迟, 阻止<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The cold he caught threw back his recovery from rheumatism.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 感冒拖延了他风湿病痊愈的时间。</font><br>迫使(某人)依靠(某事物)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The shortage of gas has thrown us back on the use of bicycles.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 由于汽油短缺, 我们只好用自行车作交通工具。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her friends had deserted her, and she was thrown back on her own resources.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的朋友们都抛弃了她, 因此她只得依靠自己了。</font><br>\n
throwback	<h3>throwback</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>掷回,挫折,阻止,大倒退,返祖<br>\n
throw down	<h3>throw down</h3>扔下, 使倒下<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He threw down the book and went out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他扔下书就出去了。</font><br>推翻, 摧毁<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They plotted to throw down the government.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们密谋推翻政府。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The city was thrown down during the siege.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在围城过程中, 这座城市被摧毁了。</font><br>抛弃, 拒绝<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He threw his girlfriend down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他抛弃了他的女朋友。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has thrown down a good offer.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他拒绝了一个很好的提议。</font><br>\n
throw in	<h3>throw in</h3>把…扔进…<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After reading the letter, he threw it in the waste-paper basket.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他看完信之后, 把它扔进了字纸篓。</font><br>添上, 附带奉送<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp John threw in a couple of tires when he sold his bicycle.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 约翰卖掉自行车并免费送两个轮胎。</font><br>把…插入讨论、计划等<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The diplomat threw in a joke, and the tension was instantly relieved.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那位外交官插进一个笑话, 紧张的气氛顿时缓和下来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She threw in that she must resign.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她插嘴说她必须辞职。</font><br>\n
thrown	<h3>thrown</h3>throw的过去分词<br>\n
throw off	<h3>throw off</h3>迅速脱掉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He threw off his coat and started to work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把外衣一脱就开始干了起来。</font><br>摆脱<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It took me a week to throw off my cold.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我的感冒过了一周才算好了。</font><br>\n
throw out	<h3>throw out</h3>拒绝; 否决<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The suggestion was made at the conference, but they threw it out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个建议在会上提出来了, 但他们不予考虑。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The case was thrown out of court because of insufficient evidence.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 由于证据不足, 法庭对此案不予受理。</font><br>提出(暗示、建议等)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He threw out a hint regarding bonuses at the end of the year.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他暗示了有关年终奖的事。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Several suggestions for possible examination questions were thrown out by the teacher.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老师就哪些问题可能作为试题作了几点提示。</font><br>\n
throw together	<h3>throw together</h3>仓促地集成; 集合<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Chance had thrown us together at a skiing resort.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 机缘使我们在一个滑雪胜地相遇。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They were thrown together by a common interest.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 共同的兴趣使他们走到了一起。</font><br>\n
throw up	<h3>throw up</h3>把…向上抛〔推, 举〕<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp All the crowd cheered and threw their hats up in the air.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 整个人群都欢呼起来, 把帽子抛向空中。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The baby loved being thrown up into the air and safely caught again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这婴儿喜欢被抛起来再被稳稳地接住。</font><br>呕吐<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Just the thought of eating snakes makes me want to throw up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 只要一想到吃蛇, 我就想呕吐。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp When I get seasick, I throw up my food.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我一晕船就呕吐。</font><br>放弃<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She began studying medicine, but threw it up after seeing the first operation.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她开始学医, 但见习了第一次手术后, 便放弃了学医。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp A career such as that is not one that should be thrown up without serious thought.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这种职业不是那种可以不经慎重考虑就放弃掉的职业。</font><br>匆匆建造(某物)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They threw up a new cabin in a couple of hours.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在几小时之内他们就建起了一座新的小屋。</font><br>产生(人才); 提出(主意)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our country has thrown up a number of great writers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们国家出了许多大作家。</font><br>浪费, 荒废<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You shouldn't throw up a chance like that!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 像那样的机会你真不该错过!</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't throw up your education by leaving now.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别现在就离开, 荒废了你的学业。</font><br>\n

tied	<h3>tied</h3>系,打结,约束<br>\n
tie down	<h3>tie down</h3>捆住, 束缚<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Help me to tie the branch down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 帮我把这根树枝捆住。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She feels her job is tying her down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她感到工作把她束缚住了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He was tied down to his job.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他工作忙得脱不了身。</font><br>\n
tie-dye	<h3>tie-dye</h3>扎染,将衣服打结后再染<br>\n
tie in with	<h3>tie in with</h3>(使)跟…相符; 跟…连接起来<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp His story ties in with the facts.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他的说法符合事实。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Where does this line tie in with the main circuit?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这条线在哪里跟主线路连接在一起呢?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The teacher tied in what he said with the vocabulary in the previous lesson.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 老师把他所讲的同前一课中的词汇联系起来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The illustrations were cleverly tied in with the text.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 插图与本文配合得很巧妙。</font><br>\n
tiepin	<h3>tiepin</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>领带别针<br>\n
tie-pin	<h3>tie-pin</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>领带别针,领结别针<br>\n
tie up	<h3>tie up</h3>(使)停泊<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The freighter tied up at a small harbor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 货船停泊在一个小港口里。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp At that time, our ship was tied up at this harbor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 当时我们的船停靠在这个港口。</font><br>包起来; 系紧<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Shall I tie up your things in a parcel?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我把您的东西包起来, 好吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Hurry up. Tie up your shoelaces; we are late.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 快点, 系上你的鞋带, 我们晚了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The package wasn't tied up securely and came apart while in the mail.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个包裹没有绑紧, 在邮递途中散开了。</font><br>阻碍; 使处于停顿状态<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The strike tied up the factory.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 罢工使那家工厂停工。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Traffic was tied up for three hours because of the parade.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 由于游行, 交通停顿了三小时。</font><br>使无空闲; 完全占用<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This work will tie me up for fortnight.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这项工作将使我忙上两个星期。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He tied up the phone for an hour.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他占用电话一个小时。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He's tied up in conference all day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他一整天都在开会。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Her money is tied up in securities and is not available to her at present.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她的钱用来买了股票, 目前她还不能支用。</font><br>\n
tie-up	<h3>tie-up</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>扎好的东西,停泊的场所,牛棚,停泊处,联系<br>\n
tie up with	<h3>tie up with</h3>把…与…密切联系起来<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our company has tied up with another firm to support the project.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们公司和另一公司联合资助这项工程。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police are trying to tie up his escape from prison with the murder.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警察试图把他的越狱与谋杀案联系起来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The two companies are closely tied up with each other.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这两家公司之间有密切联系。</font><br>\n

turn against	<h3>turn against</h3>(使)转为反对; (使)变成和…敌对<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Those who were once for him have turned against him.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那些原来支持他的人现在倒过来反对他了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Nothing could make me turn against my country.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 什么也不能使我背叛我的祖国。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He tried to turn the children against their mother.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他试图使孩子们反抗他们的母亲。</font><br>\n
turn around	<h3>turn around</h3>(使)转身, (使)转换方向<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The bus had to back up and turn around.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那辆公共汽车不得不先往后退, 然后再掉头。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We've come too far; turn the car around and go back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们已经走了很远, 把车掉过头来往回开吧。</font><br>(使)好转<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Do you think our housing sales will turn around during this year?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你认为今年我们的住宅销路会好转吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They turned the situation around for the better.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们扭转了局面。</font><br>使变得完全不同, 曲解<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He turned my question around so that it sounded foolish.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把我的问题歪曲得听上去愚蠢可笑。</font><br>改变意见<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He seems to have quite turned around.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他似乎完全改变了意见。</font><br>\n
turn away	<h3>turn away</h3>转过脸去<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She turned away in disgust.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她因讨厌而转过脸去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She turned away her face.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把脸转过去。</font><br>拒绝(某人)进入<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He turned away a beggar from his door.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他把乞丐自门口逐走。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Because the hall was full, many people were turned away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 由于大厅已满, 许多人被拒于门外。</font><br>\n
turn back	<h3>turn back</h3>(使)往回走<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We'd better turn back; it's getting dark.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们最好还是往回走吧, 天快黑了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The police turned them back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 警察把他们赶回去了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The wheel of history can never be turned back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 历史的车轮绝不能倒转。</font><br>翻起, 折转<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't turn back the corners of the pages to mark your place.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别折书页的角来标明你读到的地方。</font><br>\n

turn-off	<h3>turn-off</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>岔路,支路<br>\n
turn off	<h3>turn off</h3>(把…)关掉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The tap won't turn off and there is water all over the floor.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 水龙头关不上, 满地都是水。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He turned off the water.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他关上了水龙头。</font><br>转向; 拐弯<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The road to Watts turns off here.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 去瓦茨的路从这里拐弯。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They turned off at the foot of a hill.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们在山脚下拐弯了。</font><br>完成<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I turned off a good piece of work this morning.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今天上午我完成了一件令人满意的工作。</font><br>(使某人)感到厌烦<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Half the crowd turned off when the speaker began talking about pop music.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 讲话人开始谈起流行音乐时, 一半听众兴味索然。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The boy often turns off his mother.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这孩子经常使他母亲烦恼。</font><br>解雇, 辞退<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I have turned off my maid.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我已把女仆辞了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She was turned off by her boss.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她被老板解雇了。</font><br>\n
turn on	<h3>turn on</h3>打开<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This tap is stiff; it won't turn on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个龙头太紧, 拧不开。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please turn the light on for me; it's getting dark.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 天要黑了, 请把灯给我打开。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You should light the gas as soon as it is turned on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一扭开煤气管, 你就应该点燃煤气。</font><br>(使)感兴趣; (使)兴奋<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Some of the students really turned on to these different courses.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一些学生真的很喜欢这些名目繁多的课程。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Many young people are taking drugs to turn on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 许多年轻人吸毒寻求刺激。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What kind of music turns you on?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你特别爱听什么音乐?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'm not turned on by modern pop music.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我对现代流行音乐不感兴趣。</font><br>\n

turn out	<h3>turn out</h3>关灯<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't forget to turn out the light when you leave the classroom.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你离开教室时别忘了关灯。</font><br>制造; 培养<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp How many machines did you turn out last month?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 上个月你们生产了多少台机器?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This university has turned out some first-rate scholars.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这所大学培养了一些第一流的学者。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Many TV sets have been turned out by this factory.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这家工厂生产了许多电视机。</font><br>结果是, 原来是<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He said he was a doctor; but later he turned out to be a cheat.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他自称是个医生, 结果证明他是个骗子。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The day turned out (to be) a fine day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那天倒是好天气。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It turned out that he was never there.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 原来他根本没去过那儿。</font><br>\n
turn over	<h3>turn over</h3>(使)翻转; 调转<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Turn over or your back will get sunburnt.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 翻过身去, 不然你的后背要被阳光灼伤的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Having read Page 1, he turned over to page 2.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他读完第一页后, 就翻到第二页。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp If you turn over a turtle on its back, it will become helpless.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 假如你把海龟翻过来, 它就无能为力了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The soil must be thoroughly turned over before planting.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一定要先把土地深翻一遍再下种。</font><br>仔细考虑<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He turned the new idea over in his mind.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他仔细地考虑了这种新想法。</font><br>移交; 交给<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp To whom should we turn over the key when we leave here?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在离开这里时, 我们把钥匙交给谁呢?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The customs officials turned the man over to the French police.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 海关官员把那个人移交给了法国警察。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Luckily, my watch was turned over to the property office.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 很幸运, 有人把我的表交到了失物招领处。</font><br>\n

wait around	<h3>wait around</h3>在某处等待着<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Where have you been? I've been waiting around here for two hours.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你上哪儿去了?我在这儿等了你两个小时。</font><br>\n
wait in	<h3>wait in</h3>在家里等<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I've been waiting in all day for your television repairman to collect the set, but he didn't come as he promised.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我一整天待在家里等待着你们的电视修理人员来搬电视, 但修理人员失约未来。</font><br>\n

wait on	<h3>wait on</h3>等待; 继续等候<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We waited on for another hour, but still she didn't come.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们又等了一个小时, 但她仍然没来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We wait on your reply to our letter.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们等着你们的回信。</font><br>〈非正〉稍候; 停下来等<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Wait on, will you?I 'm just coming!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请等我一下, 好吗?我马上就来!</font><br>〈非正〉伺候, 服侍<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They all wait on the king.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们都侍奉国王。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Old as he was, he refused to be waited on.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 虽然他上了年纪, 但他不要别人服侍他。</font><br>招待(顾客)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Is there anyone here to wait on us?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这儿有人招待我们吗?</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp We were waited on by a pretty girl in a pink apron.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 招待我们的是一位穿粉红色围裙的漂亮姑娘。</font><br>〈正〉拜访<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Our representatives wait on you in the morning.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们的代表将在上午拜访您。</font><br>随…而产生, 产生于, 是…的结果<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Success waits on hard work.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 成功来自勤奋。</font><br>在餐馆侍候顾客<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The only job he could get was waiting on table, but it was better than nothing.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他唯一可以找到的工作便是在饭馆里当服务生, 不过这总比没工作强。</font><br>\n
wait up	<h3>wait up</h3>熬夜等候<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't wait up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 不要熬夜。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'll be home very late tonight, so don't wait up for me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 今晚我要很晚才回来, 所以不要为我等门了。</font><br>停下来等待别人赶上<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The young man waited up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 年轻人停下来等后面的人赶上去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't go so fast!Wait up for me!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别走得那么快!停下来等我一下!</font><br>\n

waken	<h3>waken</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>醒来; 睡醒<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He wakened at 7 o'clock.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他七点钟醒来。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt.</i></font><br>唤醒; 弄醒<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What time are you going to waken him?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你准备什么时间叫醒他?</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vt. & vi.</i></font><br>(使)觉醒; (使)振奋; 激发<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The book wakened the reader's interest.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这本书唤起读者的兴趣。</font><br>\n
wake up	<h3>wake up</h3>醒来; 唤醒, 弄醒<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I woke up in the night feeling cold.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我夜间醒来感到很冷。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is time for you to wake up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你该醒了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It's time for you to wake up and attend to your business.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 该是你奋发立业的时候了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Please wake me up at six.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 请在六点钟叫醒我。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I was suddenly woken up by the alarm clock at 3 a.m.; I know it was my little brother's practical joke again.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 凌晨三点钟, 我忽然被闹钟惊醒, 我知道这又是我小弟弟的恶作剧。</font><br>引起注意<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The author used three exclamation marks at the end of the last sentence to wake up the readers.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 作者在文章的最后一句连用了三个惊叹号, 以引起读者的注意。</font><br>(使)认识到; (使)觉悟<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I wish she'd wake up!She's so naive!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她实在太幼稚了, 我希望她能醒悟过来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The event may wake him up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这件事可能会使他醒悟。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp People are waking up that he is arrogant.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 人们开始认识到他很傲慢。</font><br>活跃起来; 激起, 引起<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp On holidays the little town wakes up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 每逢假日, 这个小城镇就活跃起来了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He needs someone to wake him up.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他需要有人来使他振作起来。</font><br>\n
wake up to	<h3>wake up to</h3>(使)认识到<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I wish I could wake her up to the danger she is in.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我希望能唤醒她认识到处境的危险。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It is time I woke up to myself.I've wasted too much time fooling around, and I almost ruined my career.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我该清醒认识自己了。我无所事事浪费了太多的时间, 差点毁了我的事业。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She woke up to the problems of growing old.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她意识到了年老所面临的种种问题。</font><br>\n

walk away	<h3>walk away</h3>走开<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp After a while the police walked away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 过了不久警察就走开了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He put his arm round me and walked me away.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他伸出手臂搂着我, 带我走开。</font><br>\n
walk away with	<h3>walk away with</h3>随…走开<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Why didn't you walk away with your father when he left?Y ou didn't have to stay.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你父亲离开时, 你为什么不和他一块儿走呢?你并不是非留下不可。</font><br>偷走; 带走<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Someone has walked away with her umbrella.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 有人把她的雨伞顺手牵羊地拿走了。</font><br>〈口〉轻而易举地赢得(比赛、奖品等)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp With two top players absent, our City Football Team still walked away with the game.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在两名主力队员缺席的情况下, 我们的市足球队仍轻易地获得了这场比赛的胜利。</font><br>\n

walk into	<h3>walk into</h3>走进<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I saw her walking into a shop.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我看见她走进一家店铺。</font><br>未经许可进入<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp While we were out, somebody just walked into the house and stole the jewels!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们出去时, 有人进入房子把珠宝偷走了!</font><br>走动时无意中撞上<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I got this lump on my head by walking into a glass door that I hadn't seen.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我走路时碰在了一扇没看见的玻璃门上, 头上肿起一块。</font><br>由于疏忽而遭到<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It was his own fault; he just walked into the blow.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他是因为不小心才挨了那一击, 是他自己的错。</font><br>〈非正〉轻易地找到工作<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He has just walked into the job without any problem.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他顺利地得到了这份工作。</font><br>〈非正〉大吃大喝<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That boy walked into the meal as if he hadn't seen food for a week.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那个男孩子狼吞虎咽地吃饭, 好像他一个星期没见到食物了。</font><br>〈非正〉痛骂, 申斥<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He walked into us all when we least expected it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们一点儿也没想到他竟把我们大家痛骂了一顿。</font><br>\n
walk off with	<h3>walk off with</h3>偷走; 带走<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The burglars walked off with all my jewelry.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 夜盗偷走了我的全部珠宝。</font><br>〈口〉轻而易举地赢得(比赛、奖品等)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Don't tell me Jim has walked off with the top prize as usual!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不信吉姆又一如往常轻易地赢得了一等奖。</font><br>〈非正〉在(演出)中引人注目<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The new young singer has simply walked off with the show.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这位年轻的新歌手在演出中颇引人注目。</font><br>\n
walk out	<h3>walk out</h3>走出去<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The man who has just walked out is Tom.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 刚才走出去的那个人是汤姆。</font><br>罢工<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The men in that factory walked out yesterday.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那家工厂的工人昨天罢工了。</font><br>退出(会议等)以示抗议<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp At that meeting one of the delegates walked out in protest.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在那次会议上一个代表退席以示抗议。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Representatives of six nations walked out to show their opposition to the vote.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 六个国家的代表退出以示反对投票表决。</font><br>带…出去<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She walked the child out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把孩子带出去了。</font><br>〈军〉在非值勤时间内请假离开营房<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp During the first weeks of basic training recruits are not permitted to walk out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在最初几周的基本训练时间内, 新兵不得请假外出。</font><br>谈恋爱<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp John and Mary are walking out together.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 约翰和玛丽正在谈恋爱。</font><br>\n
walk over	<h3>walk over</h3>穿过<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Walk over and look in the window.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 走过去往窗里瞧。</font><br>走到另一地方<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Let's not take the car, we can easily walk over.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我们不用坐车, 走着去很方便。</font><br>把…带到另一地方<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I'll walk you over to your place, and you shouldn't go alone on such a dark night.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我将把你送到你住的地方, 你不应该在如此漆黑的夜晚单独走。</font><br>无视…的愿望〔感情〕, 轻蔑地对待<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Those parents and teachers walked over young children.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那些父母和教师漠视幼童的愿望。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He would walk over other people to get what he wanted.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他会无视别人的意愿来达到自己的目的。</font><br>轻而易举地胜过<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jones simply walked over Brown at billiards.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在弹子游戏中, 琼斯不费吹灰之力赢了布朗。</font><br>\n

work off	<h3>work off</h3>(使)分离〔分开〕<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The nut has worked off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 螺帽已经脱落了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can't work off the lid of this bottle; can you help me?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我不能把这个瓶盖转下来, 你能帮帮我吗?</font><br>渐渐消除; 逐渐减弱<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp As I got about, the stiffness in my left leg gradually worked off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 由于我四处走动, 左腿僵硬的情况逐渐消失了。</font><br>发泄<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp There is no need to work off your anger on me.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你没有必要冲着我发脾气。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp On that occasion there was no one on whom his temper could be worked off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 在那种情况之下, 没有一个人是他的出气筒。</font><br>抵消, 以干活抵偿<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It took him several years to work off the loan he owed us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他花了好几年的时间才逐渐还清欠我们的债务。</font><br>除去; 处理掉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He tried to work off his surplus fat by doing exercises every day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他每天运动, 想以此去掉一些多余的脂肪。</font><br>售出; 卖掉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp About 100, 000 copies of the book have been worked off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这书已经售出近十万册。</font><br>结束, 完成<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The contract is worked off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 合同已经履行完毕。</font><br>使假冒, 使人对…得到错误印象<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He tried to work off the poem as his own.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他想冒称这首诗是他写的。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They can't work off that tale on us.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们那套鬼话骗不了我们。</font><br>\n
work out	<h3>work out</h3>解决, 解答; 计算出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp This problem will not work out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这个问题解答不了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She worked out the problem with no difficulty.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她毫无困难地解决了这个问题。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The area can easily be worked out if you know the length and the breadth.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 如果你知道长度与宽度, 面积很容易计算出来。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The charge for labor works out at almost ten shillings an hour.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 付给工人的费用算下来每小时差不多十先令。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp I can't work out how to do it.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 我无法解答怎么做它。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Can you work out on the map where we are now?</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你能在地图上找到我们现在所在的位置吗?</font><br>产生结果; 发展<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The plan worked out badly.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 计划进行不顺利。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Everything has worked out according to plan.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 一切都按计划发展。</font><br>锻炼<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp These athletes work out at the gym for two hours every day.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这些运动员每天都要在体育馆锻炼两个小时。</font><br>作出; 制订出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It wasn't too long before we had worked out a plan acceptable to all.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 没多久我们就制订出一个大家都能接受的计划。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The plan has already been worked out, and could be put into operation at a moment's notice.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 计划已经拟好并立即可以付诸实施。</font><br>使筋疲力尽; 耗尽<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He never seems to be worked out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他好像永远不知疲乏似的。</font><br>了解某人的本质<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp You're cunning, and I can't work you out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你这个人太狡猾, 我实在看不透你。</font><br>在外当雇工<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Jimmy worked out when he was only ten.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 吉米在十岁时就离家去当雇工了。</font><br>\n

write down	<h3>write down</h3>写下, 记下<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Hold on the phone for a second.Let me find a pen to write down your phone number.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 别挂电话, 让我找支笔记下你的电话号码。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp What you've said has been written down.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 你所说的一切都被记录下来了。</font><br>视为<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They seem to have written him down as a fool.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们好像把他视为笨蛋了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She wrote him down as negligent.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她把他看成是个粗心大意的人。</font><br>贬低(地位、重要性等)<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Though several critics have tried to write down the play, it is still very popular.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 尽管有几位批评家竭力贬低这出戏, 它仍然很受欢迎。</font><br>\n

write in	<h3>write in</h3>写信反映<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp TV viewers have been writing in to complain of the false advertisement.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 电视观众不断来信抱怨虚假广告。</font><br>将…插写进去<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp He wrote in an additional paragraph at the editor's request.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他应编辑的要求插入了一小段加写的文章。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp Any alterations should be written in neatly to the left side.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 改动部分应书写清晰, 插在正文的左侧。</font><br>\n
write into	<h3>write into</h3>写进<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp That's only someone's personal opinion, and we don't have to write it into the document.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那仅是某人的个人意见, 咱们不必把它写进文件里。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The buyer insisted that a guarantee for compensation must be written into the contract.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 买方坚持要把赔偿保证写进合同里。</font><br>\n
write off	<h3>write off</h3>流利地写下, 迅速写出<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She has written off an account of her trip.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她一口气把旅行见闻写了下来。</font><br>损失掉, 排除<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp It may not be a bad thing that they write off their marriage before it begins.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们断绝了关系未结婚, 这可能并非坏事。</font><br>毁掉; 结束掉<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They wrote the car off.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们将那辆汽车报废了。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The plane was completely written off and the pilot died.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 飞机全毁, 飞行员身亡。</font><br>\n
write out	<h3>write out</h3>写出, 写完<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The boy was kept in school, writing out lines for the teacher.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那男孩放学后被老师留了下来抄写诗行。</font><br>通过剧情安排使(某角色)退出表演<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp They've written me out!The character I was playing dies in the third part!</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 他们安排我下场!我所扮演的角色在该剧的第三集中死了!</font><br>使(自己)竭尽才智无可再写<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The author seems to have written himself out.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 这作家似乎已经江郎才尽, 再也写不出东西来了。</font><br>\n

zigzag	<h3>zigzag</h3><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>adj.</i></font><br>(指线条、小径等)锯齿形的, 之字形的, Z字形的<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The lightning made a zigzag in the sky.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 闪电在天空划出一道Z字形。</font><br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>n.</i></font><br>锯齿形的线条、小径等<br><font color="DarkMagenta"><i>vi.</i></font><br>弯弯曲曲地走路, 曲折地前进<br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp She walked along, zigzagging with her head back.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 她回头看着, 弯弯扭扭地向前走去。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The road zigzagged up the hill.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 那条路曲折地伸到山上。</font><br><i><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp The lightning zigzagged through the church yard.</font></i><br><font color="Navy">&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp 闪电呈之字形划过教堂的院子。</font><br>\n
